loans.name: Yeimi Melissa

texts.es:
Yeimi es una joven estudiante de Administracion de empresas, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Yeimi, tengo 18 años de edad, vivo en Santo Domingo. Naci en San Juan en le pueblo de Vohechio y crecí allá hasta los 12 años, luego me mude a Santo domingo. Tengo una hermana de 17 u un hermano de 14 años.
Actualmente curso mis estudios en Administración de empresas en la Universidad Dominicana O&M, me gustaría ser una gran Administradora, estoy cursando el tercer cuatrimestre de mi carrera, la cual en el futuro me dará los frutos necesarios para mis sustento y el de mis familiares. En mi tiempo libre me gusta leer y compartir con mis familiares, sería un sueño para mi terminar mis estudios y ser una excelente profesional. 
Necesito este préstamo porque tengo una deuda pendiente con la universidad y por esta razón acudo a esta valiosa institución a solicitar el mismo, con la aprobación de este préstamo mi vida cambiaria totalmente ya que puedo estudiar tranquila y saber que no dejare mis estudios a un lado, en el futuro no muy lejano quiero ayudar a mis padres para que tengamos un mejor nivel de vida, por esta razón si no obtengo este préstamo suspendería mi matricula en la universidad.
Mis sueños a largo plazo es ser una profesional de éxito, poder lograr mis objetivos profesionales, alcanzar un buen nivel laboral, tener oportunidades nuevas y competitivas para el mercado laboral y estar a la altura del mismo. Me gustaría trabajar para una empresa de diseño en donde la creatividad juegue un papel importante en la misma, ya que son una chicha muy creativa y proactiva.
texts.en:
Yeimi is a young business administration student who is requesting a loan to cover her educational expenses.  This is her story: My name is Yeimi, and I am 18 years old.  I live in Santo Domingo. I was born in San Juan in the town of Vohechio where I grew up until I was 12.  Later, I moved to Santo Domingo.  I have a 17 year-old sister and a 14 year-old brother.

I am now enrolled in a business administration program at the Universidad Dominicana O & M.  I would like to become a great manager.  I am now in the 3rd quarter of my degree program which, in the future, will give me the means to support myself and my relatives.  In my free time, I enjoy reading and spending time with family.  My dream is to finish my education and become an excellent professional.

I need this loan because I have an existing debt with the university, and so this is why I have come to this valuable institution to request a loan.  With the approval of this loan, my life will change completely, as I will be able to study tranquilly, knowing that I won't have to put my studies aside. In the near future, I want to help my parents so that they can have a better quality of life.  But if I cannot obtain this loan, I will have to suspend my enrollment in the university.

In the long run, my dream is to become a successful professional so that I can achieve my professional goals and advance professionally.  I hope to have new and competitive opportunities in the labor market, and rise to the top.  I would like to work for a design company where creativity plays an important role, because I am a very creative and proactive young woman.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of higher education

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de ganado, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de 2 novillas cargadas para continuar con la crianza y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 54 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has made a living for 15 years raising livestock and selling their products in the surrounding towns. He uses what he makes from his sales to pay some household expenses. 

Jorge is asking for a loan to buy 2 pregnant heifers in order to continue breeding and thus have higher income.

loans.use: to buy two pregnant heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, la joven vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area, has been making a living in the sale of fruit and vegetables for the past 8 years in the municipal market. She has many customers because of her good prices. With what she makes from her sales she aims to achieve success. The young woman lives with her life partner in her own house. She is once again applying for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale to continue with her sales and in this way have better profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Catalina Del Socorro

texts.es: Catalina es una mujer que ha sabido salir adelante junto al apoyo de su compañero. Las ganas de salir adelante resaltan en la expresión de su cara. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de colchonetas hace ocho años, inicio en el negocio ayudándole a un señor a vender las colchonetas que producía pero hace tres años se independizo y logro poner su propio negocio. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para comprar esponja y tela y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta comprar un vehículo y movilizarse para vender las colchonetas. Su meta próxima es comprar unas máquinas que le hacen falta y buscar ayudantes para forrar las colchonetas y de esta manera aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Catalina is a woman who has been able to move forward with the support of her partner. The desire to move ahead can be seen on her face. For the past 8 years, she has made a living making and selling mats. She started in this business by helping a man sell the mats that he made. However, 3 years ago, she became independent and managed to establish her own business.

She is requesting a loan to buy sponge and fabric so that she can increase her sales. Among her future plans, she wants to buy a vehicle in order to travel to sell her mats. Her next goal is to buy some machines that she is missing and to look for helpers who can line the mats. This way, she hopes to increase production.

loans.use: to buy sponge and fabric.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: El carisma de Alejandra la caracteriza en todo momento. Alejandra es una mujer luchadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante es por tal razón que emprendió su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortilla. Este es el tercer préstamo que solicita por el cual se siente muy agradecida, lo necesita para comprar materiales para mejorar su cocina industrial para que pueda funcionar de la mejor manera. Con las ganancias obtenidas con la venta de tortillas podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Alejandra's charism characterizes her every moment.  She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead and for that reason she began her business making and selling tortillas.  This is the third loan that she has requested and thus she is very thankful.  She needs the loan in order to buy materials to improve her industrial stove so that it will function better.  With her earnings from the sale of tortillas she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase materials to improve her industrial stove.

loans.name: Blanca Exa

texts.es:
Blanca, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, a la edad de 22 años se acompañó, hoy en día tiene dos hijos, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y así es que mantienen a su familia.

 
Blanca, tiene negocio de venta de ropa desde hace cinco años, el negocio empezó solo en la comunidad, ahora sale a vender a otros caseríos, camina al menos tres kilómetros de distancia y lo hace tres días a la semana, de esta manera ayuda a su pareja para los gastos del hogar.


Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar 405 bloques, tres quintales de hierro, medio flete de cuartón y seiscientas tejas y pagarle al albañil que hará la construcción en su casa, con ello estarán satisfaciendo su necesidad.   

El sueño de Blanca, es tener una casa en buenas condiciones y preparar a sus dos hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 32 years old and studied through the seventh grade.  She married at the age of 22 and has two children.  Her husband works in agriculture and thus helps maintain the family. 

Blanca has a business selling clothing and has been working in the field for five years.  She began working only in the community, but now she goes out and sells in order locales.  She walks at least three kilometers distance and does that three days a week.  In this way she helps her partner with household expenses. 

Blanca needs a loan in order to purchase 405 blocks, three quintals of iron, 600 tiles and money to pay a brick layer who will do the construction on her house.  With these items her needs will be met. 

Blanca's dream is to have a house in good condition and to prepare her two children through schooling.

loans.use: to purchase items for improving her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bananas, onions, yucca, chicken, rice, oil, flour, etc. for her business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
VÍCTOR DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD DE 9 Y 2 ANOS  LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO, ES ORIGINARIO DE LA ZONA CENTRAL DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLE ME POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR DESDE MUY TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA UBICADO EN UNOS DE LOS MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD, TIENE QUINCE AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL NEGOCIO. EL DEDICA UNA DIES HORAS DIARIAS A SU NEGOCIO PARA PODER OBTENER GANANCIAS DEL MISMO Y DE IGUAL FORMA SATISFACER A  SUS CLIENTES Y MEJORAR SU CLIENTELA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA NUEVA COMO: PANTALONES, SHORES, FALDAS, ROPA DE NIÑO, TOALLAS, ROPA INTERIOR, JANS, CAMISOLAS, CAMISETAS ETC. VÍCTOR AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Victor is 35 years old and married. He has two children, who are 9 and 2 years old; they are in school. He is originally from the center of the region. He is a hard-working, responsible man with a desire to move forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he was unable to study and had to start working at an early age to help cover the costs of household expenses.

As a result of his desire to move ahead, he established a new clothing sale business, which is located in one of the markets in the area. He has 15 years of experience in this business. He works about 10 hours per day so that he can obtain earnings from his business while satisfying his customers and expanding his customer base.

He is requesting a loan to stock his business by buying new clothing including pants, shorts, skirts, clothing for children, towels, underwear, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, etc. Victor gives thanks to Kiva lenders for helping people with limited resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua have decent ways to make a living.

loans.use: to buy new clothing including pants, shorts, skirts, clothing for children, towels, underwear, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 43-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible housewife and lives with her family. Her son owns a small business selling ready-made garments at a shop. He purchases clothes from the market at a low price and sells them at a high price in his community. The ladies in town like his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the weather has started to change and people are demanding seasonal clothes.

She requested a loan so that her son can buy a greater variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Khalida wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's garment shop

loans.name: Leydi Johana

texts.es:
Para Leidy una joven de 27 años de edad, la vida ha sido un poco tediosa, a sus 20 años de edad tuvo su hija y desde entonces se dedicó de lleno a la actividad de venta de mercancía para mantenerla, dado que su hijo no tiene un padre responsable que responda por ella.
Leidy vende mercancía, ropa en su barrio, en pueblo, a familiares a amigos a todo el que pueda vender.
Leidy se encuentra empezando este nuevo año y es por eso que necesita capital de trabajo para iniciar a trabajar e irse todo el año, esperando a seguir vendiendo para generar el sustento para su hija que ya tiene 7 años de edad.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de indumentaria informal para hombre y dama.
Tu apoyo permitirá que esta mujer siga teniendo herramientas para mantener a su hija.
texts.en:
For Leidy, a young woman of 27, life has been a little wearisome. At the age of 20, she had her daughter, and since then she has devoted herself full time to selling merchandise in order to support her, given that her daughter doesn't have a responsible father who is accountable for her.

Leidy sells merchandise, clothing, in her neighborhood and in the town to relatives, friends, and everyone else she can sell to.

Leidy is beginning this new year, and it is for this reason that she needs working capital to begin to work and get started for the whole year, hoping to continue selling in order to generate support for her daughter, who is now 7 years old.

She is applying for a loan to purchase informal clothing for men and women.

Your support will allow this woman to continue having tools to support her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a stock of informal clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 54 years old and married with ten children. With three children in school, Florencia works very hard to provide for them.

Florencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Florencia has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Delia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia Elena de 53 años de edad madre soltera con hijo mayores de edad, los cuales en la actualidad son independiente económicamente, es originaria de Managua lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tiene que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabón, jugos, gaseosas. Verduras, frutas, queso, huevos, crema. Etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. EL objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Silvia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena is a 53 year old single mother of older children who are economically independent. She is originally from the central region of Managua. She is characterized as hardworking, responsible, and eager for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, she was unable to pursue her studies, and instead saw the necessity of work at an early age.

Thanks to her desire to move forward through economic activity, Silvia has a small grocery store where she sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, soap, juice, sodas, vegetables, fruit, cheese, eggs, cream, etc. She devotes to her store about 12 hours daily, offering her products. 

The purpose of her loan is to invest in working capital to supply her store and enable the purchase and sale of food products so that in the near future she can obtain better income. Silvia is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to help them have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to buy and sell products such as soap, juice, soda, vegetables, fruit, cheese, eggs, cream, etc.

loans.name: Iduvina Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Iduvina es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio, su negocio es un comedor donde vende todo tipo de comida todos días de la semana, contando con 5 años de experiencia de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Iduvina tiene su negocio en un lugar estratégico cerca de un parque y allí transitan muchas personas, sus clientes principales son personas que habitan en el municipio y otras que llegan desde otras aldeas cercanas.
Doña Iduvina esta solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne de pollo, de res, chuleta, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, papas, tomates, huevos, etc. Para tener la mercadería suficiente para seguir  elaborando  comida y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, sueña con poder ampliar más su negocio.

Danlí, Honduras – Enero  2015
texts.en:
Iduvina is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her business. She runs a restaurant where she sells all types of food every day of the week.  She has five years of experience.

Iduvina's business is located in a strategic place, close to a park where lots of people pass by.  Her main customers are people who live in the city and others who come from surrounding villages. 

Iduvina is asking for a loan in order to purchase chicken, beef, pork, rice, beans, soft drinks, potatoes, tomatoes, eggs, etc.  This will give her sufficient merchandise to continue making her meals and thus satisfy customer demand.  She dreams of growing her business even more. 

Danlí, Honduras.  January 2015

loans.use: to purchase chicken, beef, pork, rice, beans, soft drinks, potatoes, tomatoes, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isidra

texts.es:
María, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a la situación económica de su familia, no pudo culminar sus estudios, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 22 años de edad los cuales trabajan.

María, es empleada doméstica, desde hace 4 años se dedica a este trabajo; debido a que su situación económica era muy vulnerable, decidió dedicarse a trabajar para poder tener ingresos económicos extras.- Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos y hortalizas como tomate, pepino, rábano, repollo entre otros.- María, no tiene un horario de trabajo fijo, debido a que algunos días entra temprano y otros días más tarde, la distancia que camina es  de un kilómetro para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

El financiamiento del crédito lo utilizará para colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa y poder ofrecer lo básico como frijol, maíz, aceite, azúcar y otros productos necesarios; el crédito le ayudara para poder mejorar su situación económica, debido a que con su tienda podrá tener más ingresos.


María, sueña en un futuro poder surtir más su tienda, con todos los productos necesarios de la canasta básica  y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos. También desea poder ampliar su vivienda para estar más cómodos con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 46 years old, studied until the second year of primary education. Due to the economic situation of her family, she could not finish her studies. She is in a common law relationship, and her partner works in agriculture. She has two children who are 15 and 22 years old, both of whom work. 

Maria is employed as a maid. She has worked in this job for 4 years; due to her very vulnerable economic situation, she decided to make a living working in order to earn extra income. Her husband works in agriculture sowing basic grains and vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, and cabbages among others. Maria does not have a fixed work schedule, since some days she works early and others later. The distance she walks is one kilometer to arrive at her place of work. 

She will use the loan to put a small store in her home and be able to offer basic goods such as beans, corn, oil, sugar and other necessary products; the loan will help her to be able to better her economic situation, because with her store she will have greater earnings. 

Maria's dream for the future is to supply her store more, with all of the necessary and basic products, and in this way to be able to better her earnings. She also desires to be able to expand her home in order to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to put a small store in her home

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilia is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Cecilia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Cecilia has been in this business for 12 years. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Modesta Rosa

texts.es:
MODESTA DE 42 AÑOS  DE EDAD, MADRE SOLTERA CON TRES HIJOS DE BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD DE 14,16,10 ANOS RESPECTIVAMENTE, LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO, ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA CENTRAL DE LA REGION.  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA DE EDAD, PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTULIDAD LUCHA DIA DIA PARA BRINDARLE A SUS HIJOS UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA. YA QUE SUS SUEÑOS VERLOS FORMADOS EN PROFESIONALES.
GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE CARNE DE RES Y VACA EN UN LUGAR ESPECIFICO DE UN MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD,  TIENE 25 AÑOS DE DESEMPEÑAR DICHO NEGOCIO, EL CUAL INCIO POR INICIATIVA PROPIA Y LA NECESIDAD DE TENER UN MEDIO DE SUBSISTENCIA PARA SU HIJOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN SU PRODUCTOS Y COMPRAR VARIEDAD DE CARENES PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. MODESTA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Modesta is 42 years old. She has three children under her care who are 14, 16, and 10 years of age, all of whom are in school. She is originally from Managua, a place located in the central zone of the country. She can be characterized as being hardworking, responsible, with an attitude toward personal improvement. 

Unfortunately she was not able to go to school and had to work from a young age from necessity in order to help with expenses in the home. Now she struggles day to day to provide her children with a better quality of life, as her dream is to see them become professionals. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, as an economic activity she works in the sale of beef and cow in a specific part of a local market. She has spent 25 years in this business, which she started by her own initiative and the need to have a means of subsistence for her children. The aim of the loan is to invest it in her products and buy a variety of meats to satisfy demand from her customers. Modesta appreciates the help that the investors of Kiva provide to people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of respectable work.

loans.use: to buy different types of meat such as: beef, pork, liver, entrails, roast beef, tenderloin, eye of round, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old, married and has a child. She raises hogs and sells them to butchers upon achieving the desired weight. She has been in this business for over three years now. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines to sustain her hogs.

Someday, she hopes to grow her business and save funds for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Esmeralda Bibiana

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 4 De Agosto.
En este lugar vive la señora Esmeralda, tiene 55  años de edad, mantiene  una relación de unión libre, ella tiene tres hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es mecánico automotriz. 
Doña Esmeralda es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su marido  con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja  tres  días por semana en sus recorridos ya que  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también vende en su casa a los  clientes más conocidos, ella  también prepara comida por encargos, hace poco comenzó con esta actividad y le deja muy buenos ingresos. Tiene más de 7  años  que se dedica a sus ventas y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, productos Avon y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son tener un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
In Andrés De Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the 4 de Agosto communal bank meet every two weeks.

This is where Esmeralda lives. She is 55 years old and in a common-law relationship. She has three children who are adults and independent. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Esmeralda is a housewife, who to earn her own income and in this way help her husband with the household expenses, runs a small business. She sells clothing by catalog and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She also sells from her home to her most regular customers.

She works three days a week doing her rounds, as she sells door to door.  She also does catering.  she started this activity some time ago and it generates very good income. She has had her small business for seven years and it is going very well. This loan is to buy clothing, Avon products, and groceries for preparing her food. She has been with the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the benefits that she receives from the institution. Her dream is to have a permanent location for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing, Avon products and groceries

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business of rice farming in the Philippines. Mary Grace has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Comprar un congelador grande para poder depositar alimentos congelados como lo son el pollo es el gran objetivo que se ha trazado la señora Martha para este año 2015, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes y paralelamente una cafetería, pero como quiere iniciar el año de la mejor manera, solicita un apoyo para terminar de juntar el capital necesario para comprar la nevera, pues estos productos atraerán gran público y mejorar sus ventas.
Con tu apoyo puedes ayudar a una empresaria a progresar y terminar de consolidar su negocio, volviéndose una empresa firme y competidora
texts.en: The main goal that Martina has set for 2015 is to buy a big freezer in order to store frozen food, such as chicken. She has a grocery store and also a cafeteria, but since she wants to start the year in the best way possible, she is requesting support to finish raising the funds needed to buy the freezer. These frozen products will attract the general public and improve her sales. With your support, you can help a businesswoman progress and finish establishing her business, becoming a strong and competitive business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer in order to begin selling refrigerated foods such as chicken.

loans.name: Yolanda Elena

texts.es: Ella es Yolanda, mujer de 51 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, vive bajo unión libre con su pareja y juntos trabajan por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar, por su parte Yolanda tiene un taller de confección el cual opera sola, aprendió sus habilidades gracias a que tomo clases y capacitaciones, trabaja 6 días por semana 10 horas cada uno, y aspira que el volumen de trabajo aumente para contratar una persona, y se está anticipando a lo que viene pues solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina fileteadora, la razón es que los contratos que se vienen son grandes y necesita la maquinaria y materia prima como hilos, broches, nylon para tener todas las herramientas disponibles para cuando le llegue el trabajo.
texts.en: Yolanda is 51 years old and the mother of 3 children. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and together they work in order to improve the living conditions of their household. Yolanda has a sewing workshop, which she operates alone. She learned her skills thanks to the classes and training she took. She works 6 days a week for 10 hours each. Yolanda hopes that her workload will increase so she can hire someone and so she is looking ahead to what is coming. She is requesting a loan to buy a surger (overlock sewing machine) because the orders that are coming in are big and she needs machinery and raw materials such as thread, clasps, and nylon in order to have all her tools available for when she receives the work.

loans.use: to buy a surger (overlock sewing machine), thread, clasps, and nylon.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a 30-year-old mother who has two children attending school. She has owned and managed a retail store for almost eight years within the rural community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aspires to further improve the business in order to earn a higher income. She wants to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to request a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of rice, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, snack foods, candies, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. She hopes that she will receive her requested amount to be able to improve the business and support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, snack foods, candies, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anjum

texts.en: Anjum is 38 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a shoe shop in which she sells a variety of shoes. She buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them in her shop. She has been selling gents' shoes only but now she wants to offer ladies shoes as well, according to customers' demand. Her major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount. Anjum requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy crushing ladies shoes as well. Anjum is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to offer ladies shoes in her shoe shop

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, solo estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y juntos tienen 3 hijos.

Rosa, compra tule para la elaboración y comercialización de petates artesanales, ésta actividad la hace desde que vivía con sus padres, para generar ingresos económicas para los gastos de la casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar madera para colocar nuevamente el techo de su vivienda, ya que corre peligro de que se caiga y cause algún daño físico, así como también desea cambiar los pilares que sostienen la casa y reconstruir una pared que también está dañada. 

Ella sueña con tener su casa segura y reconstruir las partes dañadas, para continuar trabajando en su casa en la elaboración de petates, así como también desea que sus hijos estudien y asegurarles de que tendrán un hogar donde no correrán peligro.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old. She has a 2nd grade education and is married. Her partner works in agriculture and they have 3 children together.

Rosa buys "tule" (a type of fabric that comes from a plant) to make and sell handmade bed mats. She has done this activity since she lived with her parents in order to generate income for the household expenses.

She needs this loan to buy wood to put a new roof on her house because it is at risk of falling and causing physical harm. In addition, she wants to change the pillars that sustain the house and rebuild a wall that is also damaged. She dreams of having a safe house and rebuilding the damaged parts so she can continue working in her house making bed mats. She also wants her children to study and wants to ensure that they will have a house where they are not in danger.

loans.use: to buy wood to put a new roof on her house.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con las siembras y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 57 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. He makes a living growing corn and beans, something he has been doing for 10 years. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph. Later he sells his crops in the different stores that are close to his house. 

With the income that he gets from his sales Marcos is able to pay some of his household expenses. He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, etc. in order to continue planting and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She also helps support her sisters. Jane and her family live in a rental with access to both electricity and piped water. Their major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Jane has been selling potatoes, cassava, tomatoes and banana-leaf sweets by the roadside for the last five years. She works seven days a week. The seasonality involved in selling produce is a major challenge for her.

She joined MCDT - SACCO because she wanted to boost her business and pay school fees for her child. She is applying for a loan of 700,000 UGX to buy potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, onions and banana leaves. Her dream is to make more in profits so that she can buy some land.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cassava, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on bread and sauce ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 4 años y una hija mujer de 8 años y su negocio es la venta de chicharrón de pollo.
Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona central, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima templado durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados. 
Margarita es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como ayudante de panadería y con sus hijos; la hija mayor estudia en la escuela y el hijo menor juega todo el día porque aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de chicharrón de pollo; ella realiza la compra de pollo, lo sazona y lo fríe, junto a otros acompañamientos como arroz y papas fritas, labor que realiza de lunes a domingo sin descanso en su puesto de venta fijo. “comencé con ayuda de mi hermana, hace 2 años que trabajo sola y la competencia que tengo es bastante porque la zona es muy comercial…” comenta. Ella sueña con tener un local propio, amplio para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de insumos de cocina como; harina, aceite y pollo, los beneficios que obtenga los utilizará para incrementar su capital de trabajo y agrandar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Margarita solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para la venta de chicharrón de pollo.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 34 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has a 4 year old son and an 8 year old daughter. Her business is selling fried chicken.

She runs her business downtown in an area characterized by trade in all sectors. It houses universities, public offices and private businesses that coexist side by side. It has a temperate climate year round with temperatures that vary during the day between 14-24 degrees Celsius.

Margarita is dark skinned and short with long, black braided hair. She dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and skirt). Her mother tongue is Quechua which she speaks with her family and she speaks spanish because of the general culture and because of the work that she does.

She shares her life with her children and her partner who works as a bakery assistant. The eldest daughter is in school and the youngest son plays all day because he is still not of school age. They live in their own home built from brick with a corrugated roof. It has potable water, electricity and sewage.

Her business is selling fried chicken. She purchases the chicken, seasons and fries it. It comes with other fixings like rice and french fries. She does this work at her market stall, without rest, from Monday to Sunday.

“I started with help from my sister. I have been working alone for 2 years and have a lot of competition because the area is very commercialized” she says. 

She dreams of having her own shop, big so that she can provide more comfort to her customers. Her wish is to expand her business by purchasing kitchen supplies like flour, oil and chicken.

She will utilize the profits obtained to increase her working capital and to expand her business. 

This is the first loan cycle she is making with the institution in the 2 years that she has been doing this work independently. It is for these reasons that Margarita is requesting a loan to buy kitchen supplies for selling fried chicken.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies for the sale of fried chicken.

loans.name: Nolvia Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Nolvia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, venta de ropa y también tiene un molino, ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña Nolvia se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad y zonas aledañas, esta solicita el préstamo para la compra de uniformes escolares y aprovechar esta época escolar que es cuando más se vende este producto, también tiene un molino el cual le ayuda a generar mas ingresos.
 Nolvia sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y suplir las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos para apoyar a su familia. 


Danlí, Honduras - Enero 2015
texts.en:
Nolvia is an enterprising woman and dedicated to business. Her primary source of income comes from her business selling clothes, and she also has a mill located in her house. Nolvia has made a living with this work for the past three years. Her main customers are neighbors in her community and neighboring zones. 

She is asking for the loan to buy school uniforms and take advantage of when school is in session, which is when she sells the most of this product. She also has a mill which helps her to generate more income. 

Nolvia dreams of being able to expand her business and supply her customers' needs, and in that way be able to improve her source of income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms for her business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 47 years old and has six children. Mercedita is married and has two children who are in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercedita has been in this businss for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and groceries.

Lelia has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Lelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and groceries.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Margie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, vende sus productos en los alrededores de donde reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así pueda tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated because she is 20 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has made a living working in agriculture for the last four years. She plants corn and sorghum and sells her products in the areas surrounding where she lives. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of her living expenses. The young woman lives in her own house with her life partner and her son.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and improve the plot of land shown in the photograph to continue her farming, now that it is her only source of income, and in that way she can have a better income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and improve the plot of land

loans.name: Samy Magdiel

texts.es:
La señora Samy es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio que es la venta de golosinas, tiene su negocio ubicado dentro de las instalaciones de un colegio de su comunidad y sus clientes son los alumnos y maestros del centro educativo.
Doña Samy este negocio lo atiende de manera personal hace 3 año, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de plátanos, yuca, queso, harina, churros, refrescos, galletas, jugos, etc. Espera que con la inversión que haga tenga los productos necesarios para satisfacer la demande de sus clientes y que le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Samy uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar su negocio.
 
Danlí, Honduras - Enero 2015
texts.en:
Samy is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to business. Her primary source of income comes from her business, which is selling snacks. She has her business located within the facilities of a high school in her community, and her customers are students and teachers at the education center. 

Samy has personally run this business for the last three years. She is asking for the loan to buy plantains, yucca, cheese, flour, chips, soft drinks, cookies, drinks, etc. She hopes that with the investment she makes, she will have the necessary products to satisfy the demand of her customers and that it will generate the income necessary to help her and her family get ahead.

One of Samy's dreams is to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantains, yucca, cheese, flour, chips, soft drinks, cookies, juices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Esther is in her mid 30s and has two children who both attend school. She has a beauty salon and sells cosmetics. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

This is Esther's fifth loan from Tujijenge. She used her previous loans to purchase products such has handbags and hair products to sell at her shop. Esther plans to use this loan to improve her salon an purchase cosmetics to sell. 

Esther will be sharing this loan with her loan group, Sunguchini, which consists of one other individual. They will keep each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: improve her salon

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling soft drinks and has been in this business for 10 years,  selling to all types of people on a retail and wholesale basis. She generates additional income from renting rooms. 

Sarah has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruits. She works six days a week in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to buy a better fridge to serve her customers better. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy soft drinks

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 24-year-old teacher and hog grower living in Amulung. She raise hogs as an additional source of income. She sells them to butchers.  

Dina wanted to increase her profits by selling healthy and good hogs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and rice bran for hogs sustenance. This will give them enough sustenance to be healthy. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is married and she works hard to support her family.  She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from  a general store. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bakyt

texts.ru: Бакыт, 42  года, женат, 2 детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении 9 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы с 16,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бакыта в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 бычка, 3 лошади, 7 овец. Бакыт обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. На полученные доходы от кредита он планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота, чтобы иметь возможность построить сарай для лошадей.
texts.en: Bakyt is 42 years old, married, and the father of two children.  He has a secondary education and he has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past nine years.  He started his own business with an initial capital of 16,000 som (KGS).  Today, and thanks to his very hard work, Bakyt has two young bulls, three horses and seven sheep on his farm.  He has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 40,000 som to buy one cow.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to increase his livestock headcount and to build a stable for his horses.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 41 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Venara

texts.en:
Venera is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives in Kareli district with her husband and daughter. Venera's husband is a pensioner. Venera and her daughter are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they cultivate family-owned agricultural land and grow potatoes and onions there. Venera is a  very hard working woman and does her best to insure in a good harvest. She sells the harvested products locally. 

Venera has a great desire to start a new husbandry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1000 GEl to purchase a cow. After the cow is purchased, Venera will start producing dairy products.  She already has a shed for the cow in the yard.  The Start Up program will be a great support for her family as it will increase their family income.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wool to make blankets

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en:
Taliko is a 54-year-old woman from Marneuli district. She has 3 daughters and a pensioner husband.  Two of her daughters are involved in private activity jobs and get a fixed salary. Taliko doesn't have her own job and has a great desire to do her bit for the family's welfare. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income or experience to be sufficient to approve the loan.  

Taliko requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit on soft conditions to people, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, and do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Taliko will go to Turkey where is located the worldwide market  and purchase stock of various bed linens to start trading. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase her family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: start a bed linen business

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Ramón de 58 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de ganado y los vende en los pueblos aledaños ya tiene clientes establecidos que lo buscan por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una novilla para seguir con la crianza y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón, who is 58 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has made a living for the last 15 years raising livestock, and he sells them in the neighboring towns. He has established customers who come to him for the good prices. With what he obtains from his sales, he manages to pay some of his living expenses. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a heifer in order to continue raising livestock, and in that way be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años  al cultivo de granos básicos, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y encementando el piso, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra  y así el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 33 years old, has made a living for many years growing basic grains. With the sales he makes, he manages to cover some of the expenses of his household. Jose lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. 

He wants to improve his home, changing the roof and laying cement on the floor, but with what he obtains from his sales, he does not have enough to do it. For that reason, he is asking for a loan to buy metal sheets, beams, cement, sand, and to pay for labor. That way he and his family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: To buy sheets of metal, beams, cement, sand, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jupiter Group

texts.es:
Vanessa es una mujer es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur caracterizada por encontrarse enclavadas en las márgenes del majestuoso curso del agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Vanessa es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo lo usa estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada en la silla, al centro, usa blusa a rayas verticales). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se dedican al comercio, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina, consta de dos habitaciones, baño y cocina, cuentan con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad de contar con material de trabajo constante la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de refrescos, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugos batidos, venta de productos cosméticos, venta de flores y venta de vajillas, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre cubierta con sombrillas y 2 mesas y varias sillas alrededor. Ella cocina platos como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito), pipián (basado en carne de res o en pato), locro carretero (carne deshidrata y yuca), cogote relleno (cuellos de gallina relleno) y rapi (carne, arroz, urucú). “aprendí a cocinar por enseñanza de mi abuela, ella sólo sabe cocinar comida tradicional y es lo que más les gusta a mis clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante. Ella desea realizar la compra de víveres como, harina, aceite, fideo, y otros; para darle mayor variedad de comida y contar con insumos de cocina de forma constante para que su negocio sea el preferido de la zona. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva con esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Vanessa solicita un préstamo para la comprar de víveres como arroz, fideo, aceite y otros para contar con insumos de cocina para ser la cocinera preferida del lugar.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a 24-year-old single woman without children and her business is the sale of traditional food. She is enterprising, independent, happy, good natured, responsible, and hardworking. 

Her work is carried out in the southern zone, which is characterized by being nestled on the banks of a majestic waterway. This area is a traditional weekend outing, complete with rustic buildings made of regional materials where you can taste the traditional food and do some sporting activities. The area has a warm, tropical, and humid climate. Temperatures average between 21-35 °C during the day.

Vanessa is of dark complexion and medium height, with dark eyes and black hair which she wears in a ponytail. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, but she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business that she preforms (she is sitting in the chair, in the middle, and she is wearing a blouse with vertical stripes in the photograph). 

Vanessa lives in the house of her parents, who make a living in trade. They live in a rented house made of brick with a roof made of corrugated iron. It consists of two rooms, a bathroom and kitchen, drinkable water, electricity, and sewage. 

The need for constant work led Vanessa to form a group of people with businesses such as; the sale of soft drinks, coca leaves, juice smoothies, cosmetic products, flowers, and crockery in order to to apply for a loan and expand their businesses. 

Her business is the sale of traditional food. She has a spot outdoors in the street, covered by umbrellas. Two tables and various chairs surround her. She cooks dishes such as; majadito de charque (dried meat, rice, fried plantain), pipián (based in beef or duck), locro carretero (meat dehydrates and cassava), cogote relleno (stuffed chicken necks), and rapi (meat, rice, urucu). 

"I learned to cook from my grandmother. She only knew how to cook traditional food, and that is what my clients like the most," Vanessa commented.

Her dream is to have a restaurant. She hopes to be able to buy foodstuff such as flour, oil, noodles, and more in order to offer a better variety of food and have a constant source of ingredients so that her business will be the favorite of the area. This is the 2nd sequence of loans from this institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this job.

It is for these reasons that Vanessa is asking for a loan in order to buy foodstuff such as rice, noodles, oil, and more in order to have the ingredients to be the favorite cook in the area.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff such as rice, noodles, oil, and more in order to have the ingredients to be the favorite cook in the area.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for three years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: La Reine B Group

texts.fr: le groupe LA REINE B vient de solder son premier prêt avec kiva par anticipation. Bienvenue membre représentatif avait pu acheter le sésame pour sa transformation. Le bénéfice lui a permis d'aider son époux dans la gestion de la famille(santé, soins médicaux,etc). Elle a encore besoin de ce crédit pour continuer son activité. Elle pourrait acheter 4 sacs de sésame à 50 000 francs le sacs, du sucre et les autres ingrédients nécessaire pour la transformation du sésame en caramel. A l'issue des ventes, Bienvenue pourrait épargné une partie ses bénéfices et le reste lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
'La Reine B' Group has just completed its first loan with the Kiva field partner.  Bienvenue is the group representative and she used her loan to buy sesame seeds for her food production business.  Her profits helped her husband provide for the expenses of their family (healthcare, medical care, etc).

She needs this subsequent loan to continue her business.  Bienvenue will use it to buy four sacks of sesame seeds for 50,000 francs CFA a sack, sugar and other ingredients needed to make sesame caramel.  Once she has sold her product, Bienvenue will be able to save some of her profits and use the rest to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of sesame seeds and sugar to make sesame caramel for sale.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: AÏSSATA est une femme peuhle qui évolue dans la commercialisation du lait caillé. Elle est à son 5ème crédit et sollicite ce dernier pour acheter des moutons et chèvres pour les élever et pouvoir traire le lait qu’elle vend journalière ment à ses clients. Elle habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet et détient une ferme. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle soutient son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir des bœufs venant d’Europe pour augmenter sa production et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïssata is a Haalpulaar woman who sells milk curds.  This will be her fifth loan with the field partner.  She runs a farm several kilometres from the field partner's office. 

Aïssata will use her loan to buy sheep and goats for milking, and then sell the milk each day to her customers.  She has been working in this business for more than twenty years, and works from six in the morning until six in the evening.

Aïssata helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family and the schooling fees of their children.  In the future, she would like to buy European cows to increase her production and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise for milking, and to sell the milk.

loans.name: Eriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Eriberto, de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está soltero, la mujer con quien estuvo acompañado en su juventud y con quien tiene 3 hijos, se separaron y ahora solo una hija vive con él, los demás hijos están en el extranjero. 

Eriberto, se dedica al transporte colectivo, transporta personas en su vehículo de un pueblo a otro, ya que en ese lugar no hay buses, tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, por lo que ya tiene conocimiento de su trabajo y también su clientela, el trabajo lo inicio comprando un pick up y el recorrido que hace hoy desde un pueblo a otro, es aproximadamente de 80 kilómetros y su horario de inicio es de las 5:30 a.m. a 5:30 p.m.

El préstamo será invertido para reparar su vehículo, ya que por el momento está sin funcionamiento y esto le está generando pérdidas importantes a su economía. 

El sueño de Eriberto es tener la mejor clientela en su trabajo, además espera que sus hijos sigan sus pasos trabajando honradamente.
texts.en:
Eriberto is 56 years old and single. He studied until 9th grade. Eriberto and he woman whom he was with in his youth and with whom he has 3 children are separated, and now he lives only with his daughter, since his other children are abroad.

Eriberto makes his living in public transport. He transports people in his vehicle from one town to another, since in this region there are no buses. He has been working at this job for 10 years, and he knows his job and his clientele well. He started by buying a pickup and now the route he takes today from one town to another is about 80 km. He works from 5:30 am to 5:30 pm.

The loan will be used to repair his vehicle which for the moment is not working, and this is causing him to loose important business.

Eriberto's dream is to have the best clientele in his line of work. He also hopes that his children follow in his footsteps and work honestly.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is a 28-year-old, Egyptian, married mother of two children of 4 and 8 years old. She has been photographed here in her home with her youngest child.

Luiza’s activity is buying and reselling used items, including clothing, kitchenware, shoes, etc. She is in this with her husband and they own a motorcycle for transportation as they go around in villages and cities to sell. 

During the winter months, sales are better than in the other months, according to their cash analysis flow. During these months, they sell roughly $25 - 50 per day. Since her mother-in-law lives with them, she contributes her little retirement pension of less than $100 per month, including some financial assistance. 

A loan of 50,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) will help Luiza to buy some more used items to resell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing and other items to resell

loans.name: Mulimo Group

texts.fr: Incité par les autres membres de sa famille qui gagnaient bien leur vie dans l'agriculture, Delphin a commencé à cultiver depuis 1979. A la récolte, il paie les frais scolaires de ses enfants et prend en charge les autres besoins sociaux de sa famille quoique durant ces dernières années la production agricole a baissé; cela a comme conséquence la réduction de revenus. Par ailleurs, il compte dans l'avenir construire une habitation décente. Sur la photo, il est au centre et tient dans ses mains un carnet rose
texts.en:
Encouraged by the other members of his family who were making a good living, Delphin began his agriculture business in 1979.  He is standing in the centre of the photograph, holding a pink registration booklet.   At harvest time he makes enough money to pay his children's school fees and provide for the expenses of his family.  Over the past few years his production levels have dropped, also reducing his income.  

However, Delphin will use his loan to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding and harvesting.  In the future, he expects to be able to build a decent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding and harvesting for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 64 years old and has only one child. She has owned and managed a small beauty salon within the public market for almost 28 years. This is her way of helping her husband to gain income to sustain their daily necessities. To provide better service to her customers, she needs to acquire materials needed in her salon. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access an additional PHP 10,000 to buy cosmetics, jewelry, perfumes, lotions and other needed materials. Being a kind and friendly mother, she hopes that she will further improve her business and provide satisfactory services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewelry, perfumes, lotions and other needed materials

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 25-year-old single man from Nablus city. He works as a construction worker in the city where he gets a low and unstable income. He would like to start up as an independent construction worker, but he needs some tools and materials for his work.

Eyad has taken out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some construction tools, cement and stones for his construction work. By taking out this loan, he will be able to start his own business with a better income.

Eyad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy some construction tools, cement and stones for his construction work.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора 34 лет. Она жительница района Дж.Руми. Гулнора молодая мама одиночка. Она разведена с мужем. У нее есть маленький ребенок. Сейчас Гулнора живет с ребенком у папы. Гулнора 5 лет своей жизни посвятила торговой деятельности. Она на рынке района занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви. Ей нравится своя работа, и помогать людям с правильным выбором. Гулнора хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Она планирует увеличить товарооборот, и за счет кредита привезет сезонную одежду и обувь. У Гулноры не достаточно денежных средств для совершения данной операции. Гулнора надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Gulnora is 34 years old.  She lives in the J. Rumy district of Tajikistan.  Gulnora is a young single mother.  She and her husband got a divorce and Gulnora raises her young child.  She lives with her child and her own dad.  Gulnora has devoted five years of her life to retail business.  She sells children's clothes and shoes at the local market in her district.  She likes her work, and she also enjoys helping her customers make the right choice.  She wants to expand her activity and attract more customers.  She is planning to increase her turnover and will use her loan to bring in children's seasonal clothes and shoes.  She doesn't have enough money to make this purchase by herself.  She is relying on your help.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is married and has four children. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a restaurant and has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income by selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use this loan to buy ingredients to use in the meals she will serve, including more bunches of green bananas, onions, Irish and sweet potatoes, beef and fresh beans. She works at the market seven days a week, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, onions, Irish and sweet potatoes, beef and fresh beans

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Gemma is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Roset

texts.en:
Roset is thirty-three years old and single with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Roset operates a butcher shop to get income to sustain her family. She has been in this business for three years and it is her main source of income. 

She dreams of expanding her business but market competition is her main challenge. 

She intends to use this loan to buy goats for slaughtering for meat sales.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughtering for meat sales.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a hardworking man of 36 years living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with one child. He has earned his income from a bookshop supplemented by income from a mobile money business and a produce selling business since 2009. He is challenged by competition for the market affecting his dream of opening up new branches in other towns. Johnson is asking for credit to buy books, pens and files to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, pens and files to sell

loans.name: Gantungo

texts.en:
Gantungo, who is a cattle trader for a source of income, is a married Ugandan man of 31 years old. He used his previous loan to buy cattle to sell and managed to make some profit. He also earns from selling a local brew to supplement his income. 

Gantungo plans in some time to extend his services to several nearby markets. He is hardworking but is challenged by fluctuations in animal prices depending on the seasons. 

He intends to use this credit to buy cattle and local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman of four children who do not attend school because of lack of money for school fees. Nadzua owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are for food for the family. 

She has been operating a poultry selling business for over two years now, selling to the community and passers-by. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more chicks for resale in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for resale

loans.name: Atyrgul

texts.ru: Атыргуль 47 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование у Атыргуль высшее образование, она старший преподаватель в университете. Ежемесячная заработная плата Атыргуль примерно 12,800 сом (KGS). Она оптимистична и трудолюбива. В этом году Атыргуль решила сделать ремонт в ее доме, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 64,000 сом (KGS) на покупку обоев, краски, кафеля и других материалов, необходимых для ремонта дома. Доходы Атыргуль и дальше планирует вкладывать в благоустройство дома.
texts.en: Atyrgul is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She is a college graduate and works as a senior university professor.  She receives a monthly salary of about 12,800 som (KGS).  Artygul is optimistic and hardworking.  This year, she has decided to make some home improvements in her house, and for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 64,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy wallpapers, paints, tiles and other necessary materials to renovate her house.  She is planning to use her earnings toward further home improvements.

loans.use: to buy wallpapers, paints, tiles, etc. to make some improvements in her house.

loans.name: Fassy

texts.en: Fassy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 10 children and 5 of the children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells cold drinks in a kiosk that she rents. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of mineral water, pineapples, oranges, watermelon, and soda. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and buy a van to transport her merchandise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy boxes of mineral water, pineapples, oranges, watermelon, and soda

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Justina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

Justina has been in this business for 41 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Justina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Alen

texts.en:
Alen is 27 years old and being so young and the only breadwinner in his family, he feels a great responsibility to work a lot, earn a lot and provide his mother with the best living conditions. His mother is unemployed now and she is a housewife. Alen graduated from the local State College in the department of Audit and Accountancy.
