After a long time spent looking for a job in his specialty, Alen now works in a different field than his specialty. He works at the court as a judicial regulator. He combines his work with farming, which also brings some income to his family and solves some financial problems. Alen is seriously engaged in poultry and on his farm, he has 60 chickens, which means that he sells a lot of chicken meat and eggs to his loyal customers, and to resellers. Some of it he also sells to the city shops. Alen lives in a cute house in Kapan city in the Syunik region. 

Alen decided with this requested loan to repair the hen-coop for his chickens and buy 20 chickens and fodder for his chickens.

loans.use: to repair the hen-coop for his chickens and to buy 20 chickens and fodder for his chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, manure and mulch for his farm.

loans.name: Maliyka

texts.ru: Малийка, 58 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей, они взрослые и самостоятельные. У Малийки среднее образование. Она уже более 10 лет занимается швейным бизнесом. Цех находится на территории дома, есть 10 швейных машин, у Малийки работают от 4 до 7 человек. В основном шьют женские халаты, готовая продукция экспортируется за границу.  Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 40,000 сом (KGS). Малийка обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для развития ее бизнеса, она планирует приобрести сырье и материалы для увеличения производства. Доходы от кредита Малийка будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и благоустройство ее дома.
texts.en: Maliyka is 58 years old, a widow, and the mother of three adult children who are now independent.  Maliyka has a secondary education and she has been working as a seamstress for more than 10 years already.  Her shop is located on her property.  She has ten sewing machines and employs between four and seven people who mostly sew women's robes and export their final production.  Maliyka makes a monthly income of about 40,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to expand her business, as she is planning to purchase raw materials and fabrics to increase her production.  She will use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to make some home improvements in her house.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Saphorn

texts.en:
Saphorn, 48, lives in a small community in Svay Rieng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland, which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru: Курбоной успешно погасила первый кредит. Она благодарит Вас за помощь, оказанную ей в нужный момент. Сейчас она начала параллельно заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Курбоной имеет земельный участок, где она будет заниматься растениеводством. Она готовиться к посеву нового урожая, и ей надо купить семена картофеля и пшеницы, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. В будущем Курбоной планирует расширить деятельность. Ваша поддержка очень нужна для Курбоной. Она верит, что ее снова не оставят.
texts.en: Qurbonoy successfully repaid her first loan.  She thanks you for your help, which really came at a time when she needed it the most.   She has now also become involved in agriculture.  She has some land and will be working in crop farming.  She is getting ready to sow her land toward the next harvest, and she needs to buy potato and wheat seeds.  For this reason, she has applied for a loan.  In the future, she would like to expand her activity.  Your support is really important to her.  She believes that, once again, she won't be let down.

loans.use: to buy high-quality potato and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика молодая жительница района Спитамен. Малике всего 23 лет. Она живет с родителями. Малика шустрая и умная девушка. Она 2 года назад начала бизнес. Малика продает разную косметику. Ей в этой бизнесе нравится ежедневный доход. Малика хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Она собирается увеличить ассортимент товара. Но для купли товара ей не хватает средств. Малика надеется на получение кредита. Это кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность. У Малики большая мечта, в будущем она хочет открыть себе собственную торговую точку.
texts.en: Malika is a young resident of Spitamen.  She is only 23 years old and she lives with her parents.  She is a nimble and smart girl who started her own business two years ago.  Malika sells cosmetics and she likes the daily income from this business.  She wants to expand her business and attract more customers.  She is planning on increasing her assortment of goods, but in order to do this she needs money.  Malika is hoping to receive a loan that will help her expand her business.  She has a big dream, which is to open her own trading stall in the future.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of cosmetics

loans.name: Zinatjon

texts.ru: Зинатжон 30 лет. Она проживает в районе Б. Гафуров. Зинатжон молодая мама одиночка. Она развелась с мужем и ребенком на руках. Справляться с ребенком Зинатжону тяжело она старается. Она не считает себя матерью одиночкой, ведь у нее есть один прекрасный маленький сын. Зинатжон занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она зарабатывает обеспечить ребенка. Но сейчас момент ее нынешняя машинка хорошо не исполняет свои функции. Зинатжон хочет купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить жизнь ребенка. По этой причине Зинатжон берет кредит. Онаждет Вашу доброту. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Zinatjon is 30 years old and she lives in the B. Gafurov region.  She is a young single mother; she and her husband divorced and she was left with the baby.  It is difficult for Zinatjon to manage with the baby, but she tries.  She doesn't think of herself as a lonely single mother, as she has a wonderful young son.  Zinatjon sews women's clothes and she earns money to take care of her son.  But now her sewing machine does not work very well and she wants to buy a new one so she can earn money and provide for her son.  This is why she has asked for a loan.  Zinatjon is awaiting your kindness.  Support her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Это прекрасная женщина Зулхумор. Ей 41 лет. Она проживает в районе Спитамен вместе мужем и детьми. Она 15 лет своей жизни занимается поваром, и параллельно занимается выращиванием скота. Зулхумор трудолюбивая женщина. Она любить зарабатывать своим честным трудам. Она покупает несколько молодых телят, откармливает их в несколько месяцев, и потом вывозит на продажу. Зулхумор хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Ваша поддержка очень важно для Зулхумор.
texts.en: This wonderful woman is Zulhumor.  She is 41 years old and she lives in the Spitamen region with her husband and children.  She has worked as a baker for 15 years and she also raises animals.  Zulhumor is a hard-working woman.  She enjoys the fruits of her honest work.  She buys a few young calves, fattens them up and puts them up for sale a few months later.  Zulhumor wants to increase her head of livestock and expand her business, which is why she has asked for a loan.  Your support is very important to her.

loans.use: to expand her livestock business and to buy calves.

loans.name: Megrijon

texts.ru: Мехрижон молодая жительница района Спитамен. Она не замужем. Ей 31 лет. Мехрижон живет с мамой и две сестрой. Она талантливая женщина. Мехрижон занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее мама занималась именно этой деятельности. Мехрижон занимается шитьем уже более 2.5 лет. Она берет заказы у себя дома, ей удобно сшить на дому. Доход, который она получает, обеспечивает ее семью. Мехрижон хочет поменять швейную машинку. Она купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы продвигаться дальше и не потерять источник дохода.
texts.en: Megrijon is a young resident of Spitamen.  She is 31 years old, unmarried, and she lives with her mother and two sisters.  Megrijon is a talented seamstress; she sews women's clothes.  She decided to get into this business because her mother was also engaged in this same profession.  Megrijon has already been sewing for more than 2.5 years.  She takes commissions at her home, where is it convenient for her to sew.  She takes care of her family with the income that she receives.  Megrijon wants to change her sewing machine.  She wants to buy a new one so she can work more quickly and not lose this source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica  a la veta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene varios años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi pueda darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman's face is blurred because she is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) from home and has been in business for several years.  She has many customers who are mainly neighbors.

The woman is a single mother and lives in her own house with her son.  The loan she is requesting is to buy ingredients such as pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and other items since this is her only source of income and means of giving her child a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Madelyn Vanessa

texts.es:
Madelyn, de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera, la situación de inseguridad en el país, fue la razón principal por la que sus abuelos, no le permitieron seguir en la universidad, desde siempre ha vivido con sus abuelos, porque sus padres viajaron al extranjero.   

Madelyn, es empleada en una ferretería, tiene tres años de experiencia en ventas, un tío de ella es el dueño de la ferretería, la necesidad que tenía el tío de una vendedora, le dio la oportunidad de aprender acerca de las ventas.- Anteriormente, se dedicaba solo a estudiar; la distancia que viaja en bus hacia su trabajo es de 15 kilómetros diarios y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar aceite, azúcar, frijol entre otros productos necesarios en la cocina, para el negocio que tiene su abuela en la casa, el préstamo servirá para que Madelyn, ayude a su abuela con el negocio.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para sus necesidades y las de sus abuelos y espera ir escalando de puesto en su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Madelyn is 22, single and completed high school.  Because of the insecurity in the country her grandparents did not allow her to continue with university studies. She has always lived with her grandparents because her parents live abroad. 

She is employed, works at a hardware store, and has three years of sales experience. One of her uncle's is the owner of the store and needed a salesperson which gave her the opportunity to learn about sales.  Before she was only a student.  She travels to work 15 kilometers a day by bus and her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

The loan she needs is to buy oil, sugar, beans and other cooking products for the business her grandmother runs at home.  The loan will allow Madelyn to help her grandmother.

Her dream is to continue working to cover her needs and those of her grandparents.  She hopes to continue to advance in her workplace.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, beans and other cooking products for her grandmother's business.

loans.name: Mario  Alberto

texts.es: Mario de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus seis hijos, el se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, vende su productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Mario está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con su cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario, 51, lives in his own house with his six children.  For several years he has been growing corn and millet.  He sells his produce to neighboring villages and has steady customers.  With the sales he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Mario is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc. in order to continue with his crop activity, since this is his only work, and to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: G.s Flor De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Doña Marina es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, cuenta con una pulpería donde vende todo tipo de abarrotería en general, esto lo realiza desde hace 4 años,  se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, que la visitan a diario para adquirir sus productos. 
Doña Marina está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería en general como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, café, leche, huevos, pan, refrescos, harina, etc. para poder surtir su negocio, espera que esta inversión que realice le permita salir adelante en su negocio y obtener los ingresos necesarios para seguir apoyando a su familia, sueña con poder expandir mas su negocio y abastecer de producto a sus clientes, solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas.
Doña María Consuelo se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 8 años.
Don Alexi se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 1 año.
Doña María Lidia se dedica a la venta de embutidos carne de pollo, carne de res, huevos, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años.
Doña Mirna se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y plásticos desde hace 2 años.

Danlí, Honduras – Enero  2015
texts.en:
Marina is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business. She has a store where she sells all types of general groceries. She has done this for 4 years. She gets up very early to serve her customers who visit her every day to acquire her products. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy general groceries such as sugar, rice, beans, coffee, milk, eggs, bread, beverages, flour, etc., to stock her business. She hopes this investment she is doing will allow her to get ahead in her business and obtain the income she needs to keep supporting her family. She dreams of being abel to expand her business more and stock products for her customers. She is asking for the loan in a group form with the following people: 

María Consuelo has sold general groceries for 8 years.  
Alexi has sold general groceries for 1 year. 
María Lidia sells deli meats, chicken, beef, and eggs, an activity she has done for 6 years.  
Mirna has sold used clothing, shoes and plastic items for 2 years.  

Danlí, Honduras – January, 2015

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, coffee, milk, eggs, beverages, flour, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee desde hace 3 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This image is blurry because the woman in it is 28 years old and lives in a risky area. She has had a small store at home for three years. She has many customers due to her good prices and service. She owns a house, where she lives with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy soups, eggs, grains, beverages, candies, sweet bread, etc. This will result in a better income and better living conditions.

loans.use: tobuy soups, eggs, grains, beverages, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, está acompañada, estudió hasta segundo y es madre de tres hijos, todos son mayores de edad, su pareja es jornalero y quedo un poco invalido desde la guerra.
 
María, el negocio que tiene es de engordar cerdos, los compra pequeños y los venden después de cuatro meses; también tiene pollos de engorde, todos los días trabaja 12 horas cuidando sus animales, mientras sus hijos y su compañero de vida trabajan como jornaleros, en un lugar que está a tres cuadras de su casa. 

María, necesita el dinero para comprar 6 cerdos y 100 pollos para engordarlos, también 4 quintales de concentrado para los pollos, con ello estarán aumentando la crianza de animales y por ende tendrán más ingresos.  

El sueño de María, es tener bien preparado un lugar para tener crianza de cerdos y realizar los dos negocios a la vez de venta y engorde de animales.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, has a second grade education.  She and her partner have three adult children.  Her partner is a day laborer and has been somewhat disabled since the war.

Maria raises pigs for a living.  She buys piglets and sells them after four months.  She also raises chickens and works 12 hours a day caring for her animals.  Her children and husband work as day laborers on a farm three blocks from home.

Maria needs money to buy six pigs and 100 chickens.  She also needs to buy four quintals of concentrated chicken feed.  This will allow her to increase her business and earn more income.

Maria's dream is to have a better place to raise the pigs and be able to conduct both sales businesses at the same time.

loans.use: To buy six pigs and 100 chickens to raise, as well as four quintals of concentrated chicken feed.

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María, de 75 años de edad, no estudió, estuvo casada pero la relación no duro, es madre soltera de tres hijos, todos viven fuera del país, por lo que ella vive sola en casa. 

María, se dedica al comercio de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja donde compra 50 pollos cada dos meses, desde pequeños los cuida, hasta las que tienen seis semanas y luego los mata y los prepara para ir a venderlos; ya tiene su propia clientela, por lo que ya no le es difícil la venta, tiene más de 10 años de realizar esta actividad, 

María, aprendió este negocio por medio de su hermana, quien también realiza la misma actividad, la distancia que recorre es de un kilómetro y las ventas las realiza tres veces a la semana y su horario de trabajo es de las 5:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 a.m. cuando termina de repartirlos.

El préstamo servirá para comprar concentrado para pollos, de acuerdo a su tamaño y semanas, así es la cantidad que se les compra.-

María, espera seguir trabajando con su granja, para mantenerse ocupada y para dejarles una buena herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 75, could not study. She was married, but not for long. She is a single mother of three children; all of them live abroad, so she lives by herself. María sells chickens. She has a small farm and buys fifty chickens every two months. She raises them until they are six weeks old and then slaughters them and prepares them to be sold. She has her own customer base now, so it is easy for her to sell her chickens. She has been doing this for more than ten years.

It was her sister who taught her what she knows about this business, since she also raises chickens. She has to walk one kilometer and makes the sales three times a week. She works from 05:00 am until 11:00 am, when she finishes delivering the orders.

She will use this loan to buy feed for her chickens. The quantity depends on their size and age. María hopes to be able to continue working in her farm in order to keep herself busy and be able to leave her children a good legacy.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es: Juan de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo, cuando su cosa ya esta lista la almacena en graneros como los que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, Juan está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 50, has worked in agriculture for 30 years growing corn, beans and millet.  He stores his produce in graineries to be sold later in different markets near his home.  He lives with his wife and four children in his own house.

Juan is requesting a new loan to buy more seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, etc. to continue his work and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has had a small store located in her residence for 4 years. She sells a variety of products such as candies, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar etc. She has a lot of customers because of the good prices. She lives in her own house with her family group. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, because this is her only source of income and this way she can have better profits for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc.

loans.name: G.s Triunfando Juntos Group

texts.es:
La señora Nohelia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de ropa usada mixta, tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante y también lo atiende en su casa de habitación, sus clientes  principales son personas que viven en su zona y fuera de su comunidad.
Doña Nohelia esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisas, calcetines, ropa de cama, etc. también trabaja vendiendo productos por catálogo de avon, que le genera otros ingresos, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia y que su negocio sea más prospero.
Doña Nohelia está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal y al igual que sus compañeros de grupo están contentos de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Irma se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 2 años.
Don Juán  se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 4 años.
 
Danlí, Honduras – Enero  2015
texts.en:
Nohelia is an enterprising woman and dedicated to her business, which is selling varied clothing. She has had her business for 3 years. She does this business as a street vendor and she also runs it from her house. Her main customers are people who live in the area and outside of her community. 

Nohelia is asking for a loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts, bed clothes, etc. she also works selling Avon products via catalog, which generates more income. She hopes this investment will allow her to get ahead with her family and that her business will be more prosperous. 

Nohelia is asking for the loan in a group form and just like the other members, she is happy to work with Prisma.
Irma has sold clothes and shoes for 2 years. 
Juán has sold general groceries for 4 years. 
 
Danlí, Honduras – January, 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, socks, bed clothes, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Santos Clarixsa

texts.es:
Santos, de 37 años de edad, termino su carrera universitaria en el año 2005, obteniendo su título de profesorado en educación básica, se creció  junto a sus cuatro hermanos, se casó  cuando tenía 30 años de edad y su esposo actualmente reside en Estados Unidos, porque tuvo que emigrar hace un tiempo debido a la falta de oportunidades en el país. 

Santos, trabajo en la alcaldía en el año 2006. Hoy en día trabaja como profesora por turnos en el centro escolar de su comunidad, trabaja impartiendo clases a los niños de segundo grado de educación básica.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, mochila, zapatos y uniformes para su hijo, ella además, invertirá $400 para hacer una división de lámina en el lugar donde imparte las clases, para que los niños a quienes atiende puedan estar en mejores condiciones.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para poder seguir generando ingresos y poder mejorar su vivienda y seguir ayudando a su hijo para que pueda terminar sus estudios y que sea una persona de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Santos, 37, received her university degree in 2005. She is a primary school teacher. She grew up together with her four siblings and got married when she was 30. Her husband migrated to the United States in search of better opportunities. Santos worked for the City Hall in 2006. She works now in shifts, as a teacher for the local community school. She teaches second grade.

She needs this loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, a backpack, shoes and uniforms for her son. She will also use 400 USD to build a division in the classroom, in order to improve the studying conditions for her students.

Her dream is to continue working in order to receive an income, make some home improvements, and support her son so that he can finish his studies and becomes a person of good character.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her son and build a division in the classroom where she teaches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for his stall to resell.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eulalio es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es dueño de un taller mecánico, tiene su propio local en el cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. 
Comenta que ha ido creciendo poco a poco y que por medio de su esfuerzo está mejorando. Su meta es esforzarse cada día más e invertir en su local para poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar herramientas para su negocio, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo, cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eulalio is from the city of Curuguaty and is the owner of a auto repair shop.  He has his own garage where he works every from the early hours of the morning. He says that it has grown little by little and, through his efforts, is improving. His goal is to work harder every day and invest in his garage so that it can continue growing.

He asks for this loan to purchase tools for his business and in this way to be able to continue with his work, meeting his customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, etc. to build a large sink, a bathroom, and repair the cooking area of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rings, earrings, bracelets, chains, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Douglas Antonio de 47  de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa,  se dedica desde hace 25  años al negocio de venta de cuadros artísticos o pinturas primitivas, el dibuja pinturas como, paisajes, animales, construcciones, etc. sus clientes son personas del extranjero, amistades, entre otras personas que aprecian el arte de la pintura.
Don Douglas Antonio vive en un municipio de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, el es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Douglas Antonio solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como, estuches de oleo bastidores, pinceles y lona, materiales que son los materiales para elaborar sus pinturas, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y que le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Enero del  2015.
texts.en:
Douglas Antonio, 47 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked for 25 years at his business selling works of art or folk paintings. He makes paintings such as landscapes, animals, buildings, etc. His customers are people from abroad, friends, and other people who appreciate paintings.  

Douglas Antonio lives in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desire to get ahead and fight each day to improve his quality of life.

Douglas Antonio is asking for the loan to purchase raw materials such as cases of oil paints, stretcher frames, brushes, and canvas, materials that are the materials to make his paintings. He hopes that this investment will allow him to get ahead with his business and that it will generate the income necessary to get ahead with his family.

His dream is to grow with his business to improve his quality of life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - January 2015.

loans.use: to purchase cases of oil paints, stretcher frames, brushes, and canvas for his business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a 22-year-old single man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a motorcycle transport business and at the same time sells charcoal, which boosts his income. In his business, he is faced with the challenges of weather changes and road accidents that put his business at a risk. However, he is working very hard to make sure he survives and hopes to buy a car to start a taxi business. Sam has asked for a loan to service and repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Daniel Alberto

texts.es:
Daniel, de 29 años de edad, es Ingeniero Agrónomo, se creció con sus padres, está casado y únicamente su esposa depende económicamente de él porque aún no tienen hijos.

Daniel, trabaja con hortalizas desde los 14 años de edad, su padre le enseño a cultivar pepino, chile, ejote entre otras hortalizas y ahora Daniel, da trabajo a 5 jóvenes para que le ayuden, pues las vende a una cooperativa.- Además, tiene cuatro clientes en la ciudad, a quienes les vende la producción.

El crédito lo necesita para crédito para el mejoramiento de la estructura de los invernaderos en donde tiene sus hortalizas, ya que son artesanales y necesitan mantenimiento para poder tener una buena producción.

Su sueño es tener 1 invernadero techado, donde pueda cultivar sus hortalizas como tomate, pepino y ejotes.- 
Anteriormente, tenía una estructura de madera y un viento fuerte que hubo en la época lluviosa, le destruyo por completo el que tenía.
texts.en:
Daniel, 29 years old, is an agricultural engineer. He grew up with his parents, is married, and only has his wife who depends on him economically because they don't have children yet. 

Daniel has worked with vegetables since he was 14 years old. His father taught him how to grow cucumber, chile, and green beans, among other vegetables and now Daniel provides work for 5 young people who help him, and he sells to a cooperative. In addition, he has four customers in the city, to whom he sells his products. 

He needs the loan to make repairs to the greenhouse structures where he has his vegetables, since they are handcrafted and need maintenance to be able to have a good production.

His dream is to have one covered greenhouse where he can grow his vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, and green beans. Before, he had a wooden structure and a strong wind during the rainy season completely destroyed the one he had.

loans.use: to make improvements to the greenhouse structures where he has his vegetables.

loans.name: Mary Niquel

texts.es: Doña Mary es una emprendedora agropecuaria. Vive junto a sus padres, quienes le han enseñado el oficio de la producción agropecuaria. Se ha dedicado desde hace 4 años a la cría de cerdos. Tiene actualmente 20 cerdos y desea incrementar la producción. Al incrementar la alimentación de los animales considera que podrá venderlos en menos tiempo y generar ganancias en tiempo oportuno. Por ello desea un préstamo de $2,000 que le permita comprar 76 quintales de alimento de engorde para los cerdos. Para ella tener el acceso al financiamiento es un reto, pues le permite probar su experiencia y capacidad como productora, ampliar su horizonte, plantearse nuevas metas y alcanzarlas con el apoyo del financiamiento que se le brinde. Ya ha tenido tres préstamos con la Empresa Comunal, y en todos ha salido a tiempo en su compromiso de pago. Su meta, como mujer soltera, es el buscar salir adelante, sosteniéndose por medio de la inversión productiva. Piensa en hacer crecer su negocio comprando a futuro más cerdos e invirtiendo en otras actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en: Mary is an enterprising woman working in farming and livestock. She lives with her parents who have taught her the farming and livestock business. She has worked for 4 years raising pigs. Currently, she has 20 pigs and wants to increase production. By increasing the feeding of the animals, she thinks she will be able to sell them in less time and to generate income at the right time. Therefore, she wants a loan of $2,000 that will allow her to buy 76 hundredweights of fattening feed for pigs. For her getting a loan is a challenge because it lets her prove her experience and ability as a producer, broaden her horizons, set new goals and reach them with the support of the offered loan. She has already had three loans with the "Empresa Comunal", and she has met all her payments on time. Her goal, as a single woman, is to move ahead, supporting herself through her productive investment. She plans to grow her business by buying more pigs in the future, and by investing in other farming and livestock activities.

loans.use: to buy 76 hundredweights of feed for pigs.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza City. His father works as an employee in the public sector. Abdallah wants to help his family and find another source of income. He opened a small cafe, where he makes cocktails, ice cream and soft drinks. It is a very good business and the store location is in the city center.

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a refrigerator and raw materials for his cafe. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to improve his business and his family's living conditions.

Abdallah appears in the photo in front of his cafe.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and raw materials for his cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt for resale.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are at school. She has been running a grocery store for four years now. She works from 4:00pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Janeth's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to paint the structure, buy chairs, and increase the amount of grocery drinks for sale. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, household expenses and for loan dues. 

She will use this loan to buy a TV for entertaining customers and to buy more drinks for resale. She dreams of buying a freezer.  

Janeth will make sure she pays back her loans on time according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy a TV for entertaining customers and to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Ranohon

texts.en:
Ranohon is a businesswoman. She was born in 1965, and she lives in a rural area. She is married and has four children. She is an active, honest, kind and brave person. 

Ranohon was one of participants of CSC MDO IMON International's training. She was nominated to get a certificate and she got it. 

She wants to open and develop her trading business. She is planning to help her family raise their standard of living. Her dream is to be helpful to her family and to raise her family’s standard of living. She is requesting financial support to improve her standard of living. She wants to open a grocery store. She needs to buy goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 63-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has four dependents. 

Carolina earns a living through rice farming. She has supported her husband in improving their rice farming business. This is the source of their income for more than 40 years now. 

Carolina is asking to take a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. A loan will her to improve the productivity of her farm, thus increasing the harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a 62-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown children. She is from Ormoc City, Philippines. 

Bernardita is a rice farmer and has been in the rice farming business for more than 40 years now. This is the source of her income. Bernardita has helped her husband in tilling their farm. 

Bernardita is requesting a loan to buy more seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm, thus improving the harvest and yield. In the future, Bernardita hopes of making her farming business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of 100,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Dotiela

texts.en:
Dotiela is 50 years old and married with four children. With one child is still in school, Dotiela works very hard to provide for them.

Dotiela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell at her store, like coffee, shampoo, noodles, milk, etc.

Dotiela has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell at her store, like coffee, shampoo, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Nyawa

texts.en:
Nyawa is a married man. He has two children who attend school. Nyawa owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

Nyawa has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door, where passersby and town dwellers are his potential customers. He faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season, when it becomes difficult to operate his business. 

With the 100,000 KES loan, he wants to add to his savings to purchase a new motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Reinalda

texts.es:
La Sra. Reinalda tiene una despensa y carnicería, donde atiende todos los días de la semana, junto con su marido ambos se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante, e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de su humilde trabajo.
Ella comenta que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y por ello es que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar insumos varios para la venta, como ser carne, productos variados, verduras, frutas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Reinalda's grocery shop doubles as a butcher's shop.  She serves customers every day of the week, together with her husband. Both spare no effort to improve their lot in life through hard but humble work.
Reinalda says that the shop had been growing steadily, which is why she asks for a loan in order to buy food items to sell: meat, various products, vegetables, fruit, etc. The aim is to keep sales going. She is grateful for the opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a range of products as well as pinatas and plastics to increase her sales and improve the family economy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and hire help to make the new bedroom she built more secure and more comfortable.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en:
Nasimjon is a young and hardworking man. He is married and has a little child. He is a very caring father to his child. 

Three years ago, Nasimjon began his own business because he needed to provide financial support. Nasimjon has been busy with buying and selling shoes in a local market. He is very hardworking man and tries to offer high quality shoes for customers. He wants to increase the assortment of goods for the new season, but he does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy shoes for the new season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season.

loans.name: Inobatkhon

texts.en:
Inobatkhon is an ambitious woman. She was born in 1970. Inobatkhon is widowed and has two children. She is the main provider for her children. 

Inobatkhon works hard to earn a living. She lives with her children in a village, so she has been busy with an agriculture business. She feeds cattle and sells them in a local market. Inobatkhon feeds cattle at her house, where she has a cowshed. She manages the business alone. 

Inobatkhon is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.en:
Fazliddin is a hardworking man. He is married and has a child. He lives with his family in South Tajikistan.

Fazliddin has been busy with his service business for more than 5 years. He is a master house repairer. He works hard and tries to offer high quality. Since he began this business, the living conditions of the family has become better.

He is going to buy doors to finish repairing the house of his client, which he began 1 month ago. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy doors. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy doors

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is a 65-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is a farmer and has been in the rice farming business for more than 30 years now. 

Concordia is requesting a loan to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. She also wants to buy piglets for her hog raising business. Concordia believes that a loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm. In the future, Concordia hopes of making her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm and to buy piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Santos Andres

texts.es:
El señor Santos Andrés de 50  años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10  a su taller de carpintería donde elabora puertas, mezas, cómodas, chineros, gaveteros, espejos de lujo, camas, etc. 
Don Santos Andrés vive al sur de Honduras, el es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar una sierra eléctrica nueva con motor y todo incluido,  con este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo,  Honduras – Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Santos Andrés, age 50, lives with his children in his own house.  He has had a carpentry shop for ten years.  He makes doors, tables, dressers, china cabinets, bureaus, decorative mirrors, and beds, etc.

Santo Andrés lives in southern Honduras.  He is an enterprising man with the desire to improve his quality of life.

He is requesting the loan to buy a new, motorized electric saw with everything included.  With this loan he plans to improve his earnings and his quality of life.  He is a client who wishes to continue working with Prisma.  His dream is to grow in his business in order to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – January, 2015

loans.use: to buy an electric saw for his business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of an eight-year-old child. She is from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Elsa has been in the business for more than two-and-a-half years. 

Elsa would like to obtain a loan to buy more goods to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among other items. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Elsa hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte.

She owns a small sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Elvie has been in the business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Elvie is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among others. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Elvie hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among others

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 58-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte.

She has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years now. Esterlita works with her husband on their farm. This is the source of their business.

Esterlita is asking to take a loan to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help them improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl, 31, is a married woman and a mother of three children, ages eight, seven and five. She is engaged in retail sales of dry goods, like clothing, towels, sunglasses, belts, children’s toys and other things.  

Cheryl is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for resale, such as towels, belts, clothing, sunglasses, and children’s toys, among other items. A loan will help her improve her inventories, thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Cheryl hopes of making her business more successful and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for resale, such as towels, belts, clothing, sunglasses, and children’s toys, among other items.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 27 years old and lives in Lahore with her husband and three children. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using salon instruments for many years, wearing out the instruments, which need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to do so.
 
Due to her husband's low purchasing power, Razia requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and easily buy new instruments, such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair.

Razia hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some savings for household expenses. Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy instruments for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 50 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from driving for hire.

She runs a general store to sell food and household items. She started this business 1 year ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Hang intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that he is requesting, he wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Beatrice has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. 

Beatrice's husband manages their small farm, making $100 per year. Even though his small income keeps the family living in poverty, he still claims the position of breadwinner in the household, as is the case in most households in Kenya. Financial support far outweighs any other care or support for the family, leaving women disadvantaged to make decisions within the household, and forces them to fully depend on their husbands to buy everything, from laundry soap to the food they eat. 

With the little time Beatrice has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Beatrice is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. 

While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Beatrice access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Beatrice’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Marianna

texts.en:
Marianna is 28 years old and she lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. She is married. Marianna’s husband works at the Kapan combine. They have a son who is two years old. 

Marianna has obtained higher education and graduated from Yerevan State Linguistic University. She has a specialty of pedagogue and particularly she is a specialist in English Language and Literature. Still she is not able to work, since her child, being so small, needs great care. Instead, she has several pupils, who come to her house to attend paid private courses in English Language to prepare for entrance examinations.

Marianna is asking for a loan of 400,000 AMD in order to buy professional literature, and she must also buy table and chairs for the room where she teaches her courses, so as to make it more comfortable for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy professional literature and a table and chairs for the room where she teaches her courses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy instruments for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Gran Riqueza Group

texts.es: Violeta tiene 45 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos educando. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda hace 08 años. Ella inicio su negocio de manera ambulatoria. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su bodega a un restaurant. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes bebidas productos lácteos golosinas. Ella participa en el nuevo grupo “GRAN RIQUEZA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Violeta es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Violeta, age 45, is single and is raising two children.  She established her store at her house eight years ago.  She started her business in an itinerant manner.  Her biggest wish is to expand her store into a restaurant.

She will use the loan to buy more groceries, drinks, dairy products, and candy.  She is a member of the new group Gran Riqueza.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was provided.  Violeta is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, drinks, dairy products, and candy.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is in his mid-30s, single, and has two children who are attending school. For the past 10 years, Andrew has been selling food at his food stand. He works from 8 AM to midnight daily and makes a stable monthly profit. This is Andrew's 15th loan from Tujijenge. His past loans were used to buy supplies for his food stand. He successfully paid back his previous loans and used the profits to purchase a new roof. Andrew plans to use this loan to further improve his food stand. He plans to use the profits to pay for his household expenses. Andrew's dream is to one day own his own home.

loans.use: to improve his food stand business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She also runs a tricycle transport business with her husband. 

Elsie is asking to take a loan to buy more goods for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and also to buy gasoline for the tricycle. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Elsie dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and also to buy gasoline for the tricycle.

loans.name: Fredie

texts.en: Fredie is a 42-year-old married man and a father of two children. Fredie lives with his family in Ormoc City, Leyte. Fredie earns an income through his farming business. This has been the source of his income for more than four years now. Fredie is asking to take a loan to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help Fredie improve his farming business. In the future, Fredie wants to expand his farm in order to generate more revenue. He also wants to save money for the educational fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Zaida María

texts.es: Doña Zaida es una mujer emprendedora que de pequeña realizó junto a su familia diferentes actividades agropecuarias y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos a través del trabajo agrícola. Hoy, sus hijos han formado nuevas familias , mientras ella, junto a su esposo, siguen invirtiendo en la actividad agropecuaria para sostenerse y apoyar en la educación de sus nietos. Además de criar ganado para ceba desde hace 10 años, cría también cabras para aprovechar su leche y pollos de engorde. Su intención es aumentar el número de terneros que tiene para incrementar los ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Cuentan con la tierra necesaria para el pastoreo, pero tienen dificultades para adquirir préstamos en la banca privada por ser personas humildes. Ya ha realizado cuatro préstamos con la Empresa Comunal de San Andrés, lo cual le ha ayudado a aprender a administrar un préstamo y le ha dado la confianza de que puede salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Zaida's an enterprising woman who learned various farming jobs from her family at a young age, and she has gotten her children ahead with agricultural labor.  Her children have their own families now, while she and her husband continue to invest in farming to support themselves and help with their grandchildren's education.  In addition to raising livestock for fattening for 10 years, she also raises goats, to make the most of their milk, and fattening chickens.

Zaida's goal is to increase the number of calves she has to increase her income and improve her quality of life.  They have the necessary land for grazing but are having problems acquiring loans from a private bank because they're humble people.  She has already had four loans with Empresa Communal de San Andrés, which has helped her learn to manage a loan and given her the confidence that she can get ahead with her own effort.

loans.use: to buy 10 calves to raise

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 30 años de edad, estudió segundo grado en su comunidad, se ha dedicado a los trabajos de la agricultura y a trabajado como ayudante de albañil con su padre, trabajo durante dos años en una empresa de construcción, donde conoció a su esposa, con quien ahora tiene un niño de 9 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en la jarcia (elaboración de hamacas artesanales) y con esto ayuda económicamente al hogar, ademas de hacer los oficios del hogar.

Julio, se dedica a elaborar hamacas de hilo de seda, desde hace 11 años su esposa le enseño el arte, se decidió a este rubro, debido a la demanda que hay en la zona y que también es rentable.- Su esposa trabaja tejiendo hamacas y cuentan con cinco tejedores.- El material lo compran en la comunidad y las venden en las comunidades del departamento y en otras dos ciudades venden las hamacas en las plazas, los día de comercio.

Julio, necesita el crédito para comprar 100 libras de material para tejer, guarda cabos y cortinas para las hamacas, con ello pretende aumentar su volumen de producción y obtener mayores ingresos económicos. El resto del dinero lo necesita para la compra de uniforme, útiles escolares, zapatos y otros para que su hijo pueda ir a la escuela.

Julio, sueña con seguir trabajando en las artesanías, darle el estudio a su hijo y también mejorar su vivienda, pues es de barro el piso es de tierra.
texts.en:
Julio is 30 years old and went to school until the second grade in his village. He was a farmer and also helped his father, a bricklayer. He worked for two years in the employ of a construction company, where he met his wife. They now have a nine-year-old son. His wife is a traditional weaver who makes hammocks, thus contributing to household expenses. She also takes care of the household.
Julio also weaves hammocks out of silken strands. He started eleven years ago and learned the trade from his spouse. He decided to become a weaver because there is a lot of demand for their product in the area and it is thus a profitable business. They both weave hammocks and work with five other weavers. They buy the materials they need in their village and sell the finished product in other villages in the area. On market day in the neighbouring two towns, they sell their wares in the square.
Julio needs the loan to buy a hundred pounds of materials he needs to weave hammocks and make thimbles and curtains for said hammocks. His goal is to increase production and earn a higher income. He will use the rest of the loan to buy a uniform, school supplies, shoes, and other items his son needs to attend school.
Julio dreams of continuing to work in artisan handicrafts, of providing his son with an education, and also of improving his home, which, at the moment, is made of mud and has a dirt floor.

loans.use: to buy supplies to weave hammocks, thimbles, and hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's vegetable shop.

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en: Rehema is in her mid 60s, single, and has three children, one of whom is still in school. She has been selling fish for two years. She works from 9 AM to 10 PM daily and is able to earn a stable monthly profit. This is Rehema's 9th loan with Tujijenge. The previous loans were used to help restock her fish supply for resale. She has successfully paid back her previous loans and used the profits to help renovate her home. She will use this loan to purchase more fish to sell. Rehema dreams to one day buy her own home. Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, Orange, which consists of seven people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Navigator Group

texts.en: Fabiani is in his early 50s, single, and has four children who are all in school. For the past eight years, Fabiani has been selling baobab seeds and he has been able to earn a stable monthly income. This will be his second loan from Tujijenge. His first loan was used to purchase baobab trees and he successfully paid back his loan, using the profits to renovate his home and provide food for his family. Fabiani will use this loan to purchase more baobab trees so that he can sell more seeds and increase his business. He dreams of building up his home. Fabiani will share this loan with his loan group, Navigator, which consists of one other individual. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase baobab trees to harvest and sell the seeds

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста 47 летняя жительница района Вахш. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей. Две дочери и два сына. Муж занимается земледелием. Гулдаста трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она занимается животноводством. У нее имеется коровник, где она позаботится о животных. Она 6 лет своей жизни продвигается этой видом деятельностью. Гулдаста свободное время занимается земледелием, она помогает мужу в работе. Она обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. Она намерена на заемные средства приобрести скотов и сохранить бизнес.
texts.en: Guldasta is a 47-year-old resident of the Vakhsh district. She is married and has four children: two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a farmer. Guldasta is a hardworking and responsible woman. She raises livestock and has a barn where she takes care of the animals. She has been in this business for six years. Guldasta also plants crops in her free time and helps her husband with his work. She applied for a loan because she has only a few animals remaining and wants to save her business by raising her livestock numbers. She intends to use the loan to purchase cattle and save her business.

loans.use: to increase her number of livestock and save her business

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Don Javier es un emprendedor que ha dedicado toda su vida a la producción agrícola y ganadera. Con ella ha sostenido a su esposa y dos hijos. Ha decidido ampliar su actividad agrícola, centrada en las hortalizas, para diversificar su producción con la siembra de chayotes (güisquil o cocoro). Conoce de esta planta, pues la ha cultivado en su juventud en la finca de su padre. Hoy quiere cultivar chayotes en su propia finca. Esto le permitirá ampliar también su mercado. Para ello necesita comprar diferentes insumos (semilla, abono, medicina entre otros) por un monto de $2,100. Con esto generará otros ingresos que usará para invertir en su actividad productiva, para la educación de sus dos hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Javier's an entrepreneur who has earned a living in agriculture and ranching his entire life, and supported his wife and two children with it.

He has decided to expand his agricultural work, which is focused on vegetables, and diversify his crops by planting chayote ("güisquil" or "cocoro").  He's familiar with this plant because he grew it on his parents' farm when he was young.  Now he wants to grow chayote on his own farm, which will allow him to expand his market as well.

For that Javier needs to buy various inputs (including seeds, soil amendments, and medicine) for $2,100.  This will generate additional income that he'll use to invest in his crop, in his children's education, and in improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inputs for planting one hectare of chayote

loans.name: Zayton

texts.en:
Zayton sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 32,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from expanding her variety store, Zayton hopes to have a longer life and wants for her children to become successful in the future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 49, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons and her husband who earns a living by driving for hire. Loan has been running a general store to sell food, soft drinks and household items to her customers. She stared this business 11 years ago. 

Loan would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of instant food and soft drinks to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy food, soft drinks and household items for selling from her store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works for a local company. Ly runs a general store, selling food, soft drinks and household items for people in her community.

She started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of products such as candies, cakes, instant noodles and soft drinks for selling to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy candies, cakes, instant noodles and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 52, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family.

Hue and her husband earn money through their business of selling vegetables and running a general store. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of vegetables and fruits to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for selling from her store.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, 33 years old, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from driving for hire. She has run a food stall to sell snails and shells. She started this business one year ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Oanh intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy many kinds of soft drinks and good quality foods to sell from her food stall. The additional capital  will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of soft drinks and good quality foods to sell from her food stall

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 44 years old and is married. She has a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She is running a food stall selling breakfast to people in her community. Her husband supports the family by working in a local factory.

She intends to use her loan to buy rice and ingredients to make food to sell.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy rice and ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet would like to take a further loan to buy drinking water tanks to sell from her shop. Tuyet's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. 

She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy drinking water to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Ernesto Isaias

texts.es:
Ernesto, de 24 años de edad, es bachiller, está casado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija que vive en casa.

Ernesto, trabaja con ganado de repasto, solo tiene un año de trabajar con ganado y lo aprendio de un primo y decidio hacerlo, para buscar un ingreso económico extra para su familia.- La distancia que camina para llegar hasta donde están sus animales es de 3 cuadras de su casa.

Ernesto, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, le ayudará mucho porque podra tener más ganado y le generará más ganancia.

Sus sueños son, poder trabajar muy fuerte para poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia y el préstamo le ayudara mucho para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 24 years old. He is a Secondary school graduate and is married. His wife works doing domestic work and he has a daughter who lives in his house.

Ernesto works with cattle. He has only been doing this for one year. He learned from a cousin and decided to do it looking for extra economic income for his family. The distance he walks to get to his cattle from his house is 3 blocks.

Ernesto needs a loan to buy more cattle. This will help him greatly as having more cattle will generate more profit. His dream is to work very hard to be able to provide a better future for his family and the loan will help him a lot in achieving his goals.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija que vive en casa y esta estudiando y tambien vive un hijastro que trabaja.

José, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por más de cinco años y lo aprendió de su suegro y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso económico extra para su familia.- La distancia que camina para llegas hasta donde está su ganado es de 1 kilómetro de su casa, le apoya su compañera de vida.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, le mejorara mucho porque podra tener más ganado y esto le traera más ganancias y por lo tanto mejorará su calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando, para poder darles un mejor futuro a su familia y el préstamo le ayudará a lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old and studied up to Grade 3 in Primary school. He is married and his wife works doing domestic work. He has a daughter who with in the house and studies and he has a step-son who works.

José works with cattle. He has done this for more than 5 years. He learned it from his father-in-law and decided to do it to to find an extra income for the family. The distance that he walks to get to where the cattle are is one km from his house. His life companion helps him.

José needs a loan to buy cattle. This will help him a lot as he will be able to have more cattle which will bring him more income and improve his quality of living. His dream is to be able to continue working and be able to provide a better future for his family and the loan will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat is 56 years old and lives in Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She had been married since 1982, and she has one son and three daughters. They are all married.

Sinat has been a weaver for 20 years, while her husband has been in the same work for 20 years. She would like to apply for a loan to build a kitchen and buy silk. Nowadays, she doesn't have a kitchen, and she wants to get a new house. She said that she is going to pay back all of the money.

loans.use: to build the kitchen and buy silk.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 38-yea-old, married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte. Glenda has been in the farming business for more than three years now. She also earns additional income through her sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. These are the sources of her income. 

Glenda is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and others. This loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Glenda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and pay workers to build a room in his mother's house, which will give him privacy and space.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 45, is divorced and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Mai has been running a general store, selling food, soft drinks, and household items, in front of her house for 13 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more, different products such as shampoo, detergent, sugar, milk to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products such as shampoo, detergent, sugar, and milk for selling

loans.name: Leonidas Del Rosario

texts.es: Leonidas con el ánimo de apoyar a su esposo en su taller de Ornamentaciones, está dedicada a la administración de ésta empresa familiar, en la que su labor se ve reflejada en la mejora de los niveles de producción y ventas del negocio.  Su cónyuge quién es el encargado de la producción de rejas en hierro y aluminio, protectores para ventanas, divisiones de baño y puertas, es quien diseña, corta, arma y da los acabados para la entrega final del producto. El horario de atención está comprendido entre las 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días, en los que se dedican a la elaboración de rejas y también en realizar la parte comercial del negocio que es ofrecida mediante el catálogo de productos de su autoría, de este modo los interesados pueden apreciar la estética y calidad de los productos. Leonidas está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de insumos necesarios para la producción como hierro, aluminio, acrílicos y pintura.  Esta inversión pretende mejorar los tiempos de entrega y con ello la rotación de cartera.  Leonidas y su cónyuge desean continuar trabajando para a futuro ampliar su negocio y tener una mayor capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Leonidas with the goal of helping her husband with his decorative metal workshop is dedicated to administering this family business. Her work is reflected in the majority of levels of production and the sales of the business.

Her husband is in charge of the production of aluminum and steel grilles, protection for windows, bathroom dividers and doors. He designs, cuts, places together and finished the final product to be delivered. Their timetable is from 7 am until 4 pm every day. Making grilles and to carry out the commercial part of the business his products are offered by catalog. That way the customers can appreciate the the esthetics and quality of his products.

Leonidas is applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of supplies needed for production like steel, aluminum, acrylics and paint. This investment will hopefully reduce the time it takes to deliver the orders and their turn-over time.
