Leonidas and her husband wish to continue to work in the future to expand the business to have a greater production capacity.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for production like steel aluminum, acrylics and paint.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 46, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a porter. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business seven years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food, beverages, and other items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
Loc is 39 years old and is married with a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Her husband is a driver for hire. Loc has been running a beauty salon to earn a living. She started this business six years ago. Now she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality hair care products and repair her shop to attract more customers and meet their needs. She hopes that this will enable her increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: To buy hair care products and repair her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Dang

texts.en:
Dang, 40, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local factory.

Dang has been running a business of repairing old clothes for four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more fabric and sewing materials to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for her business of repairing old clothes

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen, 64, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a food stall selling rice soup for people in her community. 

She started this business 30 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food, rice, and spices to make better quality meals to satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, raw food, and spices to make rice soup for selling.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is 30 years old and has two children. She has been running a shop selling clothes and infant supplies for six years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Tuyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying clothing and products for infants. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes and infant supplies to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung, 55, is widowed and has three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Dung supports her family by selling milk and tea. Dung started this business four years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of tea and milk to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy tea and milk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: a loan helps Rehana buy a buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she is a new member of BRAC and is taking her first loan. She is receiving a loan for her husband; he drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years over petrol which is very costly nowadays. Due to an increase in the cost of petrol, he wants to convert his auto rickshaw over to LPG gas but his rickshaw does not have a CNG kit.

Therefore, Khalida contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan amount to give to her husband. He will buy a CNG kit for his rickshaw so that he can minimize the fuel expense and can grow his income.

Khalida seems very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Khalida's husband purchase a CNG kit for his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Maria Dalla

texts.en: Maria Dalla is a rice retailer from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. Maria Dalla is has been in the rice retail business for more than 10 years now, This is the source of her income. Maria Dalla is asking to take a loan to buy more rice to sell . A loan will help her improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Maria Dalla hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Yen, 39, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanical worker. She earns an income processing metal hinges. 

She started this business five years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of metal materials to process into hinges.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy metal to produce door hinges for sale.

loans.name: Huu

texts.en:
Huu is 46 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. She is running a food stall to sell prepared food such as fried eggs, pork  and meats.

She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of food such as eggs, meat and spices to make meals to sell.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy eggs, meat and spices to make food for sale.

loans.name: Gerasim

texts.en:
Gerasim lives with his parents in Getahovit village. He and his father are construction workers and his mother takes care of the household. 
They receive different orders from people living in nearby communities. The family's only source of income is construction, so Gerasim and his father work  hard. 

Gerasim requested a loan, which he will use to purchase a stone grinding tool needed for construction works. This tool will ease their work a lot.
He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a stone grinding tool

loans.name: Gila

texts.en: Gila is a farmer from Leyte, Philippines. She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. Gila has been in the rice farming business with her husband for more than nine years now. This is the source of her income. Gila is requesting to take a loan to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. A loan will help them improve the productivity of their farm, as well as their harvest and yield. In the future, Gila hopes to expand their farming business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy, 37, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy started a food stall selling pork and noodles ten years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food to to sell at her stall and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pork and noodles to make food for selling at her food stall.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is from Kapan town where he lives his wife, mother and two school age children. 

Garik has been involved in construction work for ten years. He renovates houses and apartments of people living in Kapan town as well as in nearby villages. Garik, as the main breadwinner of the family, has to work hard to sustain his family's living.
 
Garik has applied for this loan to purchase a concrete mixer and other tools needed for construction work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a concrete mixer and other tools needed for construction work.

loans.name: Noshaba

texts.en: Noshaba is a 49-year-old married woman. She has three children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required so Noshaba has applied for a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. He was able to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. Noshaba is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen, age 30, is a married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled vehicle. He has earned a living as a driver for many years as a way to meet family expenses, but his vehicle now requires maintenance to stay in proper condition. For this reason, Yasmeen is requesting a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband so that he can provide better service by buying new tires and a new auto body for his rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a new auto body for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 53 years of age. She is a married lady. Her great skill in hand embroidery and experience of many years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her three children. For the improvement of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities. It will help her in meeting the orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and her children's school fees. 

For the past two years, Nyamvula has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Nyamvula dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of KES 20,000, Nyamvula will purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new furniture for his law office.

loans.name: Marjorie Joyce

texts.en:
Marjorie Joyce is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to buy merchandise items like shoes and ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers. Her earnings helped to send her child to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for several boxes of shoes and ready-to-wear clothes which her customers have ordered in advance. Filipinos are more practical in their buying habits; they go to dealers for convenience and economics. Her income from her store is a stable source with which to sustain her family's basic needs and support the education of her only child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their every day needs and the schooling of her child. 

Marjorie Joyce dreams of having her own boutique to attract more customers. She aims to give her child the best education to allow her better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise items, orders of shoes and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa, 51, is a merchant from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store in her place. Ma. Luisa sells various goods ranging from foodstuffs to detergents and other household needs. This has been her source of income for more than nine years now. Ma. Luisa is asking to take a loan to buy more inventory to sell like rice, canned  goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, detergents, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will be a great help for Ma. Luisa because it will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Ma. Luisa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more inventory like rice, canned  goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, detergents, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tools and a grinder for mason work.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 40, is a married woman with six children. She has been involved in a tailoring business for about nine years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Shehnaz earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she has availed Kashf (Kiva's partner) for a murabaha loan (a non-interest-bearing loan) of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to meet increasing demand and generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan, 51, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children, a son and a daughter. Thuan earns money through her business  providing Internet services. Thuan is sometimes unable to provide the volume of services required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy larger game cards and more computer equipment to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy game cards and computers for her Internet shop

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue, 47, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Hue and her husband earn money through their business selling beverages and coffee. She started this activity 20 years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy more beverages and coffee to sell during traditional holidays. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and coffee for selling at her store.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 25 years old, married, and has three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than two years now. She also earns an additional income through her rice retail business. 

Melchora is asking to take a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs and rice to sell. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising and rice retail ventures. 

Melchora’s future dreams include the expansion of her business and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a 62-year-old married woman living in Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog raising business. However, she also earns income with her sari-sari, or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her community. 

Ponciana is requesting a loan in order to buy groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries, as well as more animal feed for her hogs. 

A loan will help Ponciana improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries, as well as more animal feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Aloha

texts.en: Aloha is a 43-year-old farmer from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has three children. Aloha has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband also works as a farmer. She is requesting to take a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik, her husband and two children live in Kapan town. Sofik's husband is employed in private sector, but his salary alone is not enough for covering the family's growing needs. 
That's the reason Sofik started her own business two years ago. She sells cosmetics from her house. Due to her hard work, Sofik was able to attract a number of devoted clients, who prefer to purchase cosmetics only from Sofik. 
To be able to cover current orders of her customers, Sofik has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase cosmetics and skin care supplies with the help of this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics and skin care supplies for covering her customers' orders

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet, 56, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Thiet and her husband earn money through their business selling pork and noodles. She started this business six years ago. 

Thiet would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of pork, noodles and spices to make better soup for selling and meeting her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members have a better future.

loans.use: To buy pork and noodles to make food for selling.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai is 47 years old and married, with two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Ten years ago, Tai started a food stall, selling noodles. Now, she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality raw food, such as noodles, meat, and vegetables, to make food to sell from her stall. 

Tai hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, meat, and vegetables, to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh would like to take out another loan to buy food and beverages to restock his general store. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock his store

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 46-year-old married woman. She has seven children. One of her sons, shown in the photo, has been running a business selling chicken and goat meat to the people of his locality. He is very motivated to provide his family with good food and clothing. For the improvement of her son’s business, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more animals along with cutters and knives. She dreams of improving their standard of living through her son’s business.

loans.use: to purchase animals and knives for meat business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena, age 62, is a widow. She raises and sells livestock with the support of her son, who is also shown in the photo. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Zareena needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more livestock to expand her business and income.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala is a married mother of two children. Her husband is also shown in the photo. He started a rickshaw business some time ago. He earns a good amount of income and needs some financial help to pay for the repair and maintenance costs of the vehicle. Therefore, Ghazala has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled vehicle. He has earned a living as a driver for many years as a way to meet family expenses, but his vehicle now requires maintenance to stay in proper condition. For this reason, Amina is requesting a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband, so that he can provide better service by buying new tires and a new auto body for his rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a new auto body for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Michal

texts.en:
Michal is 25 years old. Single, he lives in Mundri, South Sudan. He has been running a small business for the past year. 

Michal is requesting a loan of 1,500 SSP to expand the business. He is selling like soap, as well as tomato paste and palm oil for cooking, in his shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods including new beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana, age 41, is a married mother of six children. One of her sons is shown in the photo. He provides painting services in his locality, and earns sufficient income to meet the family's expenses. For the improvement of her son’s business, Rukhsana has sought a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes to cater to the maximum customers to increase income.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes to cater to the maximum customers to increase income.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
As a mother of three children, the great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals is what fills Stella with enthusiasm and inspiration. Stella is 47 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, she aspires to offer all of her children a university education. Stella learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to her parents. She has a tiny plot of land to live off – just under half an acre – and has always struggled to support her family. 

For over five years, her income source has been from selling milk and poultry. She supplements the meager income by doing other business. Stella passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family, and she wants her cows to produce more milk. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy animal feed. With this animal feed, her cows will be able to increase milk production, which will translate to increased income. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will generate more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
It is common to have a goat farm in Kenya, but starting your own business is something else entirely. Joy is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Chuka, a remote village in Kenya. She is a mother of 1 lovely child and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 6 years. 

To earn a decent living, Joy sells eggs, milk, and greens, and she engages in numerous small personal businesses, including transportation. Only recently, she started seeing how she could make more money through goat farming. 

In the past, Joy saw raising goats as just a hobby. She wants to sell goat meat and skin but assumes that the quantity she produces will not make economic sense. She needs to purchase more goats. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand her business. 

Joy is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva's lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, in order to purchase goats of a good quality breed. 

Future proceeds from the commercialization of Joy's goat farm are already committed to pay for her child’s education. In the long run, she is confident that her efforts will translate into a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy goats of a good quality breed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installment costs for this semester.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit, her husband and their two children live in Kapan town, Syuniq region. For two years, Margarit has been involved in retail business. She trades in clothing. Her husband is an police officer working at local police station. Margarit started her retail business to help her husband with the family's daily growing expenses. She has number of local clients who order clothing from her every month. 

To be able to purchase new spring season stock of clothing for selling to customers, Margarit has applied for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new spring season stock of clothing for selling to customers

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van would like to take a further loan to buy materials to make plastic coatings and to laminate objects. 

Van's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make plastic coatings and laminate objects.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a latrine and a drain that leaks, and more in the winter.  She needs to do this work before the rainy season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a pretty brunette, radiant with beauty and youth, and with a strong sense for working on her own. To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Nkubu area of Kenya. 

Rose, a mother of two, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past seven years. Her primary source of income has been both selling eggs, maize, and milk, as well as some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. 

Rose, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser, and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. 

Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, Rose is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Rose is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy customer demand. With her loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy demand. 

Through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo, Rose attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang, 57, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a daughter and her husband. Lang and her husband earn money through their business making and selling soup and noodles. She started this business 28 years ago. 

Lang would like to get a loan to buy noodles, meat and spices to make better food to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members' living conditions improve.

loans.use: To buy noodles, meat and spices to make food for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children, but she also takes care of additional family members. 

Faridah sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO in order to buy bags of charcoal. She works 7 days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonal demand and transportation. 

Faridah aspires to buy a plot of land. Currently she rents a house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include utilities and the cost of feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Meet Faith from Nkubu, Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married, and together with her husband is blessed with four lovely children.

For the past 29 years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from selling milk, a motorcycle business, eggs, and maize has allowed her to earn a decent income. Faith passionately loves dairy farming, and animals on her farm have been given names such as “Kairu” (Black). Milking and feeding Kairu (the name of her cow) makes her very proud.

By selling milk, she has had good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she receives orders from customers and then sends her customers a text message when the milk is ready for collection. Demand has been overwhelming, and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand.

She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow and also animal feeds. Faith does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow; she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich, creamy milk. The dairy cow will produce between 15-20 liters of milk a day and the animal feed will help the cow to produce even more and more milk. The increased milk production will translate into more income, and Faith will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children going to school.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and access more training on better farming methods.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir lives in the town of Kapan with his young wife and one-year-old son, Armen. 

Vladimir has been involved in retail business for eight years. He trades in spare parts of damaged cars. 

He has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to help him with purchasing a damaged car for selling its spare parts. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase damaged car in order to sell its spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to puchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pay for local laborers to expand their gardens

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 50-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tea as his main source of income, a business he started with a hope of earning income.

He is faced with challenges like unpredictable weather changes that hinder the progress of his business. Aside from that, he has hopes of expanding his projects to a bigger area. He has asked for a loan to hire a tea plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to hire a tea plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
Tatul lives with his aunt in Kapan town. His parents live and work in the Russian Federation, and time by time support Tatul financially. 

Tatul himself works as a barman and is also involved in construction work.

He has now applied for this loan to purchase tools and equipment needed for construction work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment needed for construction work

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine lives in Kapan town and works at a local secondary school as a teacher. Besides her work in the school, she also provides individual classes from her house.

Qristine likes her work and her students. She has applied for this loan to purchase a laptop needed for providing individual Russian language courses to her students. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for laptop needed for providing individual Russian language courses to her students

loans.name: Emmmuel

texts.en:
Emmmuel is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lui in the east part of Mundri in the south Sudan region. 

He buys and sells palm oil. 

A loan of 600 SSP will help him expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Majory

texts.en:
Majury is a 45 year old hardworking and determined wife and mother. Majury was once a member of the Rutendo group. She is currently in her 4th loan cycle with Thrive, which she has applied for as an individual. Majury’s major business has been cross border trading. She has been a cross-border for the past 12 years. Marjory approached Thrive so as to grow her business which was becoming stagnant due to lack of working capital. Her main challenge was raising enough working capital to complement her hard work. 

Majury is grateful for the training and financial assistance she received from Thrive. Her business has generated profits which have not only made her business grow; they have also gone a long way in improving her family’s quality of life. Hardworking Majury, even though faced by a spinal illness and operation, did not let her business crumble. Majury and her family were faced with crippling medical bills, however she did not let that deter her. After her operation made it hard for her to travel, Majury has since diversified into operating a groceries stall which is thriving. Her future plans are to open a supermarket and venture into the furniture business.

loans.use: To expand her groceries business.

loans.name: Tichaedza Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Crowborough Phase 3 suburb of Harare, Keresia found herself in financial difficulties as her husband had passed away. She is a mother of one daughter doing her tertiary education at a local college so she has to pay school fees for herself and her daughter. 

Keresia speaks of her challenges in accessing loans before she knew about Thrive Microfinance.  With her other three colleagues, they formed a group called ‘Tichaedza’ meaning ‘we shall continue trying’. Working as a group, they got training on business management and savings with the help of Thrive Microfinance. They worked as a team and managed to get their initial loan amounting US$1850 which they repaid on time.

She has managed to sail through even in the harsh economic condition that has prevailed for the past 10 years, selling kapenta (small dried fish), soyamince and mopaneworms (small dried worms..) in bulk at Mbare Retail Market in Harare. She is looking forward to seeing her daughter complete her studies and to finish building her house. With the loan amounting $650 from Kiva, she is looking forward to increase her stock to the level which will enable her to sell stock worth $880 weekly, giving her a weekly profit averaged $300.

loans.use: To increase the range of foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Rabishe

texts.en:
Rabishe is a mother of 5 children between the ages of 11 and 17 years old.

Although her husband works as a guard for a private company, Rabishe earns a living working with her husband in the small restaurant that they have, making kebabs. Their little place is very popular and well known to many, and they have a large amount of customers and good success.

Now she is requesting a loan in order to make some small renovations and to purchase a deep frying machine for the French fries and any other fried foods. Without the loan, she will not be able to complete the renovations and make her purchase, which she is confident will improve her business and increase her income.

She is grateful for the opportunity from the lenders and hopes that in the future she will have an exclusive restaurant and much success.

loans.use: to make some small renovations and to purchase a deep frying machine for the French fries and any other fried foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Servete

texts.en:
Servete is 41 years old and a housewife, staying home to take care of the children and the needs of her family. Her husband works very hard in construction and also sells wood to others for heating. He works hard to provide for his family and give them a better life. 

In the past, Servete owned a cow. She would use the milk for her family and also sell milk and other dairy products for money. For the first time, Servete is asking for a loan in order to purchase a cow again in order to sell the milk and other dairy products. 

She is very happy for the opportunity to begin her small farm again, and she is very positive and optimistic that she will have success and be able to eventually expand her farm. She is would like to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow again to sell the milk and other dairy products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 27 years old and has one child. She is a small-scale dairy farmer based in Chuka, Kenya, which she has been doing for six years. Her primary income source is milk. She loves this business because in comparison to other livestock farming, dairying can provide a higher income per animal and monthly paychecks. 

Lucy requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a dairy cow. Expanding her farm will enable her to produce more milk and utilize the available pasture. With this loan, Lucy hopes to generate enough income not only to repay the loan, but also to afford her highest monthly expenses that are farming-related.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 36-year-old, married woman and a mother of  five children, from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than a year now. She is also engaged in a food-vending business, selling home-cooked, snack foods to the people in her place. This is her source of income. 

Rosita is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients, like flour, sugar, butter, margarine, cooking oil, and others items. She also wants to buy additional animal feed for the piglets. 

A loan will help Rosita to improve her hog-raising business as well as her food-vending business. In the future, Rosita hopes of making her businesses more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, like flour, sugar, butter, margarine, cooking oil, and other items as well as feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm tools, fertilizers, good quality seeds and attain more training in good agronomic practices

loans.name: Shaam

texts.en:
Shaam is 50 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. He operates a retail business known as Baitali Trading. His shop is located at a busy intersection in New Nickerie. He sells food items and a lottery type called suribet. 

Shaam requested a loan, which he will use to expand his stock.

loans.use: to purchase goods and items for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds and fertilizers to increase their farm harvests

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and pay for local labors to prepare their gardens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds, pay for local laborers to expand their gardens and attain more farming training

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicks and feed for poultry farming.

loans.name: Durim

texts.en: Durim is 23 years old and single. Although he is living with his parents, he works very hard in order to support his family and is the main source of income for them. He works during the day for a private auto mechanic. After work and on days off, he works in his own auto mechanic shop he started with a friend. They hope that in the future they will be able to expand their business and eventually even sell used cars. He loves his business and being an auto mechanic, and he is really happy for the opportunity. He is now requesting a loan to purchase tools for his shop, which will allow him to work more effectively and efficiently. He is very grateful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his shop, which will allow him to work more effectively and efficiently

loans.name: Movses

texts.en:
Movses is married and has three adult children. He lives in Kapan, Syunik region. Movses is a constructor with 13 years of experience. He receives orders from people living in Kapan town and in nearby communities to renovate apartments.
 
Movses requested a loan, which he will use to purchase tools and equipments needed for construction work and to fix his car. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to fix his car and purchase tools and equipments needed for construction work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement to make tiles.

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin is a taxi driver living with his wife in Kapan town. Garegin drives a taxi in Kapan, Qajaran, Meghri and Goris towns and in nearby communities. His wife works in a local beauty salon as a cosmetologist.
 
Garegin has applied for this loan to be able to renovate the car that he drives as a taxi. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is from Tkhilnari. Nodar operates an agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly income from his agricultural business. Nodar has a plot of land where mandarin and vegetables are grown. He sells harvested products at the local open market. The average monthly income of the family is 200 GEL. It is hardly enough for food for a five-member family. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Nodar requested a loan from Credo to start a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With this loan, Nodar plans to buy a cultivator and start working on a private orders. Especially during the season he will be able to generate significant income and the family members will get the chance to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cultivator

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel se llama este grupo formado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, el cual se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, por medio de la venta de prendas que hace de manera ambulante, tiene todo de tipo de prendas siempre, y es por ello que tiene muy buena clientela siempre. Su meta es poder tener su propio local de ventas y así poder ir mejorando cada día, y tener mejores ingresos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser remeras, pantalones, jeans y otros varios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group is called San Miguel and was formed in the city of Caaguazú. It is part of the poverty elimination program which allows them to get to know each others situation and so improve their lives.
One of the members is Luisa who is improving her poverty situation by selling clothing items as a street vendor. She always has different types of clothes to sell and that is why she has a good clientele. Her aim is to be able to have her own premises in which to sell and therefore improve every day and earn a better income.
She is asking for this loan to buy various clothing items to sell, such as T-shirts, trousers, jeans and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve day by day.

loans.use: to buy  T-shirts, trousers, jeans, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis sends greetings from his sunny and nice village of Srashen in the Syuniksk region. He is married and he lives there with his family; he has a son and a daughter.

Aramayis is thankful for his first Kiva loan allowed him to develop both his agricultural and farming activities. He still works at the Shikahogh nature reserve and does farming and agriculture in parallel. On his plot of land, which is a great one, he cultivates a great assortment of vegetables, fruit, wheat, beef, pork, milk and eggs. Last year he also started bee keeping, so he also manages to sell honey. Aramayis still rents a big plot of land on which he mainly cultivates wheat. He sells all these goods at the wholesale market of Kapan city during the week with the great help of his wife.

Soon it will be the time for spring sowing and this loan will be great for Aramayis to help him organize the spring sowing activities. He will also buy some seeds.

loans.use: to organize spring sowing and also to buy some seeds

loans.name: Maurhil

texts.en:
Maurhil is a 30 year old, married man and a father of two young children from Ormoc City, Leyte. He has earned a living through his hog raising business for more than 7 years now. This is his source of income.

Maurhil is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise. A loan will help him improve his hog raising business as well as his income and profit.

In the future, Maurhil has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a mother of three who really wants to see her daughters realize their dreams. That is why she is full of enthusiasm and energy when working tirelessly in her one acre mixed farm.

Grace started farming ten years ago, around the time she got married. She has grown her agribusiness from scratch to its current profitable position. She has always aspired to introduce added value in order to make her clients happier and make the farm more profitable. The activities she has been running have been generating just enough income to cover her monthly business expenses and the basic necessities of the home.

Grace is counting on the support of Kiva lenders to access a loan that will enable her to pay for a posho mill (grain mill). With this loan, she will be able to process the maize grain and sell it as a finished product. Ugali is a staple food in Kenya, made from maize flour. The posho mill will also generate income from other families looking to grind maize grains they have harvested.

Grace is very motivated with this big project because it is the tipping point for her family. Triumph in efforts to elevate their livelihood will make her feel much more than pride.

loans.use: to pay for a posho mill.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation.

With the loan of 25,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en el ciclo número 12 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, y poco han ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Rosa, a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido mejorando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Se dedica a ser empleada y también hace manicura, es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar esmaltes, acetonas, algodones, alicates y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo su manicura, y de esa forma poder seguir con el buen servicio que da a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called La Esperanza, they are on their 12th loan cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women Communal Bank program where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are all part of a poverty elimination group and  they have been improving their lives a little.
Rosa, through her efforts and sacrifices, has been improving in order to give her family everything that she could not have. She works and also does manicures. She is very hard working and especially enterprising.
She is asking for this loan to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton wool, clippers and other supplies so she can continue to do manicures and in this way be able to continue giving good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton wool, clippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy consumable goods

loans.name: Kenia Valeska

texts.es:
Con los ojos brillosos y una sonrisa encantadora, Kenia ofrece su joyería de acero inoxidable. Esta joven de veintidós años de edad, es una emprendedora completa. Ella ha decidido tener éxito, además de ser universitaria, trabaja medio tiempo en una empresa y vende su joyería de forma ambulante, lo que la convierte en un ejemplo de superación para los jóvenes. 
Apoyada por sus padres ella comenzó a comprar algunos artículos de acero, con el pasar del tiempo su capacidad de adquirir más y variadas piezas ha incrementado significativamente, lo que le ha proporcionado una clientela fiel. Ahora ella se siente capaz de apostar por productos de acero más elaborados, es por eso que Kenia deposita sus esperanzas en Kiva por medio de MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo para comprar joyas de acero y así poder venderlas para cumplir con su meta de hacer crecer su negocio. En un futuro ella  planea dejar de ser vendedora ambulante y poner su propia tienda.
texts.en:
With bright eyes and a charming smile, Kenia offers her stainless steel jewellery. This young 22 year old is a complete entrepreneur. She has decided to be successful, as well as being a university student, she works part time in a company and sells jewellery as a street vendor. This has made her an example of self-improvement for young people.
Supported by her parents, she started to buy some stainless steel items, as time passed, her ability to buy a larger number and more varied pieces has increased significantly. This has led to her having a loyal clientele. She now feels able to take on more elaborate stainless steel products. This is why she is putting her hope in Kiva through MiCrédito in order to get a loan to buy stainless steel jewellery and therefore sell them to achieve her aim of growing her business. In the future she plans to stop being a street vendor and open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy stainless steel jewellery.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram works in the private sector in Kapan town. After work, Aram makes furniture in the small garage in his house. He started his manufacturing business three years ago, and since then has been able to gather a good client base. Aram receives orders for making chairs, sofas and tables from wood and other materials, and so is able to earn income for his family's living. He lives with his parents. 

Aram has applied for this loan to purchase materials and tools needed for furniture production. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools for furniture production

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is a builder living in Masis town. He live with his parents, wife and three children. Marat is mainly involved in construction and the design of buildings and he is very professional. 

To be able to make his work more effective, Marat asks for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for providing construction services. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing construction services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Inmaculada se formó en ciudad del Este, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren salir de la pobreza, por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un elemento de ayuda para todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, mostró estar en una situación de pobreza extrema, ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, es una mujer muy sacrificada que se está esforzando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Quiere ir mejorando poco a poco y por medio de su esfuerzo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hamburguesas, panificados, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y con lo cual podrá ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called Inmaculada and was formed in Ciudad del Este. They are all women who are the heads of their households and want to get out of poverty through the poverty elimination survey which is something that helps all of them.
One of the members is called Maria and she showed in the survey that she was in a situation of extreme poverty. She earns a living selling hamburgers. She is a very selfless woman who works hard to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She wants to continue improving little by little through her efforts.
She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in hamburgers, bakes goods, green vegetables and other things so as to be able to continue selling with which she will able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hamburgers, baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronics goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María atiende diario con una sonrisa a sus clientes en su pulpería. Hace cinco años ella decidió emprender junto a su esposo este negocio de una tienda de abarrotes, como una alternativa para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus dos hijos. Esta mujer de 41 años de edad no deja de ser emprendedora y enérgica a la hora de comerciar, tiene una visión para su negocio, que es hacerlo crecer hasta convertirse en distribuidora. 
Es por eso que en la oportunidad de financiamiento que le está ofreciendo Kiva a través de MiCrédito ella ve el chance de cumplir su meta. Con este, planea invertir en productos como arroz, frijoles, verduras, enlatados, jabón, papel higiénico, entre otros, que son necesarios en la vida diaria.  Esta mujer esforzada tiene como principal aliento hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales, es por eso que ella trabaja con tanto empeño y está decidida a crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
María greets her clients daily with a smile in her grocery store. It's been five years since she decided to undertake, with her husband, this business of a grocery store as an alternative to improve her quality of life and that of her two children. This 41-year-old woman never ceases to be enterprising and energetic when it comes to trade. She has a vision for her business and hopes to see it grow until it becomes a distributor. 

In the financial opportunity that Kiva is offering through MiCrédito, María sees the chance to fulfill her goal. With this loan she plans to invest in goods such as rice, beans, vegetables, canned food, soap, and toilet paper among other things that are necessary for daily life. This courageous woman's main driving force is to be able to see her children in a professional career, and it is for this that she works so hard and is determined to grow as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, canned goods, soap, and toilet paper among other things.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is in her early 40s, is married and has five children, four in school and one grown up. She has run a mama lishe (food vending) business since 2004.  She works from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and also increase the number of customers she is serving. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, build her house and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her mama lishe stock and serve many people. She dreams of installing electricity in her house and putting mosquito gauze in her windows.  

Joyce will make sure she pays her loan on time according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase her mama lishe (food-vending) stock and serve many people.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen del Rosario  está en el ciclo 15, es un grupo que está iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza.
Cinthia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a las confecciones, es modista y hace todo tipo de artículos, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que tiene ya mucha clientela. Comenta que poco a poco se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos.
Cinthia pide este préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones, para poder cumplir de esta forma con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Committee Virgen del Rosario [Virgin of the Rosary] is in cycle 15. It is a group that is starting with many expectations. They want to invest so that they can have more household income and be able to rise above poverty.

Cinthia is one of the members of this group. She makes a living making clothing. She is a seamstress and makes all kinds of items. She is very good at what she does, and for this reason she has a large clientele. She says that little by little she has gained a a very good clientele that always make many orders.

Cinthia is asking for this loan in order to buy fabric and thread in order to continue to make her clothing and therefore complete the orders of her customers. She is very thankful for the opportunity that she has received to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make clothing.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
In 2009, Elpedia learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. She tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Elpedia borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Elpedia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Bengy

texts.en:
Bengy is 33 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has been a farmer for five years. 

She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her lemon business, in order to have more produce. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. 

In the future, Bengy hopes to have her own jeep for easy to transport into the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her kitchen. She hopes to cook in a comfortable area, supported by her loan of PHP 35,000. She hopes to sustain her business and to open another eatery in her town.

loans.use: to renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Roald

texts.en:
Roald makes a good earning on his farming activities in Tambulig. This is how he supports his family and is able to send his children to school. 

He wants to increase his farm yield, especially because his cost of living increased when his children entered college. 

Roald approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticide. He has high hopes that he will have good production this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticide.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Retailing helped Clifford survive for the family. He retails his own delicious recipe of 'lechon manok' (roasted chicken) and earns PHP 15,000 per month. 

Clifford plans to expand his retailing business. He applied a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for the needed capital. He wants to buy additional chicken to make delicious lechon manok to meet the demands of his customers. 

Clifford smiles at the idea of seeing all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy chicken to make delicious lechon manok (roasted chicken).

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
In her extensive global travels, Caroline was constantly exposed to local artisan culture. Inspired by global craftspeople and by her own family ties to Zimbabwe, she decided to start her own clothing label two years ago. By using only locally sourced and sustainable materials, Caroline seeks to empower local artisans. 

Caroline, originally from Australia, currently employs an intern and hopes to expand the reach of her clothing business so that it can financially support itself. With this loan, she will be able to buy more supplies for her studio and find more vendors for her clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her clothing studio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent space and expand the reach of his record label company to include nightclub entertainment.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Many years ago, Fredrick delved into the construction repair trade and discovered a talent for fixing things. Fourteen years ago, he decided to start his own business, providing repair services and materials delivery for clients. Since then, his quality work has won him many referrals, allowing his business to grow. However, he still struggles with periods of slow business, and hopes to invest in new assets to increase profits and financial stability. 

Originally from Jamaica, Fredrick has children who depend on him for financial support. With this loan, he will purchase a trailer to expand on the delivery aspect of his company. He will also invest in new tools and materials to expand his business. He hopes to make his company financially stable, allowing him to support his children and prepare for retirement.

loans.use: to expand his business by investing in new materials and expanding the business' delivery aspect.

loans.name: Kelechi

texts.en:
Kelechi is a budding entrepreneur with an inspirational mission: to create a global marketing platform for small business owners worldwide to sell their African-inspired products on a global scale, and spread awareness of the stories behind African designers and designs. 

Originally from Nigeria, Kelechi launched her online store, Zuvaa, just nine months ago, and currently offers customers a very wide variety of African-inspired apparel items. Already, she has earned significant revenue, attracted over forty vendors in the US and Europe, and gained hundreds of customers. However, she is not experiencing steady growth, and the company suffers from insufficient publicity.

This loan will allow Kelechi to find more vendors and expand her marketing channels. Specifically, she wishes to expand her vendor and customer reach to include countries in Africa. By supporting her, lenders are also supporting scores of small business owners who sell their products on Kelechi’s website, as well as their communities. Many of the craftspeople she works with are women, whose talent is broadcast through Kelechi’s business. 

Kelechi believes that the beauty and uniqueness of African textiles and clothing “is a beauty I want the rest of the world to see as well. I want to change the perceptions of the African continent through fashion and design. And I am confident that the beauty and vibrancy of the pieces from the Zuvaa Marketplace will be a great step towards that.”

loans.use: to take on more vendors and expand the reach of her online store, which offers a selling space for small business owners to sell African-inspired products.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Ever since she lost 70 pounds by improving her diet and exercise habits, Loren has been passionate about helping others improve the healthfulness of their lifestyles. Over a year and a half ago, she started Fuego Fitness. The fitness studio offers exercise classes for both adults and kids ranging from zumba to barre to yoga. She currently employs four instructors.

The perseverance and self-discipline that allowed Loren to drastically improve her own health has driven the success of her business. However, she does not have enough spare capital to invest in new equipment and staff, and therefore help her studio grow.

In order to reach more clients and better serve her customers, Loren will use this loan to hire more employees and purchase new fitness equipment. By expanding her business, she hopes to continue helping others grow into happy, healthy people. A thriving business will also help support her husband and three daughters.

loans.use: to hire more staff and purchase equipment to expand her fitness studio and take on more customers.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel has only lived in the United States for one year, but he’s already establishing himself as a promising entrepreneur in the clothing industry. Originally from Cuba, Miguel started Modern American Woman, Corp. a few months ago to help supplement his family’s income. The brand new company already has sales and Miguel has already begun to help his family.

However, Miguel has had difficulty purchasing enough inventory to meet demand—a necessary step in expanding his business and kick-starting his success. With this loan, he will be able to invest in more merchandise and attract more clients to his company. 

He hopes to soon start selling clothing online and eventually open his own store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for his women's clothing store.

loans.name: Brad

texts.en:
Seven years ago, Brad founded his own company, Harmony Hills Construction. Construction work was something he had always enjoyed. As he puts it, “I love to work hard every day and come home with a sense of accomplishment.” His business started out performing roofing work, but has begun concentrating more on remodeling work. He hopes to continue in this direction.

Brad lives with his wife, who helps him with the company’s bookkeeping, and their three-year-old son. Although he is dedicated to his construction work, he has experienced the difficulty of expanding his business using only day-to-day profits. 

This loan will make larger-scale investment possible. He plans to buy more construction materials and hire new labor so that his company can take on larger projects and increase their profits. In the future, he hopes to become a custom home builder and create employment opportunities for people in his community. He also hopes to create a comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and hire new labor to enable his company to take on bigger, more profitable remodeling jobs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish her company website and purchase more inventory and marketing supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia, who is 53 years old, lives in the village of Maghlaki. He has a little grandson and a daughter-in-law who is temporarily unemployed. The only existing income for this family is from small agricultural activity. Gia works hard to make good living conditions for his family and satisfy its increased needs. But it became harder for him and he requires financial support to expand his agricultural activity.

Gia has a plot of land which he cultivates and also works as a private artisan. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3000 GEL for purchasing cattle. He will raise them and, after 12 months, will start milking them. Gia will start production of cheese and yogurt and will sell it at the open market of the nearby town.

Gia will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide his new business and will highly appreciate their help.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and expand his agribusiness.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Over a decade ago, Ben was introduced to bicycle motocross (BMX) and has been racing competitively ever since. Recently, he decided to pursue the business side of BMX by opening his own company and brand of BMX bikes. Although his company is only six months old, he has already developed custom brand frames and bikes. He also started his own BMX team under his brand.
 
His business holds enormous potential, but, like most business owners, Ben needs to make substantial investments to kick start its success. This loan will allow him to increase inventory and purchase marketing materials for his BMX bicycle design and sales company. He wants to be able to have BMX frames and bikes available with short notice, instead of having to special order each bike. 

His future plans include selling more bikes throughout the year and expanding awareness of his brand via marketing initiatives. Personally, he wants to participate in a few national BMX events, earn some titles, and have his team compete and do well.

loans.use: to increase inventory and purchase marketing materials for his BMX bicycle design and sales company.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Although they are overlooked businesses, auto salvage yards are incredibly environmentally sustainable enterprises. Reuse is oftentimes less energy-intensive than recycling. When people purchase reused items instead of new items, they save enormous amounts of energy and resources.

At Naises Auto Salvage, Clara is simultaneously supporting a culture of reuse and working to provide affordable car parts to her customers. Originally from the Dominican Republic, Clara has owned her business for 9 months. She currently employs two workers. However, her business needs more salvaged parts to be able to attract more customers and become more profitable.

This loan will allow Clara to purchase more salvaged auto parts and augment sales. In the near future, she hopes to expand her business to export car parts to the Dominican Republic. Clara is committed not only to increasing her financial stability, but also giving back to her roots. By supporting her business, lenders may also be supporting her Dominican community in the future.

loans.use: to buy more salvaged vehicles and parts to augment sales at her auto parts business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 57 years old, married, and has five children. 

Leticia’s husband works as an accountant, while she is managing her beauty salon business. Leticia has run her business for five years and, hopefully, will continue to operate her business until she can manage it. 

Leticia wants to expand the business by offering more services and products to her regular customers. With this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000, to buy hair dye, hair coloring, and other materials needed in her business. Leticia believes that by having the loan, she will be able to perform the service well and sell products offered by her beauty salon business.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, hair coloring, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fragrances, lipstick, make-up, and other beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Lourygyn

texts.en:
Lourygyn landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She is thankful to Paglaum for giving her the chance to continue her business supporting her financial needs.  

Now she availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Lourygyn perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals so she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
At her age of 59, Esperanza still has her eagerness to manage well her retail business and become successful too. Esperanza is married and has six children. Her husband is a company driver. Both of their earnings are just enough to meet their daily family expenditures. 

Esperanza is looking for additional source of income that will enable her to save some of her earnings. Therefore, Esperanza is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to extend the products she is selling. She will use the loan to buy beverages, biscuits, eggs, and canned goods. 

Esperanza hopes to increase her sales and income as well. She will use her loan wisely in order to be able to have savings for their future.

loans.use: to buy beverages, biscuits, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 48 years old and lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has a 7 children. 

She is doing her farming activity with her husband and has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan to pay for labor to harrow their land to plant ginger. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Esperanza hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 64 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 adult-age children. She is good in doing her farming activities and has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.
