In the future, Alicia hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle has always been enthusiastic about farming. She cultivates rice on her land in Mahayag and has a good yield and good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Anabelle knew that she has to get things right to gain more income this cropping season. 

In the future, Anabelle hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is grateful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. She is glad that her earnings helped support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive harvest on her farm.  It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and for children’s education. Your financial help has inspired her to strive more to expand her farm and she is thankful to God for blessing her business.

Leonila dreams that her farm will grow and flourish and she will have happy and prosperous life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and plants for her business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald was born in Frankfurt, Germany to a US military family. The family later moved to Philadelphia, and when he grew up, Gerald moved to Delaware County, PA. After studying martial arts for ten years, he decided to start his own martial arts school three years ago. 

Karate Kickers Martial Arts Academy, LLC, was born out of Gerald’s passion for the focus, confidence, discipline, and fitness that martial arts imparts on its subjects. He currently instructs adults, teens, and children, gaining much of his satisfaction from helping young children become more focused. He has no employees, but his wife and other young teens serve as volunteers from time to time.

In order to financially support his family, Gerald works as a full time college custodian. However, he wants to become a full-time martial arts teacher and grow his school substantially. The purpose of his loan is to purchase a new uniform and more equipment for his students at his martial arts academy. He hopes to have 50 students by the end of this year, and be able to buy a house and improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new uniform and more equipment for his students at his martial arts academy.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 23 years old, married and has one child.

Angela is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Angela has been in business  for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Beverly has been in this business for 4 years. Beverly earns additional income from raising pigs.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia works hard to support her family. Dalia is married and has a personal collection business in the Philippines.

Dalia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like body lotion, perfume, shampoo, etc.

Dalia has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like body lotion, perfume, shampoo.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of used clothes to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 46 years old and has five children. Gerlie is married and has two children who are still in school.

Gerlie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gerlie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gerlie has been  for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Mary, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Mount Kenya. She is 42 years of age and has been doing farming for the past 22 years and through those years, she has gathered so much experience she is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. Mary is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why everyday she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although Mary makes profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. The Chuka area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Mary will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Mary, but she feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Mary believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals. She believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Mary to repay the loan and secure the future of her school going children

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jessie is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jessie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jessie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Jessie has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. Jessica is married and has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell on her stall.

Jessica has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora is 28 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lora has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vidjai

texts.en: Vidjai is a 37-year-old single man who runs a shop near his home. He sells food items and household items in his shop. He wants to expand his range and has no money. Vidjai has already done business with Seva MFI and has paid all his loan on time. He asked for another loan to finance his shop articles.

loans.use: To expand his range.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for weeding.

loans.name: Los Tulipanes Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, is the country’s second largest city. Sixty-one percent of the population is Mam Maya. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Los Tulipanes” or Tulips, is located within a smaller community section of Quetzaltenango. “Los Tulipanes” is composed of eight women who have diverse businesses which include the selling of shoes, piñatas, and food. Other members of the group are embroiderers and seamstresses.

Like all of the Friendship Bridge Trust Banks, “Los Tulipanes” is run by a board of directors consisting of a president, secretary and treasurer. Forty-year-old Karla is the president and has been a microentrepreneur through catalog sales of cosmetics and shoes. Last year, because of increased competition, she began a business selling snacks, which produces a better income. This year for her new business, she is requesting a loan to buy pots, pitchers, cups and dishes as well as ingredients to make tostadas, enchiladas, chuchitos and porridges that her customers want. With her increased income, Karla can support her twin daughters' education through to the university level. Karla has a secretarial diploma but has never been able to find any jobs. That is why she continues to grow her businesses and is asking for a loan so that her daughters can become strong women with better opportunities.

All the women of the Trust Bank “Los Tulipanes” are extremely grateful to the Kiva investors for providing the loans that make it possible for them to increase and/or maintain their businesses. Thank you Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy pots, pitchers, cups and dishes as well as ingredients to make tostadas, enchiladas, chuchitos and porridges that her customers want.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis es de la ciudad de Concepción, es locutor y presentador de radio, es dueño de una radio emisora, comenta que por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Tiene muchos radioescuchas, y poco a poco su radio es más conocida y escuchada por toda la cuidad. El pide este préstamo para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su radio, y de esa forma cada día poder mejorar para sus radioescuchas.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Concepción. He is a radio announcer and presenter. He is the owner of a radio station. He comments that, by means of this work, he has the means to be able to help his family.

He has many radio listeners, and little by little, his radio is more known and listened to by all of the city. He is applying for this loan to be able to improve the infrastructure of his radio and, in this manner, be able to improve for his radio listeners every day.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the radio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, greens, dairy products, canned goods and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy general products for selling like oil, soap, fabric softeners and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in marketing and publicity for her stained glass business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Originally from Ecuador, Oscar moved to the US 23 years ago, and quickly set to work as a self-made businessman. In Ecuador, he had obtained an accountant’s degree, and came to the US with knowledge of accounting and a desire to assist others on complicated financial matters. He started his own accounting company eleven years ago, and works independently to help many people prepare their taxes and effectively deal with their finances. 

Oscar lives with his wife, and his greatest business success, according to him, is his clients’ satisfaction and the many referrals he has had for his services. To continue to serve with professional etiquette and expand the business’ services related to tax and finances, Oscar will use this loan to replace office equipment.

loans.use: to purchase more accounting supplies so that his accounting office can expand their tax and finance services.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
A mark of a successful entrepreneur is the ability to detect business potential in marketplace niches. That is just what Juan did. He saw that there were great marketing possibilities for graphic design and advertising that he could address. Two years ago, almost immediately after arriving in the US, Juan started his own business creating advertising materials for individuals and companies. He currently employs three people, one of whom is his wife.

Juan is a native of Cuba, and still provides financial support to his mother back at home. His printing business supports his family, which consists of him, his wife, and his son. However, he has run into the issue of insufficient capital to make investments to expand the services and profitability of his company. 

With this loan, Juan will purchase necessary equipment: a cutting plotter, raw materials, and a printer. His long-term goal is to grow in the advertising industry by finding ways to creatively work within the requirements of the market.

loans.use: to purchaase equipment and raw materials for his graphic design and printing company.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 26-year-old man married with one child. He does coffee trading at Nyabiteete T/C in Bugangari as his major source of income. He has been in this business for a period of five years. William’s business is always affected by inadequate capital, which is the reason as to why it does not expand at the rate he wants it to. William applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to boost his business by buying coffee from farmers which he will sell to processors. This will help him to earn more income, to meet his financial needs and construct a descent residential house. William hopes to expand his business by opening up stores in different trading centres so as to earn more profits. He hopes to achieve this with Ugafode's support.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Iveliss

texts.en:
From an early age, Iveliss developed a firm belief in persistence and never giving up. This attitude allowed her to create her own medical clinic in 2007. She currently has four employees and one partner. The efficient way she runs her company has increased demand for her services, and she loves her job. Performing exams on people who care about having a secure future for themselves and their children is something she finds very fulfilling.

In the future she plans to go back to school and get her M.D. license to practice medicine. She also hopes to provide her services in as many states as possible, and be one of the top businesses that insurance companies trust to perform professional exams. This loan will enable Iveliss to step closer to these goals. 

She will invest in new equipment, such as electrocardiograms (EKGs) and centrifuges, and hire more staff. This will enable her to continue the growth of her clinic and support herself and her 7-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and hire additional staff for her medical clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is an old client of UGAFODE who has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He runs a coffee trade business in Bigaaga Rwerere Nyakagyeme, Rukungiri district. He has done this business for more than 26 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy more coffee for trade so that he can raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his children and develop himself. Stephen is an honest and hardworking man but is always affected by limited capital. He faces many challenges like fluctuation of prices and competition from other traders. However, his major problem is limited capital which hinders him from buying all the coffee his customers want. With this loan from UGAFODE, Stephen is hopeful that the situation will improve gradually. Stephen thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance which has enabled him to expand his business whereby he has been able to realize some profits.

loans.use: To buy coffee for trade

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedora es de la ciudad de Luque, el grupo de mujeres está liderado por la Sra. Justina, quien es la presidenta del comité. 
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza para poder crecer y salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia, y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Poco a poco quiere ir creciendo en su microemprendimiento, es por ello que pide este préstamo, para la compra de prendas varias y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) group is from the city of Luque. The leader and chair of this group of women is Justina.

Justina is a person who strives to grow and get ahead in order to be able to provide for her family and give them everything she couldn't have. She is a very hard-working and selfless woman.

She wants to grow her microbusiness slowly but surely. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of clothes so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis está acompañado hace más de 10 años  con la Sra. Juana y viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.   
El señor Luis desde muy joven trabajo en la fabricación y ventas de artesanías, luego se  casó con la hija de una tejedora y  empezaron a trabajar juntos, hoy en día   hace mas 20  años que se dedica en  la ventas de la tradicional de sobrecamas y hamacas que lo lleva a vender por la zona de Asunción y chaco con una  clientela bien  formada, también se tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa donde atiende la Sra. Juana.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, hamacas, sabanas  y otros que en ésta temporada. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Luis has been in a relationship with Juana for over ten years.  They live in the city of Carapaguá.  Ever since he was very young he has worked at making and selling handicrafts.  Then he married the daughter of a weaver, and they started to work together.  It has now been over 20 years that he has been selling traditional quilts and hammocks.  He takes them to the Asunción and Chaco area to sell, and he has a well-established clientele.  He also has a small store, which Juana tends to, at his house.

He is requesting the loan to buy quilts, hammocks, sheets, and other seasonal items.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy quilts, hammocks, sheets, and other seasonal items.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Caacupe; está en su ciclo número  5  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que se han unido para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia quien comenta que el trabajo que ella hace es la Venta de Verduras por la calle también venta de huevos, se debe destacar que ella es una persona que no tiene miedo al trabajo y que siempre se sacrifica para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Agradece porque a través del programa de comités puede ir mejorando poco a poco y por medio de su propio esfuerzo, con las capacitaciones que va recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras varias, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su negocio. Todas las integrantes están entusiasmadas de poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group named Virgen de Caacupe is in its 5th cycle of the women’s committee program.  In it they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are women who are the heads of their households who have come together to help their loved ones by working together. 

One of the members is Mrs. Lidia who says that the work she does is selling vegetables on the street, she also sells eggs. It should be noted that she is one of those people who are not afraid to work and who always sacrifices herself in order to provide her loved ones with everything they need for a dignified life without any deprivation. She is grateful because through the committee’s program she has been getting better little by little and through her own hard work with the training she has received.

She is requesting this loan to buy various vegetables as this will allow her to continue with her business. All of the members are enthusiastic about being able to improve their lives.

loans.use: buy various vegetables

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 62 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

Josefina grabbed the opportunity to become a fully pledged member of PMPC. She credits her capital in support of her gardening activities to the cooperative. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

In the future, Josefina wishes to become a supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 46 years old and widowed with two children. With her two children still in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as coffee, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

Juliet has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as coffee, noodles, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Mariali

texts.en:
Mariali is 33 years old and has two children.  Mariali is single and her two children are still in school.

Mariali is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Mariali requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mariali has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margarita Rosa

texts.es:
Margarita de 63 años de edad, es habitante de un municipio ubicado a orillas del mar;  ella es una mujer casada , madre de 4 hijos adultos, que ha apoyado siempre el bienestar de su hogar , generando ingresos , mediante una actividad comercial, que desempeña desde hace 15 años, cuando una amiga, en Marzo del año 2000, le propuso vender artículos  variados, como ropa, calzado etc, y ella inició su experiencia, en la cual le fue bien y por eso dio continuidad a su negocio. 
Hoy comercializa todo tipo de productos de tocador, ropa, calzado, bolsos etc, a partir de la solicitud de pedidos que hacen sus clientes, a quienes vende de contado y a crédito, trabajando todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche; sus compras las realiza a distribuidores, mayoristas de la ciudad de Barranquilla, la cual queda a 30 minutos de su natal Puerto Colombia. Margarita cuenta con una base de clientes que le refieren nuevos y por eso siempre se encuentra en crecimiento y requiere cada vez más un nuevo capital de trabajo. En la actualidad ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado cremas, y artículos variados, para incrementar sus ventas y con ello aumentar sus utilidades. Su mayor desafío es fidelizar su clientela y ahorrar, pues tiene como  meta la apertura de un local al público y remodelar su vivienda, para aumentar el sosiego familiar.
texts.en:
Margarita, 63, is an inhabitant of a town located on the shore of the sea. She is a married woman, mother for 4 adult children, whom she has always supported the wellbeing of their home. She has generated income through a commercial activity that she has carried out for the past 15 years. In March of the year 2000, when a friend proposed to her to sell various articles like clothing, shoes, etc, she started her experience, in which it went well for her. Therefore, she gave continuity to her business.

Today, she sells all types of toiletries, clothing, shoes, bags, etc. from the submission of orders that her customers make, to whom she sells on cash or credit. She works every day from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She makes her purchases from distributors and wholesalers of the city of Barranquilla, which lies 30 minutes from her native Puerto Colombia.

Margarita has a customer base that refer new ones to her and therefore, she is always found in growth and increasingly requires new working capital. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she's doing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, by which she will buy clothing, shoes, creams and various articles to increase her sales and with that, increase her profits. Her largest challenge is to build the loyalty of her clientele and save, since she has as a goal opening a place to the public and remodeling her home to increase the family tranquility.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, creams and various articles.

loans.name: Riqchariy Mec Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal RIQCHARIY MEC, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Noemí  tiene 21 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, crianza de animales menores  y agricultura.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank RIQCHARIY MEC. The bank is located in the area of Challabamba, in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.

The member Noemi is 21 years old; she has a live in partner and 1 child. She alternates her daily activities doing agriculture. She has had her business for a long while and it’s going well for her because of the effort that she puts into it every day. At the same time she also raises small animals. She hopes to continue working so that she can continue to support her family in this manner. 

She is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet the established payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy paints and pay her workers. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy paints and pay her workers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes joined PMPC when she needed capitalization. She approached the cooperative to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. She is thankful that the cooperative has been her financing partner to sustain her business. Now, she has availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. She perseveres and always believes that she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 26 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Jeralyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Jeralyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from both motorcycle transport and a buy and sell vegetable business.

Jeralyn successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Meryjene

texts.en:
Meryjene is 63 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years now.

Meryjene requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ressel

texts.en:
Ressel is a 37-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines and has a food vending business.

Ressel has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Ressel has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a buy and sell root crop business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional root crops to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional root crops to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 54 years old, married and has four children.

Melanie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melanie has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Celeste to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, 'body loosen', sugar, salt, milk, water and biscuits.

She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Celeste independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, 'body loosen', sugar, salt, milk, water and biscuits.

loans.name: Yanci Yessenia

texts.es:
Yanci, de 30 años edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente estudia segundo año en la universidad y vive junto a su madre.

Yanci, toda su vida a ayudado en el negocio de la tienda a su madre, ella actualmente estudia segundo año de licenciatura en ciencias jurídicas, todas las semanas tiene que viajar a la ciudad en donde está la universidad.- De esta forma, se esta preparando para poder ser una persona profesionales.

El crédito será utilizado para cancelar los gastos de estudio en la universidad. 
El sueño de Yanci, es terminar sus estudios universitarios y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yanci is 30 years old and does not have any children. She is currently studying in her second year at university and lives with her mother.

For her whole life, Yanci has helped in her mother's shop. She is currently in her second year of a degree in legal sciences. Every week she has to travel to the city where her university is. In this way she is preparing herself to become a professional.

The loan will be used to pay for the costs of studying at university.
Yanci's dream is to finish her university studies and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of studying at university.

loans.name: Emma Jaqueline

texts.es:
Emma, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo es cocinero, tienen dos hijos, de ellos solamente uno asiste a la escuela.
	
Emma, es una mujer con deseos de superarse, hace 1 año inicio a trabajar en la crianza de pollos  de engorde, también ayuda a su hermana en la venta de  tortillas y con ello aporta para los gastos de sus hijos y del hogar.
	
El crédito será invertido para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para la nutrición y desarrollo de los pollos de engorde.
	
Emma, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad y mejorar la calidad de vida para toda su familia, también desea tener una granja avícola de gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Emma is 34 years old. She studied up until ninth grade. She is married, and her husband is a cook. They have two children. Only one attends school.

Emma is a woman who wants to better herself. A year ago she began work raising broiler chickens. She also helps her sister selling tortillas, and with that she contributes to covering expenses related to her children and household. 

The loan would be invested to buy feed and vitamins for the nourishment and development of the broilers. 

Emma dreams of seeing her children graduate from university and of improving the quality of life for her whole family. She also hopes to have a poultry farm with laying hens.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the nutrition and development of her broiler chickens.

loans.name: Plutarco Agustin

texts.es:
Altos y llenos de hermosos plátanos son los arboles de la finca de Plutarco, un hombre de 44 años de edad, de semblante fuerte y de una personalidad carismática, que le ha dedicado treinta años de su vida a la producción de platanera. Este agricultor encontró su pasión en este negocio desde pequeño, a los diecisiete años de edad ya que era administrador de la finca de su papá y hoy en día es el dueño. 
Actualmente Plutarco se esforzó mucho para llegar a cosechar, sin embargo ahora que está en la recta final, quiere invertir más para terminar su producción con éxito. Por esta razón solicita un crédito a Kiva a través de MiCrédito para comprar herbicida, mejorar su sistema de riego y pagar a los trabajadores. Con esta inversión podrá garantizar el equilibrio en su único ingreso, también le permitirá continuar creciendo y mejorar la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Tall and heavily laden with plantains are the trees on Plutarco's farm. A 44-year-old man, strong in appearance and with a charismatic personality, Plutarco has dedicated 30 years of his life to producing plantains. This farmer gained his passion for the business while he was young, at the age of 17, when he was already administrator of his father's farm. Today he is the owner.

At present, Plutarco is working hard to bring in the harvest, and now that he is in the final stage, he wants to invest more to successfully finish production. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Kiva through MiCredito to buy herbicides, improve the irrigation system, and pay the workers.

With this investment, he will be able to guarantee equilibrium in his only income. Also, this will permit him to continue growing and to improve the quality of his product.

loans.use: purchase herbicides, improve the irrigation system, and pay laborers for their work.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 50 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Mahayag. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month.

Recently, Carmencita availed herself of a loan to purchase cement, plywood, and nails for her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase cement, plywood, and nails for her house.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is a businesswoman from Mahayag. She is 61 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Alita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Alita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning for her family as well.

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Wilma wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 64 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three adult-aged children. She has a shop that sells fruit and vegetables and has had this business for two years. 

Elisa requested a loan to buy pails of paint for her house. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Elisa wants to expand her business and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy pails of paint for her house

loans.name: Maria Rosalina

texts.en:
Maria Rosalina is 54 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two adult-aged children. She loves doing farming with the help of her husband and her children. 

Maria Rosalina requested a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer for her rice production. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Maria Rosalina hopes that she will have a higher yield in this crop season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia makes good earnings on her farming activities in Mahayag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially because she has a high cost of living since her children entered college. 

Verginia approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have a good yield this crop season.

loans.use: to purchase a  knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 27 years old and has one child. She is married, and her child is still in school.

Mabel is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional chickens, feed, and vitamins for her chickens.

Mabel has been in business for six years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens, feed, and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Villalyn

texts.en:
Villalyn is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Villalyn has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell such as bananas, carrots, cabbage, etc.

Villalyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell such as bananas, carrots, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 50 years old and a mother of three. She engages in buying and reselling fruit and vegetables while her husband operates their motorcycle transport business. They aim to improve their standard of living and give their children a better life. 

Josefina aspires to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access an additional PHP7,000 to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, Josefina believes that someday, she will further improve the business as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small-time borrower like her.

Ruth is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed herself a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Sialei

texts.en:
Sialei is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Sialei has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, a file, and an ax. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Sialei hopes to support her family financially and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weed spray, chemicals, bush knives, a file, and an ax

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy clothing supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for the family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 35,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional merchandise, like children's, men's and women's clothing. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Virginia wants to be able to save for her new house and lot. She also desires to grow and expand her business in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise, like children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is heading into the next cropping season. He wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations.

He wants to have enough supply of rice fertilizer, for which he applied for a loan from the Cooperative.

Carlito hopes to save enough for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Bonnevie

texts.en:
Bonnevie is 24 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, dried fish, spices, etc.

Bonnevie has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and buy-and-sell vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, dried fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. Melanie has been in this business for 7 years, and earns more income from food vending.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 40 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Milagros has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Reyfrancis

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Reyfrancis works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming seaweed. Reyfrancis is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and fishing gear for her fishing business.

Reyfrancis has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and fishing gear for her business

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad, esta acompañada, su pareja al igual que ella es agricultor y juntos trabajan en la siembra de maíz y sorgo, tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 asisten a la escuela.

María, desde la edad de 10 años trabaja en la agricultura, ya que su padre sembraba 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz,  y ella junto a sus hermanos ayudaban en la siembra de este cultivo.- Así aprendió esta actividad, hoy tiene 19 años de estar acompañada; ahora, juntos realizan la siembra de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 14,000 metros cuadrados de sorgo.- Además, crían ganado de repasto; sus labores inician a las 4:30 a.m. todos los días, para prepararse a una nueva jornada de trabajo, que termina a las 12:00 m.d. y por la tarde realizan los quehaceres del hogar.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar ganado, criarlo y venderlo dentro de un año; con el préstamo se está ayudando a que María y su familia no dependan económicamente solo de la agricultura.

María, tiene el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y también desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando y reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She is married, and her partner, like her, is a farmer. Together, they work on growing corn and sorghum. They have 4 children, of whom 3 attend school.

Maria, from when she was 10 years old, has worked in agriculture, since her father grew 21,000 square meters of corn. She and her siblings helped in growing this crop. Thus, she learned this work. She has been married for 19 years. Together, she and her husband grow 14,000 square meters of corn and 14,000 square meters of sorghum. They also raise cattle. Their work begins at 4:30am everyday to prepare for a new day of work, which ends at 12:00pm. In the afternoon, they do household tasks.

The loan will be used to buy livestock, raise it, and sell it within a year. The loan will help Maria and her family to not depend solely on agriculture. 

Maria dreams of improving the quality of her family’s life, and she also wants her children to continue studying and to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock, raise it, and sell it within a year.

loans.name: Marcia Corina

texts.es:
Las pulperías son una opción cuando se trata de aportar  a la economía del hogar. Lo más beneficioso de optar por este trabajo, es la comodidad. Pero más aún, que no se descuida a la familia. Doña Marcia es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, que optó por ofrecer productos desde su casa, lo  que con el tiempo fue evolucionando a una pulpería.
Marcia solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, aceite, meneítos, papel higiénico y demás productos que ofrece en su pulpería.  Esta mujer de 54 años espera continuar invirtiendo para así ganar más clientes.  Además  es una forma de mantenerse activa y no ser una carga para nadie, pues ahora que tiene la pulpería es autosuficiente e independiente.
texts.en:
Grocery stores are an option for supporting the household finances. The most beneficial thing about choosing this work is the comfort. More than that, though, is that one doesn’t neglect their family.

Marcia is a persevering and hard-working woman who chose to offer products for sale from her house. Over time, this evolved into a grocery store.

Marcia requests the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, cheese puffs, paper towels, and other products that she offers in her store. This woman is 54 years old and hopes to continue investing so that she can gain more clients. This is also a way for her to remain active and to not be anyone’s responsibility. Her grocery store is sustainable and independent.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, cheese puffs, paper towels, and other products.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, a quienes ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Antonio, inicio a trabajar en la agricultura, desde la edad de 15 años, ayudaba a su padre en la producción de cultivos de maíz y frijol.- Además, su padre le enseño a trabajar con bueyes, para realizar labores agrícolas de labranza mínima; además, cría ganado de repasto.- De estas dos actividades dependen sus ingresos y de esta forma ayuda a su familia con los gastos. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto; de esta forma podrá aumentar su hato de ganado.

Antonio, sueña con continuar estudiando y graduarse de la universidad, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio, 23 years old, studied until the 9th grade.  He is single, he does not have children, and he lives with his parents, whom he helps with the household expenses.

Antonio began to work in agriculture when he 15 years old.  He used to help his father in the production of corn and beans.  Additionally, his father taught him to work with oxen, to do minimum tillage farming, and also to breed pasture cattle.  From these two jobs come his income, and in this way he helps his with family with the expenses.

The loan will be invested in buying cattle pasture land; this way he will be able to increase his herd of cattle. 

Antonio dreams of continuing studying and graduating of the university, in order to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy cattle pasture land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 14 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 35 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $100.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee and body lotions. 

She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity over the past 3 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee and body lotions.

loans.name: Oeurt

texts.en:
Oeurt, a mother of three dependent children, lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. For her family, rice farming and working for others for a fee are the main sources of income to secure the basic needs.

This is the sixth loan for Oeurt with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle gradually.

Now, she is getting a new loan of 1,600,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her cash crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, water, biscuits and books. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. 

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, water, biscuits and books.

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
Several months had passed and Kerto Sato group was able to pay off on time. In the journey of their businesses, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they get a satisfactory results. Because they get a satisfactory result, some of the members of the group got enough money for saving. During this time, their activities are monitored by the loan officer for their achievements and serve as an example for other farmers. 

Ni Ketut had sold all of her piglets and earns enough profit after deducting with other cost. From the profit she can fulfill her family daily needs and also save. She and all the member of the Kerto Sato said their greetings to all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the prices of feeds are high enough, the  Kerto Sato  group went for a new loan. Each member gets 1,500,000 IDR. The loan will be use to buy super quality piglets and feed.  To reduce costs, she still gives them mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not attacked by disease. If she already have enough savings for venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

Two members can’t attend the meeting due to a ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
In 2012, Gloria signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has availed herself of the financial assistance, from insurance to capitalization of her business.

She tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. Gloria borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income get a big boost.

Gloria looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Sosima

texts.en:
Sosima works hard to support her family. Sosima is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Sosima requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy livestock

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ailyn works hard to support her family. She has a business selling food supplement products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.  Ailyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more food supplements to sell to her customers.  

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food supplements

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is 24 years old and has three children. Edisa is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Edisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Edisa requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, Edisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed, vaccines & vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is 55 years old and single.    Emerenciana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, coffee, etc. to sell.

Emerenciana has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, coffee, etc.  In the future, Emerenciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 55 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlina has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, seasonings, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Erlina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en:
Filadelfa is 51 years old and married with five children.

Filadelfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Filadelfa has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Filadelfa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosa Ibel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 34 años edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera y tiene una hija que asiste a la escuela.

Rosa, desde que abandonó la escuela por falta de recursos económicos, inicio a trabajar a la edad de 12 años, junto con su madre en la venta de especias, en ese negocio trabajo 10 años.- Luego, aprendió el oficio de costurería y lo hace en sus tiempos libres, pero además de eso, hace 2 años coloco una pequeña tienda en su casa y de esta actividad dependen sus ingresos, para sacar adelante a su hija.

El crédito será utilizado para invertir en el negocio de la tienda, de esta forma se contribuye a que Rosa, continué obteniendo ingresos, para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Rosa, es terminar de remodelar su vivienda y por supuesto seguir trabajando para que su hija pueda continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old, and she studied through sixth grade. She is single and has a daughter who attends school.

Since she left school because of a lack of financial resources, Rosa started working at 12 years old. She and her mother sold spices; she worked in this business for 10 years. Next, she learned dressmaking, which she does in her free time. In addition to this, she started a small store in her house 2 years ago. Her income depends on this work, and she uses the income to take her daughter forward.

The loan will be used to invest in her store. In this way, it will help Rosa continue earning an income to cover the household expenses. 

Rosa’s dream is to finish remodeling her house and, of course, to continue working so that her daughter can continue studying.

loans.use: to invest in her store.

loans.name: Kuon

texts.en: Kuon, aged 48, is a mother of two school children. Her entire family resides in Koh Krorlor district of Battambang province, where her rice is grown. Kuon has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles with successful repayments. Now, she is requesting a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for insecticide. She hopes that she can support her business on time so that she can make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & pesticide

loans.name: Soeurg

texts.en:
Soeurng  is an elderly mother of two dependent children who are in school.  She is the breadwinner in the family and struggles for a living via rice farming. She has been occupied in this business for ages and has a decent income in return. 

Soeurng is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kivas partner). She has taken two past loans already with a successful repayment history.  For this cycle, she applies for 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to buy gasoline to pump water for her rice field. In the future, she hopes that she can make more income than before to better off her lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gas to pump water

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es:
Miguel, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casado, tiene una niña de 4 años de edad y su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos del hogar.

Miguel, inicio a trabajar junto a su padre en la agricultura desde la edad de 12 años, también trabajaba como ayudante de albañilería, desde entonces aprendió muy bien el oficio y hoy ya es albañil.- Además, junto a su esposa siembra un área de 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz, estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos.- Él trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. en albañilería. 

El crédito será invertido para comprar materiales de construcción y terminar de construir su vivienda.

Lo que más desea, es tener salud para sacar adelante a su familia, también piensa en trabajar muy duro para ayudarle a su hija a que estudie y pueda prepararse academicamente.
texts.en:
Miguel, 30 years old, studied until the 8th grade.  He is married, has a four year old daughter, and his wife does the household chores. 

Miguel began working together with his father in agriculture when he was 12.  Also, he worked as an assistant masonry; since then, he learned the craft very well, and today he is a bricklayer.  Additionally, together with his wife, they plant an area of 7,000 square meters of corn.  These two jobs are his sources of income.   He works Monday through Saturday from 7:00am to 4:00pm in the masonry.

He will invest the loan to buy construction materials and to finish building his house.

What he wants most is to be healthy to get his family ahead.  Also, he plans on working very hard to help his daughter to study and be able to prepare her academically.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and to finish building his house.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
A local resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Nak is a mother who is currently supporting one school-going child, aged 12. She earns a living via rice farming and also works for others for a fee.  

Nak has been involved with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past seven cycles and has  a successful repayment history. The positive impact of her loans allows her to improve her lifestyle gradually. Now, she is applying for 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, to buy gasoline for plowing her farmland, and to pay for plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before so that she can triple her income to keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & gasoline, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Marina Elida

texts.es:
Marina, de 53 años edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, tiene 3 hijos y su pareja es albañil.

Marina, trabaja desde la edad de 12 años ayudando a su padre en las algodoneras.- También aprendió a cultivar maíz y frijol; actualmente, tiene sembrados 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, con ayuda de su pareja y de su hijo.- También, crían ganado de repasto.	

El crédito será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto.

El sueño de Marina, es mejorar su vivienda y tener ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Marina, 53 years old, studied until the 5th grade.  She is married, has three children, and her partner is a bricklayer.

Marina has worked since she was 12, helping her father with the cotton.  Also, she learned to grow corn and beans.  Currently, she has planted 7,000 square meters of corn with the help of her partner and her son.  Also, they raise cattle in pasture.

The loan will be used to buy cattle pasture land.

Marina's dream is to improve her home and to have dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy cattle pasture land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Guilerminha

texts.en: Guilerminha is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as onions and garlic. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Guilerminha is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: buy onions and garlic

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo al igual que ella es agricultor, tienen 4 hijos, a los cuales con mucho esfuerzo y responsabilidad logro darles el apoyo, para que estudiaran hasta bachillerato.

Mirna, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos conocimientos en agricultura, ya que desde la edad de 10 años acompañaba a sus padres a las algodoneras a trabajar, también sembraban yuca y maíz.- Ahora, siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y también criá ganado, actualmente tiene bovinos a los cuales cuida todo el tiempo y los lleva a los potreros para que pasten. 

El crédito sera invertido para comprar ganado de repasto, con la cual asegurara sus ingresos.

Mirna, sigue teniedo el sueño de tener un terreno propio donde cultivar y en donde pueda tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Mirna, 46 years old, studied until the 6th grade.  She is married and her husband is a farmer like her.  They have four children, and with a great deal of effort and responsibility she succeeded in supporting them so they could complete high school.

Mirna is a hardworking woman and is very knowledgeable in agriculture; since when she was 10, she accompanied her parents to the cotton fields to work.  They also planted yucca and corn.  Now, she plants 14,000 square meters of corn, and she also raises cattle.  Currently, she has cattle that she cares for all the time and brings them to pastures so that they can graze.

The loan will be invested to buy cattle pasture land, with which to secure her income.

Mirna continues having the dream of having her own land on which to grow and where she can have more cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle pasture land.

loans.name: Grupo Ramirez Group

texts.es:
“Grupo Ramírez” está ubicado en una comunidad hermosa rodeada de arboles gigantescos, sus habitantes son personas impresionantes, desde muy temprano se levantan para iniciar sus actividades: algunos trabajan en el campo, otros en la construcción o en sus negocios.

Los integrantes del grupo están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en sus actividades, Dionicia invertirá en sus pavos; Oscar y Roberto, en borregos; Reyna, en ropa y Alberto, en su tienda de abarrotes.

Doña Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre esta de muy buen humor, en su comunidad le dicen de cariño Lupita, tiene 35 años de edad, es mamá de dos niñas las cuales aún no estudian y está casada con Don Pedro.

“Nos enteramos de VisionFund porque una vecina nos recomendó institución, ahora nos hemos decidido tomar un préstamo algunos para invertir en nuestros negocios y otros para iniciar uno nuevo” comento Doña Lupita. Ella esta solicitando crédito para comprar borregos, es la primera vez que intentará cuidar animales. No comprará alimento ya que puede aprovechar el campo que tiene cerca de casa aunque sabe que necesita ahorrar para comprar madera y construir un lugar apropiado para tenerlos en buenas condiciones. 

Guadalupe está segura que sus animales crecerán muy bien porque se trata de animales fuertes y resistentes al clima frío de la región donde vive. Ella está muy contenta porque un nuevo negocio representa una oportunidad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijas para cuando comiencen a estudiar. "Lo hago más que nada por ellas, porque quiero lo mejor para las dos, no quisiera que volvieran a pasar por lo que su papá y yo vivimos actualmente”. Uno de los sueños de Doña Lupita es hacer crecer su negocio, tener más animales e iniciar a vender en su comunidad y en otras regiones.
texts.en:
The “Grupo Ramírez” is located in a beautiful community surrounded by huge trees. The inhabitants are impressive people. They get up very early to begin their activities. Some of them work in the country, others in construction or in business. the members of the group are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses. Dionicia will invest in the turkeys; Oscar and Roberto in sheep; Reyna in clothing; Alberto in his grocery store.

Guadalupe is a hard-working woman who is always in good humor. In her community she is called Lupita with affection. She is 35 years old, is the mother of two children who do not study yet and is married to Pedro. "We learned about VisionFund when a neighbor recommended it to us. Now we have decided to take a loan to invest in our businesses and others to start a new one", Lupita comments.

She is requesting a loan to buy sheep. This is the first time she will try to raise animals. She won't buy feed but will take advantage of the fields close to the house. She knows that she will have to buy wood and build a proper place to keep them in good condition. Guadalupe is certain that her animals will grow well as they are strong animals and can resist the cold climate where she lives.

She is very happy because a new business is an opportunity to help with the household expenses and her children when they start school. " I am doing this more for them, as I want the best for them. I don't want what happened to their father and I to happen again". One of her dreams is to expand her business, have more animals and start to sell in her community and in other areas.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

location.town: Ejido la Soledad, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: José Marcial

texts.es:
José, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar, tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela.

José, desde la edad de trece años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura, junto con su padre sembraban 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol.- José, es un hombre trabajador, con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia,  por lo cual no le gusta depender solo de una actividad, es por eso que todavía trabaja en la agricultura y siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, pero además tiene un molino donde brinda el servicio de moler maíz a sus vecinos y tambien cría ganado de repasto. De esta forma logra asegurar los ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto, de esta forma continuará asegurando los ingresos con los cuales ayuda a su familia.

José, desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ayudar a que sus dos hijos continúen estudiando y continuar trabajando en la agricultura y en la críanza de ganado.
texts.en:
José, 40 years old, studied until 6th grade.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have four children, two of whom go to school.

José began working in agriculture at the age of 13.  Together with his father, they planted 10,500 square meters of corn and beans.  José is a hardworking man who wants to get his family ahead.  Therefore, he does not like to rely solely on one job.  This is why he still works in agriculture and plants 7,000 square meters of corn.  Additionally, he has a mill where he offers the service to grind corn to his neighbors, and he also raises cattle in pasture.  In this way he ensure the income to cover the household expenses.

The loan will be used to buy cattle pasture land.  In this way he will continue ensuring the income with which to help his family.

José wants to improve the quality of life for his family, to help his two children continue studying, and to continue working farming and raising cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle pasture land.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 31 years old and single. For a living, he has a small coconut farm in Tudela, Philippines, which is his primary source of income. Jimmy also makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production), and he buys whole coconuts for this. To generate additional earnings, he has a hog raising business. 

He recently needed a loan to pay for more whole coconuts and to purchase bags of feed for his growing hogs, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Jimmy wishes to have more income and to be able to save enough for his future and his would-be family.

loans.use: to pay for more whole coconuts and to purchase bags of feed for his growing hogs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 45-year-old mother, who was gifted with three children. She has been engaged in buying and selling footwear within the public market for almost five years. She aspires to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail an additional of PHP 30,000 to buy more stock of shoes, sandals, and slippers to sell. She believes that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, sandals, and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 55 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Leonita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Leonita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela.

Rosario, ha sido agricultora toda su vida, desde muy pequeña inicio a trabajar  junto a sus padres en la siembra de granos básicos. Actualmente, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca, todo esto lo realiza junto a su pareja, pero además, ambos trabajan como jornaleros en los cañales. 

El crédito será invertido para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde sembrarán maíz, yuca y comprarán  insumos agrícolas.

El sueño de Rosario, sigue siendo que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y tener ganado.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old, has a third grade education, is married to a farmer, and has three children, two of which are in school.  Rosario has been a farmer her whole life.  From a young age, she started working with her parents growing basic grains.  Currently, she has 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 of yucca.  She does all of her farmer with her husband, but they also work as day laborers in the sugarcane fields.

The loan will be used to pay the rent on the land where they plant their corn and yucca, as well as to purchase agricultural supplies.  Rosario's dream is for her children to receive an education, and for her to have livestock.

loans.use: pay the rent for the land where she will grow corn and yucca, and purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Somang

texts.en:
Somang is mother of two young children residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She secures the basics for her household via rice farming and her paid working job.  This is the third loan for Samnang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle gradually. Now, she is applying for 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She highly believes that she can improve the better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana  es una señorita muy entusiasta y sincera que trabaja muy duro todos los días vive junto a sus hermanos y sus padres, en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ella se dedica con mucha alegría y firmeza a la elaboración de pantalones de diferentes estilos y precios. Ella vende su producto en la casa donde vive.
