Esta actividad le gusta realizar la porque por medio de ella se relaciona con su comunidad y conoce a muchas personas; además de ello le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad porque ella empezó a ejercerla desde muy joven aprendiendo de sus padres. Pero ella considera que debe realizar algunos cambios en su tipo de tela por lo que necesita de un prestamo, para comprar telas nuevas y así poder mejor la calidad de su producto.
Ana sueña seguir mejorando sus productos para obtener mejores ganancias y así poder terminar de construir la casa que sus padres no pudieron terminar
texts.en:
Ana is a very enthusiastic and sincere young lady who works very hard every day.  She lives with her siblings and her parents in a neighborhood in Sololá.  She works happily and steadily making pants of different styles and prices.  She sells her products from her house.  She enjoys this work because it allows her to have a relationship with the community and she is able to meet many people.  It also allows her to earn an income so that she can cover her family's basic needs.  She has many years of experience in this field because she started working from a very young age, learning from her parents.

However, she knows that she needs to make a few changes in the fabrics that she uses, which is why she needs a loan so that she can purchase new fabrics and improve the quality of her product.  Ana dreams of continuing to improve her products so that she can increase her revenue and be able to finish building the house that her parents were unable to complete.

loans.use: purchase fabrics to make pants.

loans.name: Fetinaina

texts.en:
Fetinaina is 25 years old and a partner of over 5 years with 2 children.

She makes and sells design materials (elei) to earn a living, and she has been doing this for 1 year. Fetinaina has requested a loan to buy brooms, colored paints, materials, a design board, etc.

She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy brooms, colored paints, materials, a design board, etc.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
This is Normita, 52, and a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She, together with her children, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Normita operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and is sold on the streets. She is also a jeepney operator.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas. Normita hopes that her business will expand soon, and dreams for her children to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients that she needs to prepare more banana cue to sell.

loans.name: San Cristobal 22 Group

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 45 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 11 y 7 años y 3 hijas mujeres de 18, 14 y 9 años y su negocio es la confección y venta de mantas tejidas a mano.
Ella es emprendedora, activa, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Cristóbal’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio de frutas que traen desde el norte de la ciudad en grandes camiones para ser vendidos por mayor a comerciantes que se encargan de repartirla en diferentes mercados, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 4-16 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Paulina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que utiliza con sus familiares, en el trabajo habla español (sentada al centro). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y que cuenta con agua potable, alcantarillado y electricidad. El sueño por mejorar su calidad de vida para mejorar el futuro de sus hijos la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; artesanía en yeso, venta de sándwiches, librería, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa, venta de productos cosméticos y venta de fruta, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la confección y venta de mantas para cholita elaboradas a mano con crochet; trabajo que realiza desde hace 18 años, ella se encarga de la confección de mantas, mantillas, ponchos y otros; realizando la compra de los materiales como, lana (de oveja, de alpaca, vicuña), hilo, etc., para luego encargarse de la venta en su puesto de venta fijo en inmediaciones de la misma zona. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes tipos de lana al precio por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra lana de oveja, vicuña y alpaca; para ampliar su oferta y darles apoyo a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 45 year old woman who lives with her spouse.  She has two sons who are ages 11 and 7, and three daughters who are 18, 14 and 9 years old.  She has a business making making and selling handwoven blankets.  She is enterprising, active, optimistic, responsible and hardworking.  She sells her blankets in the San Cristobal area, which is known for selling fruit that is brought from the north of the city on big trucks in order to sell them in bulk to businesses that distribute them in different markets.  The region's climate is cold and dry, with an average temperature between 4 and 16 degrees celsius.  

Paulina is of dark complexion and has long, dark, braided hair.  She is short and dresses traditionally.  Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family.  At work, she speaks Spanish.  She lives with her husband who works in construction, and her children who are in school.  They live in a rented house that is made of brick with a corrugate metal roof.  The house has running water, a sewer system and electricity.  Her dream of improving her family's quality of life led her to forming a communal bank with people who have businesses such as: plaster crafts, sandwich sales, bookstores, beverage sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, and fruit sales.  Together they seek loans and improve their businesses.

Paulina's business is making and selling blankets, shawls, ponchos and other items.  She purchases her materials, wool (from lambs, alpacas, llamas), thread, etc, and later sells her products in the same area where she lives.  Her dream is for her children to be professionals.  She hopes to purchase different types of wool at wholesale prices.  For these reasons, Paulina is seeking a loan to purchase wool from lambs, llamas and alpacas, in order to expand her offerings and support her children in their studies.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in her 18 years in business.

loans.use: purchase wool from lambs, llamas and alpacas in order to expand her offerings.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 54 years old, married, and has eight children. Two of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Milaluna

texts.en:
Milaluna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milaluna is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Milaluna has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sardines and noodles, among others.

Milaluna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Milaluna would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sardines and noodles, among others

loans.name: Hernolina

texts.en:
Hernolina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hernolina is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.

Hernolina has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Hernolina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Hernolina has been in this business for 25 years. Hernolina would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Аида сейчас живет с родителями и ее тремя маленькими дочерьми. Супруг Аиды находится на заработках в России, ежемесячно он высылает денежные переводы. В хозяйстве Аиды есть 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 3 нетели. Ее ежемесячная прибыль с учетом доходов супруга составляет около 35,000 сом (KGS). Аида вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота, что позволит получить здоровый приплод весной. Доходы от кредита Аида будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, в будущем она хочет приобрести породистых дойных коров.
texts.en:
Aida successfully paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her financially. She now lives with her parents and her three young daughters. Her husband is working in Russia and sends money every month. She has two dairy cows, two steers and three heifers on her farm with a monthly income, including the money from her husband, of about 35,000 KGS.

Aida has again turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 75,000 KGS to purchase livestock feed, which will allow her animals to give birth to healthy offspring in the spring. She will put profits from the loan into further developing her business, and in the future she wants to acquire thoroughbred dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed in order to invest in her business and so her animals will have healthy offspring

loans.name: Toeurng

texts.en:
Toeurng is the one breadwinner in the family, with one dependent daughter residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Her main source of income is from rice farming. Toeurng is not a new borrower for VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past two cycles completely, with a good improvement in return. 

Now, she is applying for 2,000,000 KHR. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed for growing. She hopes that she can gain a good income, so that she can improve her lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Kim Ay

texts.en:
Kim Ay is villager from the Koh Krorlor district of Battambang province. Rice farming is the main source of income for her neighborhood as well as for her family. This business has earned her a decent income to secure the basic necessities for her family.

Now, she is applying for her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s field partner) to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crops. She has high hopes that with a better income she will be able to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en:
Iuliana is 20 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for more than two years. Iuliana has requested a loan to buy yeast, flour, cooking oil, a fry pan, etc. 

She joined SPBD in January to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iuliana will extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy yeast, flour, sugar, a fry pan, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Heading into the month of February, it began to rain. This is the right time for planting crops in accordance with the rainy season.

Six months ago, the Tunjung Wiguna group used a loan to buy pigs and to buy seeds for the garden. Their plan proved successful: they had satisfactory results, both from the pigs and the gardens. They can now meet the needs of their families and save money.

Since the rainy season is still going, the Tunjung Wiguna group is borrowing again. They are continuing with their plans to buy piglets as well as seeds for the garden. Almost all of the members of the group buy corn seeds because it is very suitable for the rainy season.

Ni Ketut used the loan to buy piglets and paddy seeds to be planted in her field. Ni Ketut also buys fertilizer with her own savings. Ni Ketut hopes to get optimal results so that she can continue the business with her own money.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and paddy seeds.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa mercedes’ un sitio céntrico, caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante el transporte público, desde este lugar se puede encontrar transporte público a lugares alejados de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Lucia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado estilo cola de caballo, su lengua materna es el Aymara que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con su hijo que estudia; Viven en la casa del padre de ella que esta construida de ladrillo y tiene techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, alcantarillado, gas domiciliario y electricidad, esta ubicada frente a un colegio, por ese motivo inicio Su negocio de venta de artículos de librería, como; lápices, bolígrafos, cuadernos, hojas blancas, papel de colores, reglas, marcadores, etc. Labor que realiza durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, los domingos se dedica a su familia; realizando paseos, y limpieza del hogar. Sus artículos de librería tienen ventas constantes debido a que el colegio es un publico constante, las ventas bajan en época de vacaciones, utilizando esas fechas para realizar el inventario y reposición de los materiales faltantes. “inicie mi negocio porque mi casa se encuentra al frente de un colegio, ya llevo más de 6 meses de antigüedad, los clientes me hacen pedidos de acuerdo a sus necesidades y casi toda la mercadería se vende con normalidad…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una librería grande y bien consolidada. Ella desea abastecer su stock con material escolar como libros, textos escolares, cuentos, cuadernos y otros, para comenzar el nuevo año escolar preparada con todos los materiales necesarios para la oferta. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 meses que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lucia solicita un préstamo para la compra de material escolar para abastecer su stock y recibir a los niños con todo el material escolar necesario para el inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 29 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has an 11 year old son. She has a business selling bookstore items.

She is a good mother. She’s independent, enterprising, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and hard-working. She works in the “Villa Mercedes” area. This is a centrally located area, connected to various parts of the city by public transportation. From here, public transportation to far reaching parts of the city can be found. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that during the day between 4-12 degrees centigrade year-round. It is 3800 meters above sea level.

Lucia is short, with dark complexion and long black hair tied in a pony tail. Her native tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in the community and in her business.

She shares her life with her partner who works, and with her son, who studies. They live in her father’s house. It is built of brick and has a sheet metal roof. It has drinking water, a sewage system, gas and electricity. It is located in front of a school. That is why she started a business selling bookstore items such as pencils, pens, notebooks, sheets of blank paper, colored paper, rulers, markers, etc. She does this Monday through Saturday. She spends Sundays with her family, going on outings and cleaning house.

Her bookstore items sell steadily since the school provides a constant stream of customers. Her sales decrease during vacation, and she uses that time to take inventory and restock missing materials.

“I started my business because my house is in front of a school, and I have been doing it for six months. My customers make requests according to their needs and nearly all the merchandise sells regularly…” she says.

Her dream is to have a large well-established bookstore. She would like to replenish her stock with school supplies such as books, textbooks, storybooks, notebooks and other materials, in order to begin the school year offering all the necessary supplies.

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 months that she has been engaged in this business. It is for this reason that Lucia is seeking a loan to buy school supplies to replenish her stock so that she’ll have all the necessary materials for the children when classes start.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to replenish her stock so that she’ll have all the necessary materials for the children when classes start.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA LUZ II, la socia Nilda se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatillas de diferentes tipos de modelos y colores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas para damas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to the communal bank NUEVA LUZ II. Nilda makes a living in the business of selling shoes of different types of models and colors. She has a good time with her business, which is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to continue working in this way to support her family.

Nilda requests a loan to buy shoes for ladies. 

She feels grateful for the loan given and she promises to make her payments

loans.use: to buy shoes for ladies.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has nine children who are currently in school.

Analyn has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell. Analyn has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Arlyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock businesses. Arlyn is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 24 years old and has a live-in partner.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jasmin has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, candies, biscuits, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. In the future, Jasmin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kulbarakan

texts.ru: Кульбаракан, 57 лет, замужем. У Кульбаракан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи уже 4 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 коз. Благодаря упорному труду Кульбаракан, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Кульбаракан решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить благосостояние и дальше развивать бизнес.
texts.en:
Kulbarakan is 57 and married. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry for four years as the primary source of income for her family. She has two cows and 30 goats on her farm. Thanks to her hard work, her business brings in about 15,000 KGS per month, which covers her family's basic food and living expenses. 

Kulbarakan has decided to develop her business and has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase livestock. Profits from the loan will allow her to improve her living conditions and to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида, 50 лет, не замужем, есть дочь - студентка. У Фариды высшее образование, работает лаборатном химического анализа. Фарида получает ежемесячную заработную плату в размере примерно 18,500 сом (KGS). В целях улучшения жилищных условий своей семьи, а именно ремонта отопительной системы, Фарида решила обратиться в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку труб и отопительного котла. Свои доходы Фарида старается вкладывать в воспитание и образование ее дочери, а в будущем хочет накопить на ее свадьбу.
texts.en:
Farida is 50 and single with a daughter who goes to university. She has a higher education and works as a laboratory assistant doing chemical analysis. She receives a monthly salary of about 18,500 KGS.

With the goal of improving her family's living conditions, specifically in fixing the heating system in her home, Farida decided to turn to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase pipes and a boiler. She tries to put her income toward food costs and to pay for her daughter's education, and in the future wants to save toward her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase pipes and a boiler to repair the heating system in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventories for her general store.

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru: Райкан, 50 лет, замужем, 6 детей, самому младшему 14 лет, старшему 27 лет. У Райкан среднее образование. Она по характеру: спокойная, любезная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Райкан, в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух нетелей. Доходы от кредита Райкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет достроить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Raikan is 50 and married with six children aged 14 to 27. She has a high school education and is a calm, loving and hardworking person. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two cows and one horse on her farm.

With the goal of further developing her business, Raikan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase two heifers. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm, and in the future wants to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Atafasia

texts.en:
Atafasia is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling donuts in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital.

Atafasia has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, yeast, a box of chickens, etc.

With her earnings, Atafasia will expand her business and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, yeast, a bag of chickens, a bag of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Tealofa

texts.en:
Tealofa is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 4 years.

Tealofa has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, oil, sugar, etc. With her earnings, Tealofa will improve her business and pay for her children's education.

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Puipui

texts.en:
Puipui is a 24-year-old, single woman, with no children. She has a small plantation and grows eggplants, beans, cabbages, cucumbers, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Puipui has requested a loan to buy wires, seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Puipui hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wires, chemicals, seeds, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Faatoese

texts.en: Faatoese is a 58 years old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a business selling daily consumption items such as tinned fish, sugar, flour, rice, salt, etc in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Faatoese has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, boxes of tinned fish, salt, rice, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, tinned fish, cooking oil, setc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 54 years old, married, and has one child. 

Marilou is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming rice for 30 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activities.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amy is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Amy has a transportation business in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and to pay for maintenance for her bus.

Amy has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay for maintenance for her bus

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is single and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rona has been in this business for ten years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Rona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 31 years old and single. Leah works very hard to provide for her family.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, spices, etc. 

Leah has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell in her stall.

Melita has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 44 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Virgenia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing and raising pigs. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lany is 38 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Lany has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lany requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Lany has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 47 years old and married with seven children.

Myra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

Myra has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Myra aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps ASMA's husband to fix his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps ZAWEENA with purchasing raw embroidery material for her daughters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her son to sell.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marylou works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Marylou is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Marylou has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lakana

texts.en:
Lakana is a 20-year-old civil servant who lives in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She is also pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in human resource management; she is in her first year of university in the province.

As a young civil servant, Lakana earns USD $5 per day. Her parents own a grocery store and they also sell porridge and Khmer noodles.

Now she is lacking sufficient finances to cover her university fees from first to second year, so she would like to take out a loan. This loan will help her in earning an associate’s degree successfully. Lakana’s dream after graduation is to pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to cover her university fees

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA LUZ II, la socia Natalia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Natalia belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Luz II" (New Light II). The member makes a living raising small animals such as guinea pigs. She has had her business for quite some time, and she does well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. The member wishes to continue working so that, this way, she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs. The member is grateful for the loan that she is being given, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA LUZ II, la socia Hilaria se dedica al negocio de venta de madera, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilaria belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Luz II" (New Light II). The member makes a living selling wood. She has had her business for quite some time, and she does well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. The member wishes to continue working so that, this way, she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy wood. The member is grateful for the loan that she is being given, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Pologa

texts.en:
Pologa is a 57-year-old single woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Pologa has requested a loan to buy weed spray, chemicals, knives, rakes, seeds, etc. With her profits, Pologa hopes to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, chemicals, knives, rakes, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Minandra

texts.en:
Minandra sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy additional ingredients and supplies needed in their food stall business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional ingredients like bananas, sugar, and oil to increase her profit from the business. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Minandra wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, and oil needed in her food stall business

loans.name: Ave

texts.en: Ave is 28 years old and single with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling dry curry and rice in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of rice, boxes of chicken legs, bags of sugar, etc. In the future, Ave hopes to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, boxes of chicken legs, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
Susima is 46 years old and has seven children. Susima is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Susima is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Susima requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susima has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Binga

texts.en:
Binga is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell for her business.

Binga has been in this business for 5 years. Binga earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell for her business

loans.name: Anadela

texts.en:
Anadela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Anadela successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Anadela's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Josefina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sugar, powdered milk and other ingredients for her cafeteria business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines. Shirley is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of cosmetics, laundry soap and other personal products to sell.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of cosmetics, laundry soap and other personal products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps RUBINA's husband with purchasing seasonal and fresh vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a CNG kit for her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Ran Group

texts.en:
Ran is a 36-year-old married rice farmer with two children who lives in the Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 10 years. The two children attend school. Her husband is 37 years old and is also a rice farmer. Together, they can make an income of USD $9 per day. 

Now Ran, who is a group leader, would like to apply for a group loan of three members. She will use her portion to buy the foundation parts of a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live in hygienic living conditions. 

For Ran’s future goals, she wants to buy more farmland to grow rubber trees, build a new house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy the foundation parts of a latrine

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en: Leonesa is 20 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling canteen in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, flour, snacks, a box of noodles, and plastic cups etc. In the future, Leonesa hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a box of noodles, snacks, sugar, a sack of flour, plastic cups etc

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
After 6 months of maintaining fattening pigs and chilies in her garden, Ni Nengah successfully earned a satisfactory result. After deducting the amount spent on feed, medicines and fertilizer, the net benefit was 500,000 IDR per month. From these results, Ni Nengah paid off the loan to MUK of 1,500,000 IDR and then she and the group of Wiguna Merta proposed for a new loan to MUK. These loans are very necessary to increase business capital for pigs and farming, so they can supplement the family income.

Her only daily activities are as a farmer with her husband. Ni Nengah and some friends formed a group for pigs that has been running for 10 periods. With the help of venture capital loans from MUK of 1,500,000 IDR per member, Ni Nengah developed the pigs group of Wiguna Merta and she became its head.

Furthermore, Ni Nengah will use this loan to buy three local piglets for fattening, each 500,000 IDR. Ni Nengah will buy feed and corn seeds for the garden with her own money. She hopes for next six months the pigs will have a good growth, which will increase sales results. The support from her husband also encouraged Ni Nengah to work hard with the pig livestock business and the garden.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is an honest woman. She is 42 years old. She lives in Gissar district with her husband and children. Her husband works in Russia. Aziza is a seamstress. She has engaged in this activity for the past three years. She sews national women's dresses and window curtains. Her daughter also helps her. Now Aziza wants to expand her activity and to buy clothes for her children. But she does not have enough money. Her husband`s work is not good now. For  this reason Aziza applied for a loan. She will spend the loan amount to buy different fabrics. Aziza hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Saliao

texts.en:
Saliao is 52 years old and married with four children. She has a small business of making and selling siapo (taba cloth) in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy two design boards, paints and a wheelbarrow. 

In the future, Saliao hopes to save more for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in December 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy two elei (design) boards, paints and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 41, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of five single children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $2.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cuna De Belén Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo Cuna de Belén se conocen muy bien ya que son vecinos de la misma comunidad y entre ellos existe una muy buena relación.

Doña Gilberta es una persona muy alegre su estado de animo contagia a los demás miembros de su grupo, ella tiene 52 años de edad, fue madre de nueve hijos  de los cuales ya solo una de sus niñas más pequeñas se encuentra estudiando, formó su hermosa familia con su marido Don Rosendo. Mientras él trabajaba en la construcción de casas, a Doña Gilberta se le ocurrió iniciar con la cría de animales para después venderlos y así ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ya que para Don Rosendo era complicado poder cubrir todos los gastos.

Doña Gilberta adquirió experiencia al lado de su madre cuando era pequeña y ya cuenta con 35 años de experiencia en el cuidado de pollos, pavos, borregos, cerdos y becerros. Desde muy temprano, se levanta para atender a su familia y después a sus animales, siempre ha aprovechado el campo que tiene en su comunidad para alimentar a los animales. Sin embargo, los cerdos son los animales más dedicados y para ellos necesita comprar alimento especial, que es en lo que necesita invertir actualmente. Gracias a los préstamos de VisionFund sus animales han crecido favorablemente por lo que se siente agradecida. 

Con las ganancias de su negocio, ahora Gilberta puede comprar con mayor facilidad alimentos, zapatos y material para la escuela de sus hijos. También logró arreglar dos habitaciones en su casa y está a punto de construir dos más. Ahora, para Rosendo es mucho más fácil solventar sus gastos y se siente apoyado por su mujer, sobre todo cuando no está trabajando en algún proyecto. 

Uno de los sueños de gilberta es poder seguir apoyando a su hija que está estudiando su educación secundaria. “Me gustaría que mi niña pudiera estudiar una carrera profesional para tener un empleo mejor pagado y pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida”.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Feliza y Lucina quienes invertirán en cerdos; Cirilo, en abarrotes; Paulina, en borregos y Josefina y Rufina, en pollos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Doña Feliza la representante del grupo, ella viste una playera guinda y Doña Gilberta un suéter rojo*
texts.en:
The members of Cuna de Belén Group know each other very well because they're neighbors in the same community, and they enjoy good relations among themselves.

Gilberta, 52, is a very happy person and her state of mind is contagious among the other members of her group.  She was the mother of nine children, of whom only one of her youngest daughters is still in school.  She had a wonderful family with her husband Rosendo.  While he was working building houses, Gilberta decided to start raising animals to sell so she could help with the household expenses and her children's education, because it was difficult for Rosendo to cover all the expenses.

Gilberta learned at her mother's side when she was little and now has 35 years of experience taking care of chickens, ducks, lambs, pigs, and calves.  She gets up very early to take care of her family and then her animals.  She has always made the most of the land in her community to feed her animals.  The pigs are her most labor-intensive animals, however, and she needs to buy special food for them.  This is what she needs to invest in right now.  Thanks to loans from VisionFund her animals have grown favorably, for which she's grateful.

With the profits from her business, now it's easier for Gilberta to buy food, shoes, and school supplies for her children.  She also managed to fix up two bedrooms in her house and she's about to build two more.  And it's a lot easier for Rosendo to cover the expenses now, and he feels his wife supports him, especially when he's not working on some project.

One of Gilberta's dreams is to be able to keep on supporting her daughter, who's in secondary school.  "I would like for my daughter to be able to study for a profession so she can have a better-paying job and a better quality of life."

The other group members are Feliza and Lucina, who invest in pigs; Cirilo, groceries; Paulina, lambs; and Josefina and Rufina, chickens.

*The photograph was taken at Feliza's house; she's the representative of the group.  She's wearing a cherry-red t-shirt; Gilberta, a red sweater.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Rowena and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. 

She is 39 years old, married and has three children attending school. 

She has been engaged in selling a variety of products within the public market for almost 22 years. She aims to further improve her business and increase her income in order to sustain their necessities and finance the education of her children. 

Being a hardworking mother, she believes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more face powders, toothpastes, remotes, mirrors, combs and school  supplies to resell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of nine children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Nelly is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Anita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of items like noodles, sugar, sardines, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items like noodles, sugar, sardines, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Bessy

texts.en: Hello lenders. Meet Bessy, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. Bessy, 47, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Bessy is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Chuka area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Bessy could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Bessy, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Bessy believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Bessy to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Dany Abimael

texts.es:
Dany tiene 27 años de edad en estos momentos reside en compañía de sus padres y tres hermanos, de los cuales solamente dos de ellos son dependientes de sus padres por ser menores de edad, anteriormente el joven obtuvo su titulo de secundaria como perito mercantil, hoy en día se siente orgulloso de poder estar en la culminación de su carrera universitaria considerando que es el mejor patrimonio que puede heredar de sus padres y de él mismo.

Su motivación esta basada en la superación personal, profesional y económica para así poder brindar mejor condiciones de vida a su familia, menciona que las se debe ser decidido y persistente para alcanzar las metas que se establecen en la vida, se considera un joven entusiasta, activo, visionario. Espera poder contribuir en el desarrollo de su país.
texts.en:
Dany is 27 years old. At this time, he lives with his parents and his three siblings, of whom only two are dependent on his parents because they are minors. He previously obtained his secondary degree with a specialization in business. Today he feels proud to be at the end of his university program, considering that it is the best legacy that he can receive from his parents and from himself.

His motivation is based on personal, professional, and economic self-improvement in order to be able to offer better living conditions to his family. He mentions that one must be determined and persistent to achieve the goals that are established in life. He considers himself an enthusiastic, active, and visionary young man. He hopes to be able to contribute to the development of his country.

loans.use: to finish his studies in logistics engineering

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE,la socia sigue dedicándose  a la venta de muebles de madera, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de roperos.
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” .
texts.en:
Communal bank member Isabel belongs to the communal bank "Velasco Astete." She continue working in the sale of wood furniture. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the established payments. She is a responsible and persevering person, since this is the way in which she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase wardrobes.

She belongs to the communal bank "Velasco Astete."

loans.use: to purchase wardrobes

loans.name: Aiganofolelei

texts.en:
Aiganofolelei is a 56-year-old widow with six children. She owns and operates a business venture of sewing and selling clothes. She has more than 10 years of experience in this line of business. 

Aiganofolelei needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, fabrics and hangers. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her grandchildren's school fees and to support her family. She joined SPBD in December 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, scissors, fabrics and hangers

loans.name: Liz Yanira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA LUZ II, la socia Liz Yanira  se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa  como casacas, polos, chompas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende a pedido para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank Nueva Luz (New Light). Member Liz Yanera works in the business of selling jackets, t-shirts, and sweaters, among other items. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She sells on order for her customers who make requests. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for a loan to purchase jackets.

She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy jackets to sell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 54 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Emelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Limhorn

texts.en:
Limhorn, 38, is originally from Kampong Cham Province. She has three children in total who are currently in school. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business and grows and sells rice to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this business for 20 years and earns, on average, USD $3 a day.

Limhorn is residing a little bit far from the water source, so it is hard and time consuming for her to get water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a well for household use. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get the water to use easier and spend shorter time than before.

She is thankful for the lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia sigue con su negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería como golosinas, arroz entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Celia belongs to the communal bank "Velasco Astete." She continues with her grocery store business. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the established payments. She continues selling merchandise such as candy and rice, among other items, to all the customers who come to her. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase oil and milk, among other items.

loans.use: to buy oil and milk, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, gaseosas, agua, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la gasolinera que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su casa el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, su hermana y su sobrina, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos ya que le ha ido bien sus ventas en estos últimos meses y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The youth's face is pixelated because he is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He makes a living selling soft drinks, juices, soda water, water, etc. His business is located inside a gas station that is close to his home. 

What he keeps from his sales helps him with his household expenses. He lives at home with his mother, his sister and his niece. 

He is asking for a new loan to buy more products as his sales in the last few months have gone well. The loan will help him earn more revenue for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, soda water, water, etc.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE,la socia sigue  dedicándose a la costura y alquiler de cuartos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de lanas de diferentes tipos de colores entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Irma, belongs to the Communal Bank “Velasco Astete”. The member continues to make a living sewing and renting rooms. She is grateful for the loan she received and she promises to make all the scheduled repayments.  The member is a responsible and diligent individual, this is how she gets her family ahead.

The member requested the loan to buy wool of different types of colors among other supplies.

loans.use: to buy wool of different types of colors among other supplies.

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Norma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma sigue con su negocio de venta de lechones y tamales para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para  la compra de manteca, entre otros.
texts.en:
The group member Norma belongs to the communal bank VELASCO ASTETE. The bank is located in the Cusco District, in the Cusco Province, and the Department of Cusco. 

Norma continues with her business selling roasted pork and tamales to fill the different orders that her customers solicit. Norma feels grateful for the loan and she promises to make all of the payments. She is a responsible and persevering woman; being this way is how she moves her family forward. Norma is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter and other things.

loans.use: to purchase butter and other things

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao, de 54 años de edad, es comerciante, se dedica a las ventas de helados en las canchas de futbol de su comunidad los fines de semana y los días de semana los utiliza para trabajos de agricultura y venta de pescado fresco, está casado y tiene dos hijos.-

Estanislao, se creció con sus padres, ellos se dedicaban a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos. Con el paso del tiempo decidió independizarse y formar su familia, gracias a las ganancias que le generan las ventas del comercio de pescado, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 

Estanislao, tiene 29 años de experiencia en realizar actividades comerciales; los trabajos de agricultura lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor y es lo que lo ha llevado ser una persona de éxito en su vida y ser un ejemplo para su familia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar helados para su negocio, el mejoramiento de las instalaciones de su tienda y pagar el alquiler de una máquina para recoger la cosecha de maíz.

Los sueños, que tiene para un futuro son apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, también, comenzar a cultivar peces ya que cuenta con un terreno que está bien adecuado para el trabajo de crianza.
texts.en:
Estanislao, who is 54 years old, is a businessman. He sells ice cream at the soccer fields in his community on weekends, and he uses the weekdays to work in agriculture and sell fresh fish. He is married and has two children.

Estanislao grew up with his parents. They worked in agriculture as their principal source of income. With the passing of time, he decided to become independent and form his family. Thanks to the earnings that his fish sales business generates, he has managed to raise his family.

Estanislao has 29 years of experience in commercial activities. He learned the agricultural work from his parents, who educated him and raised him with love, and this is what has brought him to be a successful person in life and an example for his family.

The money will be used to buy ice cream for his business, improve the facilities at his store, and pay to rent a machine to harvest the corn crop.

The dreams that he has for the future are to support his children in their education and also to begin to raise fish, since he has a plot of land that is well suited for the work of raising them.

loans.use: to buy ice cream for his business, improve the facilities at his store, and pay to rent a machine to harvest the corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to help bolster her income

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee junto con su esposo un taller de carpintería desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de laminas y polines y así ella y su familia puedan vivir más cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She and her husband have had a carpentry workshop for several years, the sales from which help them to get ahead. 

She wants to improve her home by replacing her roof, but with what she makes from her job she doesn't have enough to do so. Due to this, she is asking Integral for a loan to buy sheet metal and support beams so that she and her family can live more comfortably and secure.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and support beams

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita has mastered her swine production in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she makes a living supporting her husband in raising their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to receive credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always apply for any financing she may need. This loan of PHP 35,000 will be used to purchase bags of lactating feeds for her swine, bags of animal feeds and vitamins for her piglets and to pay for construction materials to build a concrete pig pen. Carmelita hopes and prays that her business will grow because that will help her save enough for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family and be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of lactating feeds for her swine, bags of animal feeds and vitamins for her piglets and to pay for construction materials to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is from Pagadian. She and her husband have a riceland and earn a living doing farming activities. Recently, Rosita requested a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland. She hopes to yield more harvest. Rosita deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase carabao to plow and harrow their wetland

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has been preparing considerably for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Mahayag. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and requested a loan. Elizabeth hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Concepcion is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Concepcion has a food vending business in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rorm

texts.en: A rice grower residing in Battambang province, Rorm is a mother of two schoolchildren. Rorm has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for eight past cycles loan already with successful repayment. Her living condition has improved gradually. Now she is applying for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She firmly believes that she can keep earning more income so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a  new welding plant for her son to weld iron accessories.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is a 47-year-old married mother of two grownup children, and is from the Takeo province of Cambodia. Sopheap and her husband, who is 46 years old, have cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1980. One of the children is a factory worker and another is a tailor. All of them can earn an income of USD 14 each day. Sopheap is requesting a loan for her child. The child will use a portion to buy more clothes to sell and to buy construction materials to renovate the tailoring shop. This loan will help her child earn more income to support the family. Sopheap's goal in the future is to build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and to buy construction materials to renovate the tailoring shop

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, oil, etc. In the future, May hopes to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, oil, etc

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry, 44 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Chan Province, Cambodia. He has six children in total; two are married and live independently while the other four are single and live under his support. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business in a small farmland. He primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market.

So far, he has been in this type of business for almost 30 years. On average, he is able to earn USD 3.00 a day. Currently, he would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of traveling. He is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers. Leah successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Leah's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Living in a rural village of Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Ra is 36 years old and married with children. Her three young children are not yet independent. To finance her family's needs, she and her husband have been rice farmers for 18 years. When he is not farming, her husband is a paid worker at a local construction materials shop. A new member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Ra is applying for a loan for her rice farm. She is going to use it to buy fertilizer. She is hoping that her rice farming will be more fruitful and earn her more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en: Voeun is 60 years old. He is a widowed motorcycle taxi driver who lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He has run a motorcycle taxi service for over five years. One of his children works in a factory and another is a blacksmith. The family can make approximately USD 20 a day. Voeun thinks that his motorcycle has a small space for his clients, so he would like to get a loan to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle with a trailer) to run a taxi service. With the loan, he will have enough money to buy the tuk tuk and earn more income to support his family. Voeun's future plan is to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle with a trailer) to run a taxi service

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom, 63, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has six children in total; one is single and five are married. To make a living, she has been involved in a farming business since 1990. She grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 2.50 a day on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business making barquillos (biscuit rolls) in the Philippines. Helen  is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her barquillos-making business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business making barquillos (biscuit rolls)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han, 58, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children in total; three are single and one is married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business. She grows rice and vegetable and sells her agriculture products to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for forty years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation.

loans.name: Jose Artulo

texts.es:
José, de 39 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene 2 hijos y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de tortillas en el parque del pueblo.

José, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de chófer desde la edad de 10 años, esta actividad la aprendió junto a su padre, a quien le acompañaba todos los días en sus jornadas laborales, ya que su papá trabajaba como chofer de una panadería; pero luego dejo su trabajo por motivos de enfermedad y fue retomado por José

José, decidido continuar ejerciendo estas actividades ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia, pues ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el parque se su municipio.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que en la parte exterior de su casa pretende construir una cocina y también va comprar una motocicleta, que le servirá para desplazarse a su lugar de trabajo.

Los sueños de José son tener una vivienda digna, compra un vehículo y apoyar en la educación de su hijo, ya que el sueña con ser ingeniero agrónomo.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, has a partner and two kids. His partner takes care of the home and sells tortillas in the town park. 


José has made a living as a chauffeur since he was 10 years old. He learned it from his father, whom he accompanied every day while he worked as a chauffeur for a bakery. His father later left his job due to illness at which point José took over.

José decided to continue this work as it has become his principal source of income. His wife also contributes financially to the family, as she makes a living selling tortillas in the municipal park.
