The money will be used to buy construction materials for they want to build a kitchen in the exterior part of their house. It will also be used to buy a motorcycle to get to work. 

José's dream is to have a respectable home, buy a vehicle and support the education of his son, who's dream is to be an agricultural engineer.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can build a kitchen in the back of his house and also buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 62 years old and married with one child in school.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and re-paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Evangeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en: Residing in a small village in Battambong province, Chan is a 61-year-old divorced woman with four children, and one of them is still living under her roof. Her main source of income is from selling cotton, which she has done for 12 years. Her secondary occupation is a paid-worker. Chan has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for nine cycles. The previous loans have helped her living standard to be improved. She is now leading a group of five. She is seeking for a loan of 1,800,000 KHR. Her portion of the loan is used to buy cotton for her retail business. With that in mind, she is hoping to expand her cotton business.

loans.use: to buy cotton for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase leather for sewing gloves.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is from Calaca-an, Plaridel, in the Philippines. She is 46 years old, married and has four children; one of whom is still in school. Wilma and her husband have a livestock business, they raise goats, native chickens, and cows. To generate more income, Wilma wants to engage in a pig raising business. To make this possible, she availed herself of a loan to purchase construction materials to build a pig pen and buy two piglets as a start up. Wilma deeply wishes that her business will grow and continue so that she will earn more income and be able to save enough for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a pig pen and buy two piglets as a start up for her livestock business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Meet Grace, aged 48, a smallholder crop and dairy farmer based in Eldoret, Kenya. She has four children. She has been doing dairy farming for seven years now. Her primary source of income is milk and crops. Grace is seeking a loan from Kiva via Juhudi Kilimo to expand her banana farming. This venture will diversify her product portfolio and help her manage risks that may affect a single line of product. With banana farming, she will be able to sell bananas and other banana products such as banana leaves in the market to boost her income. She will also use the banana leaves in feeding her animals, which will result in increased milk production. The money will help her manage to pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to smallholder farmers and making financial loans to farmers affordable. She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand her banana farming activity.

loans.name: Soheanh's Group

texts.en:
Aged 26, Soheanh, is a married woman with two sons that are under the age of six.  Her family is living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them have been working for eight years. The two jobs help them save roughly 10 USD a day.
 
As a new member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner and a leader of her group, Soheanh is applying for 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy rice seed and to hire workers to plow her rice field. Her goal of the loan is to improve her rice yield and produce more income.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and to hire workers to plow her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en: Cinderella is 20 years old and shes only child in the family. She is enrolling in an Information Technology course. She is borrowing to fully pay the tuition fees of the skills training. When she graduates, Cinderella plans to graduate and be gainfully employed and help her family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing over-lock machine and clothing for sewing garments for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Pacita has been farming sugarcane for 13 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Los Ganaderos Unidos Group

texts.es:
El nombre “Los Ganaderos Unidos” fue inspirado porque entre los integrantes existe una gran unión, siempre están en constante comunicación, se apoyan mutuamente en cualquier circunstancia además de que todos se dedican a al cría de animales. José Luciano y Alberto invertirán su préstamo en becerros; Valentina y Cecilia, en becerros y Don Miguel, en cerdos su gran pasión.

Don Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador y amable, tiene 63 años de edad, está casado con la señora Luisa quien se dedica al hogar, pero algunas veces también ayuda en el negocio de los cerdos. Juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende de ellos y se encuentra estudiando su educación primaria. 

Ya son 22 años desde que Don Miguel decidió iniciar esta actividad, “Yo no tenia un empleo fijo y los gastos de nuestros hijos eran demasiado entre alimentación, calzado y educación por eso dedcidí criar animales” comentó Don Miguel quien compró una cerda desde un principio, afortunadamente en ese tiempo también había tenido buena cosecha de maíz que empleó como alimento y su cerdita creció muy bien. Como resultado del esfuerzo y dedicación en el crecimiento de su primera cerdita en cuatro meses ya tenía 10 lechones más. La única dificultad en ese entonces era la falta de un corral de buen tamaño.

Don Miguel esta muy agardecido conVisionFund y KIVA porque lleva 16 años solicitando préstamos los cuáles le han ayudado a expandir su negocio. Actualmente tiene 12 cerdas y 41 lechones, además de una enorme nave con capacidad impresionante donde podría tener aún más cerdos.

Todos los días Don Miguel trabaja con sus animales, los clientes llegan directamente a su casa. “Estos animales han sido mi salvación para solventar todos los gastos de mi hogar y la educación de mis hijos”.

Esta vez esta solicitando crédito para comprar más cerdas, Don Miguel ha adquirido mucha experiencia y sus ganancias son buenas, sin embargo se ve en aprietos cuando el alimento aumenta de precio. En algunas ocasiones ha pedido prestado al dueño de la tienda donde lo compra para poder tener las toneladas de diferentes tipos de alimento. Aún con algunas dificultades, Don Miguel no se detiene para lograr sus metas: tener una nave aún más grande, tener más animales, equilibrar sus gastos y algún día dejar de solicitar créditos. 

*La fotografia fue tomada en el municipio en las escaleras del quiosco, Don Miguel es quien tiene el suéter rojo*
texts.en:
The name "Los Ganaderos Unidos" [The United Ranchers] was inspired by the great bond between members. They are always in constant communication, they help each other in any circumstance, and they are all dedicated to raising animals. José Luciano and Alberto will invest their loan in calves, Valentina and Cecilia will invest in calves as well, and Don Miguel in pigs, his great passion.

Don Miguel is a very hardworking and friendly man. He is 63 years old and is married to Mrs. Luisa who is a housewife, although she sometimes helps out in the pig business. Together they have a family with seven children of which only one is dependent and is currently studying elementary education.

It has been 22 years since Don Miguel decided to begin his business. "I did not have a steady job and the expenses of our children were too much between food, shoes, and education and because of this I decided to breed animals," said Don Miguel who bought a sow at first. Fortunately, at this time he also had a good crop of corn that he used as food and his little pig grew very well. As a result of his effort and dedication to the growth of his first little pig, in four months he already had 10 piglets more. The only difficulty at that time was that he did not have a good sized corral. 

Don Miguel is very thankful to VisionFund and Kiva because he's been taking out loans for 16 years which he has used to expand his business. He now has 12 sows and 41 piglets along with an enormous warehouse which has the impressive capacity to house even more pigs.

Everyday Don Miguel works with his animals. His clients arrive directly to his house. "These animals have been my salvation for paying all the costs of my house and my children's education." 

This time he is asking for a loan in order to buy more pigs. Don Miguel has acquired a lot of experience and his earnings are good, nevertheless, he is in trouble when the food price rises. In some occasions he has had to borrow from the owner of the store where he buys feed in order to have tons of different types of food. Despite some difficulties, Don Miguel never stops trying to achieve his goals: to have a bigger warehouse, to have more animals, to balance his expenses and to someday stop asking for loans.

*The photograph was taken on the municipality stairs. Don Miguel is in the red sweater.*

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Choteje Group

texts.es:
El Grupo “Choteje” está integrado por personas mazahuas que aún conservan su legua, cultura y algunas tradiciones, viven en una comunidad pequeña, el cultivo más importante es el maíz que utilizan las amas de casa para elaborar las tradicionales tortillas para su hogar.

Ma Cristina es un poco seria pero es también una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 51 años y está casada con el señor Lorenzo. Hace años la pareja vivía en la capital del país y trabajaban en una central de abastos vendiendo frutas y verduras. Debido a que no contaban con una vivienda propia en la ciudad, tuvieron que regresar a su comunidad de origen donde fue más fácil construir una pequeña casa. Sin embargo, Cristina ya se había acostumbrado al ritmo de vida, a vender y a tener contacto con las personas así que decidió empezar a vender ropa. “Recuerdo que en esos tiempos la mercancía era muy barata, una prenda me costaba $25 pesos y mis ganancias eran muy buenas". tiempo después comenzó a vender dulces, refrescos y otras golosinas, más tarde algunos productos de abarrotes y así pasaron 10 años. Lamentablemente la tienda ya no es tan productiva por la competencia que hay en la región. 

Por lo anterior Cristina decidió solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund para comprar cerditos pequeños, alimento y algunas maderas para construir un corral. Cristina esta muy agradecida con el apoyo de VisionFund y KIVA porque gracias a los préstamos pudo mantener activa su tiendita y ahora esta por iniciar un nuevo negocio. “Necesito de más ingresos porque mi esposo está enfermo y algunos gastos no los cubre el seguro popular" comentó Cristina. 

El sueño de Doña Cristina es que sus animalitos crezcan y venderlos fácilmente en unos meses además no piensa abandonar su tienda de abarrotes y espera volver hacerla crecer.

Los integrantes del grupo son Ma de los Angeles quien invertirá en borregos; Alejandra, en tienda de abarrotes y Don Crescencio, en su invernadero.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio, en las escaleras del quiosco, Doña Cristina es quien viste un gabán mazahua*
texts.en:
The group "Choteje" is composed of Mazahua people who still conserve their language, culture, and some traditions. They live in a small community. The most important crop is corn which the housewives use to make traditional tortillas for your home.

Ma Christina is a bit serious but is also a very hardworking woman. She is 51 years old and is married to Mr. Lorenzo. For many years the couple has lived in the capital of the country and have worked in a supply center selling fruit and vegetables. Since they did not have their own housing in the city, they returned to their hometown where it was much easier to build a small house. However, Cristina had already become accustomed to the rhythm of that life; to sell and have contact with people. Therefore, she decided to begin to sell clothes. "I remember that in these times the merchandise was very cheap, a garment cost me 25 pesos and my earnings were very good." Awhile later she began to sell candy, refreshments, and other sweets. Later she added some grocery products and in this way passed 10 years. Unfortunately the store is not as productive anymore due to the competition in the area.

Due to the reasons above Cristina decided to ask for a loan from VisionFund in order to buy small pigs, feed, and some wood in order to build a corral. Cristina is very thankful for the help of VisionFund and Kiva because thanks to the loans she was able to maintain activity in her little store and now she is able to open a new business. "I need more income because my husband is sick and some costs are not covered by health insurance," said Cristina.

The dream of Mrs. Cristina is that her animals will grow and she will be able to sell them easily in a couple months. She also does not plan to abandon her grocery store and hopes to see it grow.

The other members of the group are Ma de los Angeles who will invest in calves, Alejandra who will invest in a grocery store, and Mr. Crescencio who will invest in his greenhouse.

*The photograph was taken in the municipality on the stairs of the kiosk. Mrs. Cristina is shown wearing a mazahua poncho.*

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is 42 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three dependents.  Lucila has been engaged in an e-loading and barbecue vending business for 10 years already. Their family is also earning support from her brother. She earns approximately PHP10,000 each month from doing this type of work; this amount is so helpful to meet their family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional construction materials for the finishing of their ongoing house construction. Lucila has been a member of PMPC for more than three years. In the future, Lucila hopes to expand her e-loading and barbecue vending business.

loans.use: To purchase sand, gravel and cement for finishing house construction

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан, 54 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Бурмакан среднее образование, 12 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 3 теленка, 5 лошадей, также земельный надел мерою 3,0 ГА, где Бурмакан выращивает люцерну, пшеницу и ячмень. Дети и супруг с радостью помогают Бурмакан в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный доход Бурмакан от ведения бизнеса около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 24 овец. Доходы от кредита Бурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит ей улучшить материальное положение ее семьи и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Burmakan is 54 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture for the past 12 years.  She currently has three cows, three calves and five horses on her farm, as well as three hectares of land on which she grows alfalfa, wheat and barley.  Her children and husband are happy to help her run the business.  Burmakan also has everything necessary to raise livestock.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS) from her business.

Burmakan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som to buy 24 sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase the size of her herd, which will allow her to improve the material situation of her family and to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase 24 sheep in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La socia Rosaura pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía y venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a sus negocios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the communal bank APU KCAMER.  She alternates her daily activities with her craft business and selling fruit.  For quite some time she has been in business thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day.  Her goal is to continue working to support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy sweaters and other items.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy sweaters and other items.

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es: Pedro de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de yuca desde hace 6 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona de donde reside, tiene clientes ya  establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así poder seguir con sus cultivos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro, 41, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  For six years he has been growing yucca which he sells to steady customers around where he lives.  He is able to cover some of the household expenses with the income from sales.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manures, pest control agents and herbicides, and to improve the land shown in the photograph.  This is so he can continue his crop growing activity and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, herbicides and to improve the land.

loans.name: Doris Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Doris Antonia  pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER,la socia continua  dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo arroz,azucar,leche entre otros productos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aceite, arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
Doris Antonia belongs to the communal bank APU KCAMER and she continues to work on her grocery store business.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.  She still sells rice, sugar, milk and other products and wishes to continue working to support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy oil, rice and other goods.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, la joven vive en  casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas plátanos por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman's face is blurred because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She sells bananas at the municipal market and has many steady customers.  She is able to get ahead with the income from sales and she lives in her own house with her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more banans wholesale to continue her sales activity and earn more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy bananas wholesale.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas hace 18 años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas agrícolas para implementar su negocio, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maximo, 38, lives with his common-law wife in his own house in the rural district of Oyotun which is in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

For 18 years he has worked in agricultural services.  He has experience in the business and very good personal and work references.  The loan he is requesting is to buy farm tools for his business.  This will help keep his tools in good condition and give him a better image in order to improve customer service, all of which will have an impact on his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy farm tools for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start pig farming

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married and works hard to support her family. Melanie is 46 years old.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Melanie is borrowing PHP 37,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through the past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Khoe

texts.en: Khoe would like to take out another loan to buy more beverages to sell from her stall. Khoe's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to sell.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en: Abdumanon is a kind man who is married and has one child. He has always wanted to provide good living conditions for his family, so he works hard every day from early morning until late evening. Abdumanon is a master of repairing houses and has been busy with this business for more than five years. Abdumanon plans to buy a car to transport the building materials he uses in his business. He is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to buy a car. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a car for use in his business

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan to buy more rice to sell in her store. Mai's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, and a tape measure.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a new client to UGAFODE Microfinance. He didn’t attend school to reach higher levels because he lost his parents at an early age and could not get someone to help him. 

He is married and has two children. He deals in coffee trade as his major source of income, a business he has done for over seven years. However, he also deals in local gin to supplement his income.  

He applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy coffee. This will help him to expand his business and earn more profits. 

Kenneth hopes to grow his business and achieve his dream to educate his children and meet his entire family's financial obligation by using the loan and sustaining his business. Kenneth thanks UGAFODE for the financial support that is extended to low income earners.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Kukaa

texts.en:
Kukaa is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality.

With the loan of 35,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ramona Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Virgen De La Merced  se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive  la señora Ramona, tiene 33 años, está casada y  de esta relación tiene tres hijos, de 15, 9 y 2 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en el colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Ramona se dedica a la cría de chanchos en una pequeña granja en su casa, ella en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de chanchos los cuales los cría durante cuatro a seis meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa o también vende por libras a vecinos de su localidad. También vende ropa, la venta de ropa la realiza en la tarde  puerta  a puerta,  deja a crédito y cobra por semanas. Lleva 3 años en esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para  los chanchos y ropa. Lleva 2  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: The  Virgen De La Merced Credit Group meets fortnightly in the city of Manta, famous for its beautiful beaches which attract large numbers of visitors at all times of years, its fine food and its unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. It id here that 33-year-old Ramona lives. She is married with three children of 15, 9 and 2 years of age, the oldest one studying at secondary school and the youngest at primary school. He husband is a driver. Ramona raises pigs in a small farm at her home. At certain times of year, she buys a large number of pigs which she raises for four to six months, until they are ready to be sold. She then hands them over to traders who come to her home or sells them by the pound to neighbours. She also sells clothing door to door during the afternoon, leaving goods on credit and then charging for it weekly. She has been running this business for 3 years and it allows her to earn her own living with which to support her family. She will use this loan to buy food and medicines for her pigs and also to buy clothing. She has been a member of the Credit group for 2 years and she likes it because it has helped her a great deal. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy and  food and medicine for the pigs and also clothes.

loans.name: Etelina

texts.en:
Etelina is 33 years old. She owns and operates a small business of selling ice cake in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Etelina has requested a loan to buy ice bags, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, and containers to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. Etelina joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy ice bags, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags and containers.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en: Phuoc would like to take a further loan to buy more parts to repair his customers' motorbikes. Phuoc's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorbike parts to repair his customers' motorbikes.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung would like to take a further loan to buy more bread and meat to sell from her stall. Dung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of bread and meat to sell.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen would like to take a further loan to buy new furniture, noodles and spices to make food to sell from her stall. 

Duyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture, noodles and spices to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang would like to take a further loan to buy rice, sugar, and soft drinks to sell from her store. Sang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and soft drinks to sell from her store.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 32-year-old married man. He owns and operates a kitchenware business where he works for at least eight hours a day. He has another lucrative source of income, which is rentals located in Ishaka on a major street. 

He started his business in 2006 to have a source of income as a young man who was jobless. This is his second loan from the institution and he is borrowing UGX 5,000,000 to buy stock. He has clients from all walks of life since kitchenware is used in every home. He hopes to be financially stable but he says that his main challenge is that competition is very stiff. He also has challenges of some of his items breaking since most of them are fragile,(glasses, cups, plates, jars, etc.).
 
He is grateful for the financial boost from Kiva lenders through UGAFODE and is committed to repay well to grow the partnership.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es: Ramón de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) dese hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fungicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para tener una mejor cosecha y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ramón, 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked growing basic grains (corn and beans) for the past 20 years. He sells his products in nearby towns. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to pay for some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, fungicides and improve the land that is shown in the photograph, in order to have a better harvest in this way be able to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace varios años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, gracias a su trabajo y a la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, maíz y demás ingredientes para poder seguir con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area, has worked selling pupusas for a number of years. Her business is located in her home. Thanks to her work and her husband's help, they manage to get ahead. The young woman lives in her own house with her husband. She is asking for a loan to purchase cracklings, beans, quesillo, corn, and other ingredients to be able to continue on with her work and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase cracklings, beans, quesillo [fresh cheese], corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es:
Oscar, sigue desempeñando trabajos agrícolas, las cosechas son mayores, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo,  los ingresos son estables y han incrementado por la buena administración del préstamo anterior.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar dos terneros para repasto, aumentara el ganado que ya tiene y obtendrá mejores ingresos al comercializarlos cuando ya estén más grandes.
texts.en: Oscar continues going about his agricultural work. His harvests are better, his family remains  the same. His income is stable and has increase due to the good administration of the previous loan. He has decided to take another loan to buy two calves to increase the cattle he has. He will get more income selling them when they are bigger.

loans.use: to buy two calves to increase the number of cattle he has and to make more money selling them when they are bigger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad  y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en un zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hija de 5 años, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated is 23 years old, and she lives in a high risk area.  She has been selling clothes for five years.  Her business is located close to her house in a heavily traveled area.  With what she gets from her sales she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  She is a single mother, and she lives in her own house with her five year old daughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes wholesale.  She will do this in order to be able to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima -Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSA DE LIMA - URUBAMBA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Beatriz tiene 53 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de carnes, aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la carpintería, limpieza, venta de comida, venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "SANTA ROSA DE LIMA - URUBAMBA" communal bank which is located in the district of Urubamba, Urubamba province, Cusco department..

Beatriz is 53 years old is single and has 3 children. She combines her daily activities with her business selling food. She has been running this business for quite some time and things are going well thanks to the determination that she brings to her work each day. She wants to continue to work and in this way continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, oil, rice amongst others. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the established installments. The other members work in carpentry, cleaning selling food and the sales of shoes.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, and rice amongst others.

loans.name: Sandra Nataly

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de pastelería y panadería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, tiene clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de materiales de cocina y capacitación en cursos de repostería y pastelería, con esto Sandra espera mejorar la calidad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 27, is single and lives with her family in the Nueva Africa district.  It is a rural area located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  Life in the community is peaceful.  The population works mainly in agriculture and raising animals.

She provides pastry making and bakery services.  She has her own tools and over five years of experience in the business.  She has fixed customers who provide very good personal and work references for her.

She is requesting a loan to buy cooking materials and for training in courses about pastry making and making cakes.  With this Sandra hopes to improve the quality of her services.  This way she will be able to tend to the diverse needs of her customers in the area.  This will generate greater earnings.  As a result, she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking materials and for training in courses about pastry making and making cakes.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín tiene 4 hijos, él vive junto a su esposa en una de las comunidades de Sololá, él tiene 54 años de edad.
Martín es un hombre responsable muy perseverante, que le gusta convivir con la naturaleza, y le encanta la agricultura, en el lugar donde vive Martín mucha gente se dedica a este trabajo, Martín normalmente siembra frijol, güicoy, cebolla entre otras hortalizas. Una de las metas que se ha propuesto Martín para este año, es incrementar más el volumen de  su siembra, ya que conseguido estos espacios para siembra, él tiene la capacidad física para hacerlo, ya que su esposa también lo apoya con mano de obra en las épocas de cosecha.
 Pero uno de las militantes de Martín es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para la compra de semillas, abono orgánico y otros insumos,  él está interesado en conseguir un préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y todo lo necesario para su cultivo. El gran sueño de Martín es conseguir el préstamo y así poder ampliar más su cultivo.
texts.en:
Martín has 4 children and he lives with his wife in one of the communities of Sololá. He is 54 years old. Martín is a responsible and very persevering man. He likes to live with nature and he loves agriculture. In the place where Martín lives many people do this work.

Martín usually grows beans, squash, onions amongst other vegetables. One of the goals that Martín proposes for this year is to increase the volume of his planting as he has acquired the space to grow and he has the physical capacity to do it. His wife also helps him with the labor during harvest time. But one of the factors against him is that he doesn't have enough money to buy the seeds, manure and other materials that he needs. He is interested in getting a loan to invest in the purchase of seed and all that is needed for his crops. Martín's big dream is to get the loan and be able to expand his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like seeds, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Aida Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda vive en municipio muy pintoresco con una gran historia, conocido como Pueblo Mágico (nombre con el que se conoce a distintas ciudades coloniales del país). Anteriormete, en este lugar se extraía oro y ahora ya solo quedan algunas de las rutas por donde transportaban el mineral. Un pequeño vagón abandonado ahora es utilizado como restaurante. 

Doña Yolanda está orgullosa de pertenecer a un lugar así, sus vecinos le dicen de cariño Doña Yola y es una mujer extraordinaria, ejemplo de muchos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Yola tiene 50 años de edad está casada con Alejandro y tiene dos hijos que vivien en Estados Unidos.

Yola tiene una pequeña estética, que le costó bastante esfuerzo iniciar, pero actualmente es uno de los mejores salones de belleza de la zona. Hace años también comenzó a rentar cuartos a estudiantes y maestros ya que el Pueblo Mágico alberga varias universidades importantes del país. Lo que comenzó como un lugar con habitaciones muy pequeñas ahora ha mejorado gracias a los préstamos de VisionFund y Kiva. Los cuartos ya cuentan con cocineta, baño y el espacio para la cama.

Doña Yola necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más material de construcción como grava, arena, cemento y varilla para poder ampliar uno de los estudios que aún no termina. Ella está muy contenta porque ha logrado construir 10 estudios los cuales están rentados. “Afortunadamente me va muy bien, mis inquilinos están muy contentos y para mí eso es muy importante” comentó muy sonriente Doña Yola. Sus ganancias le han permitido darse varios gustos como ahora que se encuentra estudiando gastronomía que siempre fue uno de sus sueños pero no había sido posible llevarlo a cabo porque sus hijos estudiaban.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la construcción donde Yola planea levantar dos cuartos más. Al fondo se puede apreciar una parte de la iglesia del municipio*
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in a very colorful municipality with a large history know as Pueblo Mágico (Magic City, a name given to several colonial cities in the country). They used to mine gold in this place and today only a few of the transportation routes for the gold still exist. A small abandoned wagon serves today as a restaurant.

Yolanda is proud to belong to a place like this. Her neighbors call her Yola as a term of affection. She is an extraordinary woman, an example for many to improve their quality of living. Yola is 50 years old and is married to Alejandro and has two children who live in the United States. Yola has a small beauty salon that was a lot of work to open but now is one of the best beauty salons in the area.

Some years ago she also started to rent rooms to students and teachers as Pueblo Magico houses several important universities of the country. What started as a place with very small rooms has improved thanks to the loans from VisionFund and KIva. The rooms now have a kitchen, bathroom and space for a bed.

Yola needs a new loan to be able to buy more construction material like gravel, sand, cement and re-bar to be able to expand one of the studios that she has not finished. She is very happy as she has been able to build 10 studios that are rented. "Fortunately things are going well for me, my renters are happy and this is important for me', she commented Yola with a big smile.

Her profits have allowed her to fulfill various wishes as now she is studying gastronomy that was always one of her dreams that she could not do as her children were studying. The photograph was taken at the construction site where Yola plans to erect two more rooms. In the background you can see part of the Municipal church.

loans.use: to buy construction material like gravel, sand, cement and re-bar.

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мира, 46 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Миры среднее образование, она много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Миры на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 5 овец. На участке мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает фасоль. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS), на покупку 2 коров и 5 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также хочет накопить на образование ее внуков.
texts.en: Mira is 46, married and has two children. She has a secondary education and has been raising livestock and planting crops for many years. Thanks to her hard work, Mira currently has three cows and five sheep. She grows beans on a 3.0 hectare plot of land and earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy two cows and five sheep. She plans to use her profits to continue expanding her business and to save up for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and five sheep in order to increase her number of livestock
